Name: The Prancing Pony (P)
Text: Fellowship: Add a burden to play Aragorn from your draw deck.

Name: Bill the Pony (P)
Notes: Lists: ERL, MXL. When the fellowship moves with Bill the Pony to an underground site, the Shadow number of that site is reduced before Bill the Pony is discarded.
Text: Bearer must be a Hobbit companion. The Shadow number of each site is -1. Discard Bill the Pony if he is at an underground site during the fellowship or regroup phase.

Name: Fireworks (P)
Text: Spell. Fellowship: Spot Gandalf to shuffle up to 2 [GANDALF] or up to 2 [SHIRE] cards from your discard pile into your draw deck.

Name: Council Courtyard (P)
Text: Sanctuary. When the fellowship moves from Council Courtyard, remove [2].

Name: Horn of Boromir (P)
Text: Bearer must be Boromir. Maneuver: Exert Boromir and spot an ally. Until the regroup phase, that ally is strength +3 and participates in archery fire and skirmishes.

Name: Balin's Tomb (P)
Text: Underground. Maneuver: Discard a tale from play or from hand to heal your companion.

Name: Book of Mazarbul (P)
Text: Tale. Bearer must be a Dwarf. At the start of each fellowship phase when the fellowship is at site 4 or higher, you may draw a card for each Dwarf companion.

Name: Galadriel's Glade (P)
Text: Sanctuary. Fellowship: Exert an Elf to look at an opponent's hand.

Name: Phial of Galadriel (P)
Text: To play, exert an Elf. Bearer must be the Ring-bearer. Bearer's resistance is +2.

Name: The Balrog, Durin's Bane (P)
Text: Damage +1. Fierce. While you can spot The Balrog, discard all other minions. Skip the archery phase. Discard The Balrog if not underground.

Name: Saruman, Servant of the Eye (P)
Text: Saruman may not take wounds during the archery phase and may not be assigned to a skirmish. Assignment: Exert Saruman to assign an [ISENGARD] minion to a companion (except the Ring-bearer). That companion may exert to prevent this.

Name: Gimli, Son of Gloin (P)
Text: Damage +1. Skirmish: Exert Gimli to make him strength +2.

Name: Legolas, Greenleaf (P)
Text: Archer. Archery: Exert Legolas to wound a minion
column19: Legolas does not add to the fellowship archery total.

Name: Aragorn, Ranger of the North (P)
Text: Ranger. Maneuver: Exert Aragorn to make him defender +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Legolas, Son of Thranduil (P)
Text: Archer. While Legolas is at a river or forest, add 1 to the fellowship archery total.

Name: Faramir, Son of Denethor (P)
Text: Ring-bound. Ranger. An opponent may not play skirmish events or use skirmish special abilities during skirmishes involving Faramir.

Name: Eowyn, Lady of Rohan (P)
Text: Valiant. Response: If an unbound companion is about to take a wound, exert Eowyn and add [1] to prevent that wound.

Name: Smeagol, Old Noser (P)
Text: Ring-bound. To play add a burden. Regroup: Exert Smeagol (or Gollum) twice to reveal the top 4 cards of your draw deck. Wound a minion for each Shadow card revealed. Place those 4 cards beneath your draw deck in any order.

Name: Theoden, King of the Golden Hall (P)
Text: Valiant. Maneuver: Play a [ROHAN] possession on Theoden to heal a [ROHAN] ally.

Name: Black Rider (P)
Text: Fierce. This minion is strength +1 for each companion you can spot.

Name: Treebeard, Guardian of the Forest (P)
Text: Unhasty. Assignment: Exert an unbound Hobbit to allow Treebeard to skirmish. Skirmish: Exert Treebeard to make an Ent damage +1.

Name: Fell Beast (P)
Text: To play, discard 2 cards from hand. Bearer must be a Nazgul. Bearer is fierce.

Name: Aragorn, Captain of Gondor (P)
Text: Knight. At the start of each fellowship phase, you may add [2] to heal another [GONDOR] companion.

Name: Legolas, Elven Stalwart (P)
Text: Archer. While you can spot 3 wounded minions, each minion skirmishing Legolas is strength -3.

Name: Denethor, Wizened Steward (P)
Text: Denethor is strength +1 for each other [GONDOR] Man you can spot (limit +4).

Name: Gandalf, Defender of the West (P)
Text: While you cannot spot 3 companions of the same culture, Gandalf is strength -2.

Name: Frodo, Resolute Hobbit (P)
Text: Ring-bearer (resistance 12).

Name: Arwen, Fair Elf Maiden (P)
Text: While skirmishing a fierce minion, Arwen is strength +3.

Name: Eowyn, Dernhelm (P)
Text: Valiant. While skirmishing a mounted minion, Eowyn is strength +2. While skirmishing a fierce minion, Eowyn is strength +2.

Name: The Balrog, Terror of Flame and Shadow (P)
Text: Damage +2. The twilight cost of The Balrog is -3 if you can spot a [MORIA] minion. The Balrog cannot be assigned to skirmish companions or allies of strength less than 6.

Name: The Pale Blade (P)
Text: Bearer must be The Witch-king. He is damage +1. Response: If The Witch-king wins a skirmish, exert him to discard a Free Peoples condition.

Name: Gandalf, Mithrandir (P)
Text: Damage +1. Each time the fellowship moves, wound Gandalf.

Name: Firefoot (P)
Text: Bearer must be a [ROHAN] Man. If bearer is Eomer, he is defender +1. At the start of each skirmish involving bearer, each minion skirmishing bearer must exert.

Name: Gimli's Helm (P)
Text: Bearer must be Gimli. He takes no more than 1 wound during each skirmish phase. Skirmish: Discard Gimli's Helm to prevent all wounds to him.

Name: Faramir, Captain of Gondor (P)
Text: Ring-bound. Ranger. The twilight cost of each other [GONDOR] Man in your starting fellowship is -1. While skirmishing a roaming minion, Faramir is strength +2.

Name: Whip of Many Thongs (P)
Text: Bearer must be The Balrog. Skirmish: Exert The Balrog to discard a helm, shield, or armor borne by a character The Balrog is skirmishing.

Name: The Witch-king, Lord of the Nazgul (P)
Text: Twilight. Return to Its Master may not be played. Each time The Witch-king wins a skirmish, you may exert him to wound the Ring-bearer twice.

Name: Gandalf's Staff, Walking Stick (P)
Text: Bearer must be Gandalf. While you can spot 2 twilight tokens, Gandalf is damage +2.

Name: Eowyn, Sister-daughter of Theoden (P)
Text: Valiant. Response: If Eowyn is exhausted and about to take a wound in a skirmish, discard 2 cards from hand to prevent that wound.

Name: Axe of Erebor (P)
Text: Bearer must be Gimli. He is damage +1. Skirmish: Discard a [DWARVEN] condition or a card stacked on a [DWARVEN] condition to make Gimli strength +1.

Name: Aragorn's Bow (P)
Text: Bearer must be Aragorn. He is an archer. Archery: Exert Aragorn to wound a minion
column19: Aragorn does not add to the fellowship archery total.

Name: The Balrog's Sword (P)
Text: Bearer must be The Balrog. It is damage +1. This weapon may be borne in addition to 1 other hand weapon.

Name: Ulaire Nelya, Ringwraith in Twilight (P)
Text: Twilight. While you can spot 2 burdens or 2 wounds on the Ring-bearer, Ulaire Nelya is fierce and damage +1.

Name: Glamdring, Lightning Brand (P)
Text: Bearer must be Gandalf. He is damage +1. Each time you play a spell during a skirmish, you may make Gandalf damage +1 until the end of that skirmish.

Name: Eomer, Third Marshal of Riddermark (P)
Text: While you can spot a [ROHAN] Man, Eomer's twilight cost is -1. Eomer is strength +2 for each wound on each minion he is skirmishing.

Name: Gimli, Skilled Defender (P)
Text: Damage +1. Each time Gimli wins a skirmish, you may wound a minion assigned to skirmish an unbound companion.

Name: Aragorn, Defender of Free Peoples (P)
Text: Skirmish: Remove an [ELVEN] token to make a minion skirmishing Aragorn strength -3. Skirmish: Remove a [DWARVEN] token to heal a Dwarf. Regroup: If Aragorn is mounted, remove a [ROHAN] token to wound a minion twice.

Name: Shelob, Last Child of Ungoliant (P)
Text: Enduring. Fierce. While in a fierce skirmish, Shelob is damage +1.

Name: Eomer, Keeper of Oaths (P)
Text: Valiant. When you play Eomer (except in your starting fellowship), you may reveal the top 10 cards of your draw deck and play all [ROHAN] possessions revealed. Shuffle your draw deck.

Name: Glorfindel, Revealed in Wrath (P)
Text: When Glorfindel is in your starting fellowship, his twilight cost is -2. Skirmish: Reveal the top card of your draw deck. You may exert Glorfindel to make a Nazgul he is skirmishing strength -X, where X is the twilight cost of the card revealed.

Name: Radagast, The Brown (P)
Text: The move limit is +1. Each time the fellowship moves during the regroup phase, each opponent may discard 2 cards from hand to draw 2 cards.

Name: Goldberry, River-daughter (P)
Text: Each time the fellowship moves to a river, heal Goldberry and Tom Bombadil. Skirmish: If the fellowship is at a river, exert Goldberry to make a companion strength +1.

Name: Tom Bombadil, The Master (P)
Text: To play, remove 2 burdens or 2 threats. Skirmish: Spot 2 [SHIRE] companions and exert Tom Bombadil X times, where X is the fellowship's site number, to cancel a skirmish involving a [SHIRE] companion.

Name: Sauron, The Lord of the Rings (P)
Text: Damage +2. Enduring. Fierce. For each burden you spot, threat you spot, and site you control, Sauron's twilight cost is -1.

Name: Gorgoroth Swarm (P)
Text: Besieger. When you play this minion, if you can spot another besieger, you may spot 6 companions to play a besieger from your discard pile and control a site.

Name: Ghan-buri-Ghan, Chieftain of the Woses (P)
Text: While you can spot 2 other Men, Ghan-buri-Ghan cannot be overwhelmed unless his strength is tripled. While at a forest site, Ghan-buri-Ghan is defender +1.

Name: Radagast's Staff (P)
Text: Bearer must be Radagast. Each time the fellowship moves during the regroup phase, you may draw 2 cards.

Name: Anarion, Lord of Anorien (P)
Text: Skirmish: Play a [GONDOR] skirmish event to make each minion skirmishing Anarion strength -X, where X is Anarion's vitality.

Name: Erkenbrand, Master of Westfold (P)
Text: If you can spot a [ROHAN] Man, you may play Erkenbrand any time you could play a skirmish event. When you play Erkenbrand, you may discard a Shadow possession.

Name: Tom Bombadil's Hat (P)
Text: To play, spot 2 [SHIRE] companions. Each time a Shadow card adds a burden or a threat, add a [SHIRE] token here. Fellowship: Remove 2 [SHIRE] tokens from here to remove a burden.

Name: The Witch-king, Black Captain (P)
Text: Enduring. Each Man skirmishing The Witch-king loses all strength bonuses from weapons.

Name: Gimli, Dwarven Delegate (P)
Text: Damage +1.

Name: Arwen, Maiden of Rivendell (P)
Text: Ranger. Skirmish: Exert Arwen to make a minion skirmishing an Elf strength -2.

Name: Boromir, Steward's Heir (P)
Text: Knight. Ranger. Ring-bound.

Name: Eomer, Forthwith Banished (P)
Text: Damage +1. Valiant. While you can spot a [ROHAN] Man, Eomer's twilight cost is -1.

Name: Frodo, Mr. Underhill (P)
Text: Ring-bearer (Resistance 10). The twilight cost of each artifact, possession, and [SHIRE] tale played on Frodo is -1.

Name: The One Ring, The Binding Ring (P)
Text: Fellowship: Add 2 burdens to play a ring from your draw deck. Maneuver: Exert bearer to wear The One Ring until the regroup phase. While wearing The One Ring, each time the Ring-bearer is about to take a wound, add a burden instead.

Name: Nocked (P)
Text: Exert an Elf who has resistance 4 or more to wound a minion.

Name: Gandalf, Leader of the Company (P)
Text: While Gandalf is in region 1, each other companion is strength +2. While Gandalf is in region 2, each companion is strength +1. While Gandalf is in region 3, he is strength +2.

Name: Boromir, Hero of Osgiliath (P)
Text: Knight. Each time Boromir wins a skirmish, you may heal a [GONDOR] companion.

Name: Bow of Minas Tirith (P)
Text: Bearer must be a [GONDOR] Man. At the start of the archery phase, if bearer is at a battleground site, you may exert him or her to make the fellowship archery total +1.

Name: Armored Easterling (P)
Text: Skirmish: Remove [2] to make a lurker strength +1. Skirmish: Remove [2] to make a lurker fierce until the regroup phase. Skirmish: Remove [2] to make a lurker damage +1.

Name: Poleaxe (P)
Text: Bearer must be a [MEN] minion. Skirmish: Remove [2] to make a [MEN] minion fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Champion Orc (P)
Text: Toil 2. (For each [ORC] character you exert when playing this, its twilight cost is -2.)

Name: Spurred to Battle (P)
Text: To play, exert an [ORC] minion. At the start of the Shadow phase, add [1].

Name: Riders of the Mark (P)
Text: To play, spot 2 [ROHAN] companions. You may play Riders of the Mark any time you could play a skirmish event. When you play Riders of the Mark, you may exhaust a minion.

Name: Sam, Steadfast Friend (P)
Text: Ring-bound. Each other companion is resistance +1.

Name: Arwen, Staunch Defender (P)
Text: Each minion skirmishing Arwen is strength -1 for each forest site on the adventure path.

Name: Eomer, Eored Leader (P)
Text: While you can spot a [ROHAN] Man, Eomer's twilight cost is -1. Maneuver: If you can spot more minions than companions, exert Eomer to play a [ROHAN] companion from your draw deck.

Name: Ulaire Toldea, Black Shadow (P)
Text: Fierce. When you play Ulaire Toldea, you may exert him to take a [RINGWRAITH] event from your discard pile into hand.

Name: The Witch-king's Beast, Fell Creature (P)
Text: Bearer must be a Nazgul. If bearer is The Witch-king, after all skirmishes and fierce skirmishes have been resolved, you may exert him twice to make him participate in one additional assignment and skirmish phase.

Name: Ulaire Attea, Second of the Nine Riders (P)
Text: Fierce. Each time Ulaire Attea is assigned to a fierce skirmish involving a character who has resistance 4 or less, you may exert Ulaire Attea to add a burden.

Name: Sting, Weapon of Heritage (P)
Text: Bearer must be Bilbo, Frodo, or Sam. Maneuver: If bearer is Bilbo or Frodo, exert him to make another companion resistance +2 until the regroup phase. If bearer is Sam, each time he wins a skirmish, you may remove a burden.

Name: Olog-Hai Bestial (P)
Text: Degats +1. Acharne. Pour jouer, designez un seide [ORC]. Affectation : Affaiblissez ce seide pour l'affecter a un compagnon qui detient un artefact. Le joueur des Peuples Libres peut defausser un artefact en jeu pour prevenir ceci.

Name: Pippin, Brave Decoy (P)
Text: Skirmish: If Pippin is not assigned to a skirmish, spot an unbound companion who has less resistance than Pippin to have Pippin replace him or her in a skirmish.

Name: Legolas, Companion of the Ring (P)
Text: While Legolas is at a battleground or forest site, he is strength +2 and resistance +2.

Name: Eowyn, Shieldmaiden of Rohan (P)
Text: Each time Eowyn wins a skirmish, each other [ROHAN] Man is strength +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Jarnsmid, Barding Emissary (P)
Text: At the start of each skirmish involving Jarnsmid, you may remove a burden (or 2 burdens if you can spot another [GANDALF] companion).

Name: Vapour and Steam (P)
Text: Skirmish: Exert your [GANDALF] companion and add a burden to make that companion damage +1.

Name: Massing Strength (P)
Text: Discard any number of your [ORC] minions from play to make an [ORC] minion strength +3 for each one discarded.

Name: Morgul Tormentor (P)
Text: Each time the Free Peoples player assigns this minion to skirmish an unwounded companion, he or she must add a burden or discard a card from hand.

Name: Farmer Maggot, Hobbit of the Marish (P)
Text: While Farmer Maggot is at a dwelling or forest site, he is strength +4.

Name: Mithril-coat, Dwarf-mail (P)
Text: Bearer must be a Ring-bound Hobbit. Each minion skirmishing bearer loses all damage bonuses. Skirmish: Exert bearer to make each minion he is skirmishing lose fierce and unable to gain fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Saruman, Agent of the Dark Lord (P)
Text: Lurker. (Skirmishes involving lurker minions must be resolved after any others.) Skirmish: Exert Saruman to make an [URUK-HAI] minion strength +2. Each time a companion is killed, you may heal Saruman.

Name: Keening Wail (P)
Text: Toil 2. (For each [RINGWRAITH] character you exert when playing this, its twilight cost is -2.) Spot a Nazgul to add a burden.

Name: Ulaire Nelya, Third of the Nine Riders (P)
Text: Fierce. Shadow: Exert Ulaire Nelya to replace the fellowship's current site with a site from your adventure deck.

Name: Ulaire Lemenya, Black Enemy (P)
Text: When you play Ulaire Lemenya, you may play a [RINGWRAITH] mount from your discard pile.

Name: Ulaire Nelya, Black Hunter (P)
Text: Fierce. Each time Ulaire Nelya wins a skirmish, you may draw a card.

Name: The Mouth of Sauron, Messenger of Mordor (P)
Text: Maneuver: Exert The Mouth of Sauron to play a [MEN] condition or [MEN] possession from your draw deck.

Name: Orophin, Brother of Haldir (P)
Text: While Orophin is at a forest site and you can spot another Elf, Orophin is an archer.

Name: Grima, Footman of Saruman (P)
Text: Lurker. (Skirmishes involving lurker minions must be resolved after any others.) Each time a Free Peoples character is killed, you may spot another [MEN] minion to exert each companion.

Name: Ulaire Otsea, Zwarte Schim (P)
Text: Shadow: Exert Ulaire Otsea and discard a [RINGWRAITH] condition from hand to discard a Free Peoples condition from play.

Name: Saruman, Of Many Colours (P)
Text: Damage +1. Fierce. Lurker. (Skirmishes involving lurker minions must be resolved after any others.) When you play Saruman, name a culture. Each companion of the named culture is strength -1.

Name: Ulaire Otsea, Seventh of the Nine Riders (P)
Text: When you play Ulaire Otsea, you may spot a companion who has X wounds to reveal the top X cards of your draw deck. Take each [RINGWRAITH] card revealed this way into hand.

Name: Hama, Captain of the King's Guard (P)
Text: Hama is strength +1 for each Shadow possession you can spot. Each time Hama wins a skirmish, you may discard a possession from play.

Name: Guard of the White Tree (P)
Text: Knight. Skirmish: Discard a [GONDOR] condition from your support area to make this companion strength +2.

Name: The Witch-king, Captain of the Nine Riders (P)
Text: Fierce. Toil 2. (For each [RINGWRAITH] character you exert when playing this, its twilight cost is -2.) Muster. (At the start of the regroup phase, you may discard a card from hand to draw a card.)

Name: Ulaire Attea, Second of the Nine Riders (P)
Text: Fierce. Each time Ulaire Attea is assigned to a fierce skirmish involving a character who has resistance 4 or less, you may exert Ulaire Attea to add a burden.

Name: Ulaire Nelya, Third of the Nine Riders (P)
Text: Fierce. Shadow: Exert Ulaire Nelya to replace the fellowship's current site with a site from your adventure deck.

Name: Ulaire Cantea, Fourth of the Nine Riders (P)
Text: While Ulaire Cantea is at a forest or dwelling site, he is strength +2 and fierce.

Name: Ulaire Lemenya, Fifth of the Nine Riders (P)
Text: Each character skirmishing Ulaire Lemenya who has resistance 5 or less is strength -3.

Name: Ulaire Enquea, Sixth of the Nine Riders (P)
Text: Fierce. When you play Ulaire Enquea, if you can spot 2 other Nazgul, you may exert 2 unbound companions (or exert each companion if you can spot 6 companions).

Name: Ulaire Otsea, Seventh of the Nine Riders (P)
Text: When you play Ulaire Otsea, you may spot a companion who has X wounds to reveal the top X cards of your draw deck. Take each [RINGWRAITH] card revealed this way into hand.

Name: Ulaire Toldea, Eighth of the Nine Riders (P)
Text: Fierce. Each time Ulaire Toldea wins a skirmish, you may play the fellowship's next site.

Name: Ulaire Nertea, Ninth of the Nine Riders (P)
Text: Lurker. (Skirmishes involving lurker minions must be resolved after any others.) While Ulaire Nertea is at a forest site, he is strength +2. While you can spot 6 companions, each Nazgul is strength +2.

Name: Faramir, Prince of Ithilien (P)
Text: While you can spot Boromir, Faramir is twilight cost -1. While you can spot Denethor, Faramir is twilight cost -1. While Faramir bears a [GONDOR] possession, he is defender +1.

Name: Eowyn, Restless Warrior (P)
Text: Each possession you play on Eowyn during the fellowship phase is twilight cost -1. Each time the fellowship moves during the regroup phase, you may reinforce a [ROHAN] token (or reinforce 2 [ROHAN] tokens if you can spot Eomer or Theoden).

Name: Isildur, Heir of Elendil (P)
Text: Knight. Isildur is resistance +1 for each card in your hand. At the end of any phase, if Isildur has resistance 0, place him in your dead pile. Each time you reconcile, you may draw a card.

Name: Isengard Marauder (P)
Text: To play, discard 3 cards from your hand. While you can spot 2 other [ORC] minions, this minion is fierce.

Name: Covetous Uruk (P)
Text: Damage +1. This minion is strength +1 for each possession you spot.

Name: Haldir, Sentry of the Golden Wood (P)
Notes: The Hunters Release. Scan courtesy of HawkeyeSPF.
Text: To play, spot an Elf. While the fellowship is at a battleground site, Haldir is strength +2. While the fellowship is at a forest site, Haldir is an archer.

Name: Gimli, Eager Hunter (P)
Notes: dAgent Exclusive. Scan courtesy of HawkeyeSPF.
Text: Damage +1. Hunter 3. (While skirmishing a non-hunter character, this character is strength +3.)

Name: Legolas, Fleet-footed Hunter (P)
Notes: dAgent Exclusive. Scan courtesy of HawkeyeSPF.
Text: Hunter 1. (While skirmishing a non-hunter character, this character is strength +1.) Regroup: Exert 2 hunter companions to draw a card.

Name: Aragorn, Swift Hunter (P)
Notes: dAgent Exclusive. Scan courtesy of HawkeyeSPF.
Text: Ranger. Hunter 1. (While skirmishing a non-hunter character, this character is strength +1.) Skirmish: Exert Aragorn to make a hunter companion strength +1.

Name: Lurtz, Now Perfected (P)
Notes: Tournament Director Exclusive. Scan courtesy of HawkeyeSPF.
Text: Damage +1. Each time Lurtz wins a skirmish, the Free People's player must exert X companions, where X is the current region number.

Name: Aragorn, Defender of Rohan (P)
Notes: dAgent Exclusive. Scan courtesy of HawkeyeSPF.
Text: Valiant. While the Ring-bearer is assigned to a skirmish, each [ROHAN] companion gains hunter 1.

Name: Primitive Brand (P)
Text: Bearer must be a [MEN] minion. Each time bearer wins a skirmish you may transfer this possession to another [MEN] minion. If you do, stack a [MEN] minion from play on a [MEN] possession in your support area.

Name: Watcher at Sarn Ford, Ranger of the North (P)
Notes: dAgent exclusive. Scan courtesy of HawkeyeSPF.
Text: Ranger. Skirmish: Exert a [GONDOR] Man with a resistance 6 or more to make that Man strength +3.

Name: Faramir, Captain of Ithilien (AFD)
Notes: April Fool's Day Joke Card. No physical card exists.
Text: Ranger. Hunter 2. When you play Faramir, Shadow players cannot play minions until the end of the turn. The move limit is +2.

Name: Buckland Homestead (D)
Text: Dwelling. Shadow: Play a Nazgul to discard a condition from play.

Name: Caras Galadhon (D)
Text: Forest. No more than 1 minion can be assigned to each skirmish.

Name: Cavern Entrance (D)
Text: Underground. Skirmish special abilities cannot be used.

Name: Neekerbreekers' Bog (D)
Text: Marsh. When the fellowship moves to here, heal each character who has resistance 5 or more and exert each other character.

Name: Theodred, Second Marshal of the Mark (D)
Text: While you can spot a [Rohan] Man who has resistance of 7 or more, Theodred is twilight cost -1. At the start of each skirmish involving Theodred, you may exert each minion he is skirmishing.

Name: Elendil, High-King of Gondor (D)
Text: Knight. To play, spot 2 [GONDOR] knights or exert 2 [GONDOR] men. Each of your [GONDOR] companions is resistance +1. Maneuver: Remove a [GONDOR] token to make an unbound companion resistance +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Ordnance Grunt (D)
Text: Damage +1. Fierce. To play, spot an [ORC] minion. Shadow: Discard an [ORC] condition from play to play this minion from your discard pile.

Name: Bilbo, Aged Ring-bearer (D)
Text: Ring-bound. While Bilbo is not assigned to a skirmish, each Ring-bound Hobbit is strength +1. At the start of each skirmish involving Bilbo, you may remove a burden for each other Ring-bound Hobbit you can spot.

Name: Cave Troll of Moria, Menace of the Underdeeps (D)
Notes: Incorrectly numbered? Bilbo, Aged Ring-bearer is also 0D8. This looks like it belongs in the Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Damage +1. Fierce. To play, spot a [MORIA] Orc. Menace - When you play this minion you may draw 3 cards.

Name: Arwen, Maiden of Rivendell (D)
Notes: League Card for LOTRO. No phyiscal card exists.
Text: Ranger. Archer. Skirmish: Exert Arwen to make a minion skirmishing an Elf strength -2. While you can spot an Elf, Arwen is twilight cost -1. While skirmishing a Nazgul, Arwen is strength +3. Fellowship: Exert an Elf to draw a card.

Name: Gandalf, Stormcrow (D)
Notes: League Card for LOTRO. No phyiscal card exists.
Text: Damage +3. Defender +3. Skirmish: Exert Gandalf to make a companion strength +1.

Name: Saruman, Many-coloured Wizard (D)
Notes: League Card for LOTRO. No phyiscal card exists.
Text: Damage +3. Fierce. Assignment: Exert Saruman to assign him to an unbound companion. Skirmish: Exert Saruman to make him strength +1.

Name: Moria Skirmishers (D)
Notes: League Card for LOTRO. No phyiscal card exists.
Text: Archer. Each time Moria Skirmishers wins a skirmish, you may exert a companion. While skirmishing an Elf or a Dwarf, Moria Skirmishers is strength +2. Shadow: Discard this minion to play a [MORIA] minion. That minion's twilight cost is -10.

Name: Eomer, Forthwith Banished (D)
Notes: League Card for LOTRO. No phyiscal card exists.
Text: Valiant. Damage +3. Fellowship: Exert Eomer to play a mount on him from your draw deck. Eomer is strength +2 for each wound on each minion he is skirmishing. At the start of your turn, you may heal a [ROHAN] ally. While you can spot a [ROHAN] man, Eomer is twilight cost -1.

Name: Morgul Patrol (D)
Notes: League Card for LOTRO. No phyiscal card exists.
Text: Besieger. Tracker. The site number of each [SAURON] Orc is -3. Response: If Morgul Patrol wins a skirmish, exert it to make it fierce until the regroup phase. Skirmish: Exert Morgul Patrol to wound a character it is skirmishing. Regroup: Exert Morgul Patrol to make the Free Peoples player exert X companions, where X is the number of burdens you can spot.

Name: The Lord of the Rings, Trading Card Game (M)
Notes: Oversized. Decipher, Inc. is proud to present... The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game. Coming November 6th, 2001.

Name: The Lord of the Rings, Trading Card Game (M)
Notes: Oversized. Release schedule for the first nine sets: 1. The Fellowship of the Ring - November 2001. 2. Mines of Moria - March 2002. 3. Realms of the Elf-lords - July 2002. 4. The Two Towers - November 2002. 5. Battle of Helm's Deep - March 2003. 6. Ents of Fangorn - July 2003. 7. The Return of the King - November 2003. 8. Siege of Gondor - March 2004. 9. Mount Doom - July 2004

Name: Goblet of the White City (SPD)
Notes: Saint Patrick's Day Promo for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Bearer must be a [GONDOR] companion. Each time you move to a site, bearer is strength +1 until the end of the game. At the start of your fellowship phase, discard 2 random cards from hand or discard this possession.

Name: Green Dragon Mug (SPD)
Notes: Saint Patrick's Day Promo for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Bearer must be a Hobbit. Each time you move to a site, bearer is strength +1 until the end of the game. At the start of your fellowship phase, exert bearer or discard this possession.

Name: Rohirrim Stein (SPD)
Notes: Saint Patrick's Day Promo for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Bearer must be a [ROHAN] companion. Each time you move to a site, bearer is strength +1 until the end of the game. At the start of your fellowship phase, add [2] or discard this possession.

Name: Army of Dunland (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: To play, spot a [DUNLAND] Man. Menace - When you play this minion, discard up to 2 Free People's possessions.

Name: Dwarven Escort (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Damage +1. Triumph - At the start of the fellowship phase draw 4 cards.

Name: Legolas, Nimble Elf (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Archer. Triumph - At the start of the archery phase, make the fellowship archery total +1.

Name: Treebeard, Enemy of the Hand (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Triumph - At the start of a skirmish involving Treebeard discard a minion he is skirmishing.

Name: Gollum, Worker of Mischief (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: To play, spot a [GOLLUM] condition. Menace - When you play Gollum make the move limit for this turn -1.

Name: Aragorn, The Dunadan (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Ranger. Triumph - At the start of the maneuver phase, you may wound a minion.

Name: Army of Isengard (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Damage +1. To play, spot an Uruk-hai. Menace - When you play this minion, it becomes fierce.

Name: Army of Moria (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: To play, spot a [MORIA] Orc. Menace - When you play this minion, draw 3 cards.

Name: Army of Harad (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Southron. Archer. To play, spot a [RAIDER] Man. Menace - When you play this minion, add ten tokens to the twilight pool.

Name: The Nazgul (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Fierce. To play, spot a Nazgul. Menace - When you play this minion add 2 burdens.

Name: Eowyn, Daughter of Kings (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Triumph - At the start of the fellowship phase, the move limit for this turn is +1.

Name: Army of Sauron (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: To play, spot a [SAURON] Orc. Menace - When you play this minion, make it strength +10.

Name: Sam, Lover of Trees (W)
Notes: Triumph and Menace Series for LOTRO. No physical card exists.
Text: Triumph - At the start of the fellowship phase remove 3 burdens. Response: If Frodo dies, make Sam the Ring-bearer (Resistance 5).

Name: The One Ring, Isildur's Bane
Lore: ...the Ring slipped from his fingers as he swam....
Text: Response: If bearer is about to take a wound, he wears The One Ring until the regroup phase. While wearing The One Ring, each time the Ring-bearer is about to take a wound, add 2 burdens instead.

Name: The One Ring, Isildur's Bane (T)
Lore: ...the Ring slipped from his fingers as he swam....
Text: Response: If bearer is about to take a wound in a skirmish, he wears The One Ring until the regroup phase. While wearing The One Ring, each time the Ring-bearer is about to take a wound during a skirmish, add a burden instead.

Name: The One Ring, The Ruling Ring
Lore: One Ring to rule them all....
Text: Response: If bearer is about to take a wound in a skirmish, he wears The One Ring until the regroup phase. While wearing The One Ring, each time the Ring-bearer is about to take a wound during a skirmish, add a burden instead.

Name: Axe Strike
Lore: Though Gimli's words were praised by the Lady of Light, he proved his best skill was swinging his axe.
Text: Skirmish: Make a Dwarf strength +2 (or +3 if bearing a [DWARVEN] hand weapon).

Name: Battle Fury
Lore: The Dwarves quickly dispatch Orcs and Uruk-hai with their mighty battle axes.
Text: Skirmish: Exert a Dwarf to make that Dwarf strength +3 and damage +1.

Name: Cleaving Blow
Lore: The shoddy workmanship of Orc-smiths cannot withstand the fury of Durin's folk.
Text: Skirmish: Make a Dwarf strength +2 and damage +1.

Name: Delving
Lore: '...they delved too greedily and too deep, and disturbed that from which they fled, Durin's Bane.'
Text: Fellowship: Exert a Dwarf companion to draw 3 cards.

Name: Dwarf Guard
Lore: Dwarves from Dáin's people are stout companions, trustworthy and loyal.
Text: To play, spot a Dwarf.

Name: Dwarven Armor
Lore: The strongest armour still being made in Middle-earth is forged by Dwarves. It is so heavy that only they can bear it.
Text: Bearer must be a Dwarf. Bearer may not be overwhelmed unless his strength is tripled.

Name: Dwarven Axe
Notes: This card can trigger only once for each Shadow player with a minion in that skirmish, regardless of how many minions that player had.
Lore: 'Buckler and corslet, axe and sword / And shining spears were laid in hoard.'
Text: Bearer must be a Dwarf. Each time a player's minion loses a skirmish to bearer, that player discards the top card from his draw deck.

Name: Dwarven Heart
Lore: '...a Dwarf goes on, be the burden twice his own weight....'
Text: Bearer must be a Dwarf. When you play this condition, heal bearer up to 2 times. At the start of each of your turns, exert bearer.

Name: Farin, Dwarven Emissary
Lore: Among the envoys sent to represent the Dwarves of Erebor at the Council of Elrond was Farin, a young but wise Dwarf, and a fierce foe in battle.
Text: To play, spot a Dwarf. While skirmishing an Orc, Farin is strength +2.

Name: Gimli, Dwarf of Erebor
Lore: Gimli now walked ahead by the wizard's side, so eager was he to come to Moria.
Text: Damage +1. Fellowship: If the twilight pool has fewer than 2 twilight tokens, add [2] to place a card from hand beneath your draw deck.

Name: Gimli, Son of Gloin
Lore: There was a younger dwarf at Glóin's side: his son Gimli.
Text: Damage +1. Skirmish: Exert Gimli to make him strength +2.

Name: Gimli, Son of Gloin (T)
Lore: There was a younger dwarf at Glóin's side: his son Gimli.
Text: Damage +1. Skirmish: Exert Gimli to make him strength +2.

Name: Gimli's Battle Axe
Lore: Beside them Gimli stood with his stout legs apart, wielding his dwarf-axe.
Text: Bearer must be Gimli. He is damage +1. Each time Gimli wins a skirmish, you may wound an Orc.

Name: Gimli's Battle Axe (T)
Lore: Beside them Gimli stood with his stout legs apart, wielding his dwarf-axe.
Text: Bearer must be Gimli. He is damage +1. Each time Gimli wins a skirmish, you may wound an Orc.

Name: Gimli's Helm
Lore: A helm fashioned under the Lonely Mountain protects the head of Gimli the Dwarf.
Text: Bearer must be Gimli. He takes no more than 1 wound during each skirmish phase. Skirmish: Discard Gimli's Helm to prevent all wounds to him.

Name: Greatest Kingdom of My People
Lore: 'With golden roof and silver floor / And runes of power upon the door.'
Text: Tale. Exert a Dwarf to play this condition. Plays to your support area. Each time your opponent plays an Orc, that player discards the top card of his or her draw deck.

Name: Grimir, Dwarven Elder
Lore: Old and grey after many years spent in exile before the Lonely Mountain was reclaimed, Grimir can still wield his axe with strength.
Text: Fellowship: Exert Grimir to shuffle a [DWARVEN] event from your discard pile into your draw deck.

Name: Halls of My Home
Lore: 'I will go and look on the halls of Durin, whatever may wait there....'
Text: Fellowship: Exert a Dwarf to reveal the top 3 cards of any draw deck. You may discard 1 Shadow card revealed. Return the rest in any order.

Name: Here Lies Balin, Son of Fundin
Lore: 'I have looked on Moria, and it is very great, but it has become dark and dreadful
Text: and we have found no sign of my kindred.'
column19: Maneuver: Exert a Dwarf to wound 2 Orcs or to wound 1 Orc twice.

Name: Let Them Come!
Lore: 'There is one Dwarf yet in Moria who still draws breath!'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a Dwarf wins a skirmish against an Orc, discard that Orc. Discard this condition if a Dwarf loses a skirmish.

Name: Lord of Moria
Lore: Gimli rushed ahead into the vast, empty chamber to see a huge slab of white stone. Knowing instinctively the significance of this tomb, he fell to his knees, overcome with grief.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each Dwarf is damage +1.

Name: Mithril Shaft
Lore: 'Mithril! All folk desired it.'
Text: Maneuver: Exert a Dwarf to discard cards from the top of your draw deck until you choose to stop (limit 5). Add [1] for each card discarded in this way. Take the last card discarded into hand.

Name: Nobody Tosses a Dwarf
Lore: 'My folk have never had dealings with any of the servants of the Enemy.'
Text: Response: If a Dwarf wins a skirmish, make an opponent discard 3 cards from the top of his or her draw deck.

Name: Stairs of Khazad-dum
Lore: 'Moria - Khazad-dûm! Greatest of the dwarf-halls - What I would not give to look upon its treasures!'
Text: Tale. Plays to your support area. While a Dwarf skirmishes a [MORIA] minion, that Dwarf is strength +1.

Name: Still Draws Breath
Lore: When thirteen had fallen the rest fled shrieking, leaving the defenders unharmed....
Text: Response: If a Dwarf wins a skirmish, heal that Dwarf.

Name: Their Halls of Stone
Lore: 'These are not holes,' said Gimli. 'This is the great realm and city of the Dwarrowdelf. And of old it was not darksome, but full of light and splendour, as is still remembered in our songs.'
Text: Skirmish: Make a Dwarf strength +2 (or +4 if at an underground site).

Name: Thrarin, Dwarven Smith
Lore: A blacksmith by trade, Thrarin puts down his hammer and takes up his axe to fight when the need arises.
Text: Maneuver: Exert Thrarin to allow him to participate in archery fire and skirmishes until the regroup phase.

Name: Wealth of Moria
Lore: 'For here alone in all the world was found Moria-silver, or true-silver as some have called it: mithril is the Elvish name.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot a Dwarf to reveal the top 3 cards of your draw deck. Take all Free Peoples cards revealed into hand and discard the rest.

Name: Ancient Enmity
Lore: Hard and bitter is the Elven hatred of Orcs, for they have lost many kinsmen to Orc savagery.
Text: Skirmish: Make an Elf strength +1. If a minion loses this skirmish to that Elf, that minion's owner discards 2 cards at random from hand.

Name: Arwen, Daughter of Elrond
Lore: Long she had been in the land of her mother's kin, in Lórien beyond the mountains, and was but lately returned to Rivendell to her father's house.
Text: Ranger. While skirmishing a Nazgul, Arwen is strength +3.

Name: Arwen, Daughter of Elrond (T)
Lore: Long she had been in the land of her mother's kin, in Lórien beyond the mountains, and was but lately returned to Rivendell to her father's house.
Text: Ranger. While skirmishing a Nazgul, Arwen is strength +3.

Name: Asfaloth
Lore: 'Noro lim, Asfaloth, noro lim!'
Text: Bearer must be an Elf. When played on Arwen, Asfaloth's twilight cost is -2. While at a plains site, bearer is strength +2. Discard Asfaloth when at an underground site.

Name: Border Defenses
Lore: 'None of the Orcs will ever return out of Lórien. And there will be many Elves hidden on the northern border before another night falls.'
Text: Skirmish: Make an Elf strength +2 (or +4 if skirmishing an archer).

Name: Bow of the Galadhrim
Lore: To Legolas she gave a bow such as the Galadhrim used, longer and stouter than the bows of Mirkwood, and strung with a string of elfhair.
Text: Bearer must be Legolas. Each time Legolas wins a skirmish, you may wound a minion.

Name: Celeborn, Lord of Lorien
Lore: They were clad wholly in white ... and the hair of the Lord Celeborn was of silver long and bright
Text: but no sign of age was upon them, unless it were in the depths of their eyes
column19: for these were keen as lances in the starlight, and yet profo
column20: Fellowship: Exert Celeborn to heal an [ELVEN] ally.

Name: The Council of Elrond
Lore: 'You will hear today all that you need in order to understand the purposes of the Enemy .... What shall we do with the Ring, the least of rings, the trifle that Sauron fancies? That is the doom that we must deem.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot an Elf to play a tale from your draw deck.

Name: Curse Their Foul Feet!
Lore: 'A strong company of Orcs has passed. They crossed the Nimrodel - curse their foul feet in its clean water!'
Text: Fellowship: Exert an Elf to reveal an opponent's hand. That player discards a card from hand for each Orc revealed.

Name: Defiance
Lore: 'If you want him, come and claim him!'
Text: Skirmish: Make an Elf strength +2 (or +4 if skirmishing a Nazgul).

Name: Double Shot
Lore: The affray was sharp, but the orcs were dismayed by the fierceness of the defence. Legolas shot two through the throat.
Text: Archery: Spot an Elf archer companion to make the fellowship archery total +1.

Name: Elf-song
Lore: ...the beauty of the melodies and of the interwoven words in elven-tongues, even though he understood them little, held him in a spell, as soon as he began to attend to them.
Text: Fellowship: Spot an Elf to remove a burden.

Name: Elrond, Lord of Rivendell
Lore: He was the Lord of Rivendell and mighty among both Elves and Men.
Text: To play, spot Gandalf or an Elf. At the start of each of your turns, heal every ally whose home is site 3. Fellowship: Exert Elrond to draw a card.

Name: Elven Bow
Lore: 'We live now upon an island amid many perils, and our hands are more often upon the bowstring than upon the harp.'
Text: Bearer must be an Elf. Bearer is an archer.

Name: Elven Cloak
Lore: '...never before have we clad strangers in the garb of our own people.'
Text: To play, spot an Elf. Bearer must be a companion. The minion archery total is -1.

Name: Far-seeing Eyes
Notes: Erratum: This Elven condition is unique.
Lore: Keen Elven eyes see farther and more clearly than those of Men or Dwarves.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time you play an Elf, choose an opponent to discard a card from hand.

Name: Foul Creation
Lore: Saruman's Uruk-hai mirrored the singular focus of their master, viewing with contempt and disgust all they encountered.
Text: Fellowship: Exert an Elf to reveal an opponent's hand. You may discard a [ISENGARD] minion revealed to draw 2 cards.

Name: Galadriel, Lady of Light
Notes: Lists: EXL, MXL. The twilight cost of an Elf played using Galadriel's text is zero, and cannot be raised or lowered.
Lore: Very tall they were, and the Lady no less tall than the Lord
Text: and they were grave and beautiful ... and the hair of the Lady was of deep gold....
column19: At the start of each of your turns, heal every ally whose home is site 6. Fellowship: Exert Galadriel to play an Elf for free.

Name: Gift of Boats
Lore: 'They will not sink, lade them as you will
Text: but they are wayward if mishandled.'
column19: To play, exert an Elf ally. Plays to your support area. When the fellowship moves from a river during the fellowship phase, the move limit for this turn is +1.

Name: Gwemegil
Lore: Forged by the Elven-smiths of Rivendell, Arwen's blade bears enchantments to ward off the forces of the Great Eye.
Text: Bearer must be Arwen. She is damage +1. Skirmish: Exert Arwen or discard 2 cards from hand to make her strength +1.

Name: Haldir, Elf of the Golden Wood
Lore: 'But there are some of us still who go abroad for the gathering of news and the watching of our enemies .... I am one. Haldir is my name.'
Text: To play, spot an Elf. While Haldir is at site 6, 7, or 8, he is strength +2.

Name: The Last Alliance of Elves and Men
Lore: But Sauron of Mordor assailed them, and they made the Last Alliance of Elves and Men, and the hosts of Gil-galad and Elendil were mustered....
Text: Tale. Bearer must be a [GONDOR] Man. Limit 1 per bearer. Bearer is strength +1 for each Elf you can spot (limit +3).

Name: Legolas, Greenleaf
Lore: 'And I too will go with him,' said Legolas. 'It would be faithless now to say farewell.'
Text: Archer. Archery: Exert Legolas to wound a minion
column19: Legolas does not add to the fellowship archery total.

Name: Legolas, Greenleaf (T)
Lore: 'And I too will go with him,' said Legolas. 'It would be faithless now to say farewell.'
Text: Archer. Archery: Exert Legolas to wound a minion
column19: Legolas does not add to the fellowship archery total.

Name: Legolas, Prince of Mirkwood
Lore: There was also a strange Elf clad in green and brown, Legolas, a messenger from his father, Thranduil, the King of the Elves of Northern Mirkwood.
Text: Archer. While skirmishing a Nazgul, Legolas is strength +3.

Name: Lightfootedness
Lore: '...let a ploughman plough, but choose an otter for swimming, and for running light over grass and leaf, or over snow - an Elf.'
Text: Archery: Spot an Elf companion to make the minion archery total -1.

Name: Lorien Elf
Lore: '...we dwell now in the heart of the forest, and do not willingly have dealings with any other folk.'
Text: To play, spot an Elf.

Name: Mallorn-trees
Lore: Upon the further side there rose to a great height a green wall encircling a green hill thronged with mallorn-trees taller than any they had yet seen in all the land.
Text: Plays to your support area. Fellowship: Reveal an [ELVEN] card from hand and place it beneath your draw deck.

Name: The Mirror of Galadriel
Lore: 'What you will see I cannot tell....'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each Elf ally whose home is site 6 is strength +1. Maneuver: If an opponent has at least 7 cards in hand, exert Galadriel to look at 2 of those cards at random. Discard one and replace the other.

Name: Orophin, Lorien Bowman
Lore: The swift bow of Orophin, Haldir's kinsman, has slain many Orcs.
Text: Archer. Archery: Exert Orophin to wound an Uruk-hai.

Name: Rumil, Elven Protector
Lore: Brother to Haldir, Rúmil guards the northern marches of the Golden Wood.
Text: Archer. Archery: Exert Rumil to wound an Orc.

Name: The Seen and the Unseen
Lore: 'You have entered the realm of the Lady of the Wood - you cannot go back.'
Text: Fellowship: Exert 2 Elves to discard a condition.

Name: Shoulder to Shoulder
Lore: 'May it be a sign that though the world is now dark better days are at hand, and that friendship shall be renewed between our peoples.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Add [1] and exert a Dwarf to heal an Elf, or add [1] and exert an Elf to heal a Dwarf.

Name: Silinde, Elf of Mirkwood
Lore: Among the representatives of the Elves of Northern Mirkwood was Silinde, friend of the House of Thranduil.
Text: While you can spot your site 3, Silinde has the game text of that site.

Name: Songs of the Blessed Realm
Lore: Elves seem to like music and poetry and tales as much as Hobbits like food.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time you play an [ELVEN] tale, you may remove a burden.

Name: The Splendor of Their Banners
Lore: 'It recalled to me the glory of the Elder Days and the hosts of Beleriand, so many great princes and captains were assembled.'
Text: Tale. Bearer must be an Elf companion. Archery: If bearer is an archer, exert bearer to make the fellowship archery total +1.

Name: Stand Against Darkness
Lore: 'What power still remains lies with us, here in Imladris, or with Círdan at the Havens, or in Lórien. But have they the strength, have we here the strength to withstand the Enemy...?'
Text: Maneuver: Exert an Elf to discard a [SAURON] minion, a [SAURON] condition, or a [SAURON] possession.

Name: Support of the Last Homely House
Lore: Merely to be there was a cure for weariness, fear, and sadness.
Text: Maneuver: Exert an Elf ally whose home is site 3. Until the regroup phase, that ally is strength +3 and participates in archery fire and skirmishes.

Name: Swan-ship of the Galadhrim
Lore: ...and suddenly they perceived that it was a ship, wrought and carved with elven-skill in the likeness of a bird.
Text: Maneuver: Exert an Elf ally whose home is site 6. Until the regroup phase, that ally is strength +3 and participates in archery fire and skirmishes.

Name: The Tale of Gil-galad
Lore: Gil-galad was an Elven-king / Of him the harpers sadly sing: / the last whose realm was fair and free / between the Mountains and the Sea.
Text: Tale. Bearer must be an Elf. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make bearer strength +2.

Name: Uruviel, Maid of Lorien
Lore: An Elf-maid of the Galadhrim, Uruviel has dwelt for years beneath the mallorn-trees of Lothlórien.
Text: While you can spot your site 6, Uruviel has the game text of that site.

Name: The White Arrows of Lorien
Lore: Straight and true, the arrows of the Golden Wood are known to leave a deadly mark.
Text: Tale. Bearer must be an Elf companion. Archery: If bearer is an archer, exert bearer to make an opponent discard 2 cards at random from hand.

Name: Albert Dreary, Entertainer From Bree
Lore: Typical of Bree-folk, Albert is a plain but stout-hearted fellow. He does not seek trouble, but he is willing to protect his home.
Text: To play, spot Gandalf. Maneuver: Exert Albert Dreary to discard a [ISENGARD] or [MORIA] condition.

Name: Barliman Butterbur, Prancing Pony Proprietor
Lore: 'You don't know much even about them, if you think old Barliman is stupid,' said Gandalf. 'He is wise enough on his own ground.'
Text: Fellowship: Exert Barliman Butterbur to take a [GANDALF] event into hand from your discard pile.

Name: Durin's Secret
Lore: 'They are wrought of ithildin that mirrors only starlight and moonlight, and sleeps until it is touched by one who speaks words now long forgotten in Middle-earth.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot Gandalf, a Dwarf, and an Elf to make the move limit for this turn +1.

Name: Gandalf, Friend of the Shirefolk
Lore: 'Among the Wise I am the only one that goes in for hobbit-lore: an obscure branch of knowledge, but full of surprises.'
Text: Gandalf is strength +1 for each of these races you can spot in the fellowship: Hobbit, Dwarf, Elf, and Man.

Name: Gandalf, Friend of the Shirefolk (T)
Lore: 'Among the Wise I am the only one that goes in for hobbit-lore: an obscure branch of knowledge, but full of surprises.'
Text: Gandalf is strength +1 for each of these races you can spot in the fellowship: Hobbit, Dwarf, Elf, and Man.

Name: Gandalf's Cart
Lore: ...a cart came in through Bywater ... An old man was driving it all alone.
Text: Plays to your support area. Fellowship: Stack a Free Peoples artifact (or possession) from hand on this card, or play a card stacked here as if played from hand.

Name: Gandalf's Pipe
Lore: 'I know what is the matter with me,' he muttered, as he sat down by the door. 'I need smoke!'
Text: Bearer must be Gandalf. Fellowship: Discard a pipeweed possession and spot X pipes to remove X burdens.

Name: Glamdring
Lore: ...in his other hand Glamdring gleamed, cold and white.
Text: Bearer must be Gandalf. He is damage +1. Fellowship or Regroup: Exert Gandalf to reveal an opponent's hand. Remove [1] for each Orc revealed.

Name: Intimidate
Lore: 'Go back to the Shadow!'
Text: Spell. Response: If a companion is about to take a wound, spot Gandalf to prevent that wound.

Name: Let Folly Be Our Cloak
Lore: 'Well, let folly be our cloak, a veil before the eyes of the Enemy! ... Into his heart the thought will not enter that any will refuse it, that having the Ring we may seek to destroy it.'
Text: Fellowship: Exert X companions to remove (X).

Name: Mysterious Wizard
Lore: '...there are older and fouler things than Orcs in the deep places of the world.'
Text: Spell. Skirmish: Make Gandalf strength +2 (or +4 if there are 4 or fewer burdens on the Ring-bearer).

Name: The Nine Walkers
Lore: 'Nine companions to match the Nine Ringwraiths ... So be it.'
Text: To play, spot Gandalf. Plays to your support area. Each time you play a companion whose race you cannot spot, that companion's twilight cost is -2.

Name: Ottar, Man of Laketown
Lore: The Men of Laketown come from the North, where they trade with the Dwarves of the Lonely Mountain.
Text: To play, spot Gandalf. Fellowship: Exert Ottar to discard up to 3 cards from hand and draw an equal number of cards.

Name: Questions That Need Answering
Lore: 'There are some things that I must see to....'
Text: Spell. Fellowship: If the twilight pool has fewer than 3 twilight tokens, spot Gandalf to look at the top 4 cards of your draw deck. Take 2 of those cards into hand and discard the rest.

Name: Risk a Little Light
Lore: 'Let me risk a little more light.'
Text: Spell. Fellowship: If the twilight pool has fewer than 2 twilight tokens, spot Gandalf to look at the top 2 cards of your draw deck. Take one into hand and discard the other.

Name: Servant of the Secret Fire
Lore: 'I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the flame of Anor. You cannot pass.'
Text: Spell. Skirmish: Spot Gandalf to make a minion strength -3.

Name: Servant of the Secret Fire (T)
Lore: 'I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the flame of Anor. You cannot pass.'
Text: Spell. Skirmish: Spot gandalf to make a minion strength -3.

Name: Sleep, Caradhras
Notes: "Discard every condition" means to discard every active condition. Inactive conditions are not discarded.
Lore: 'Losto Caradhras, sedho, hodo, nuitho i ruith.'
Text: Spell. Fellowship: Exert Gandalf to discard every condition.

Name: Strength of Spirit
Lore: 'There are many powers in the world, for good or for evil. Some are greater than I am. Against some I have not yet been measured. But my time is coming.'
Text: Spell. Response: If a companion is about to exert, spot Gandalf to place no token for that exertion.

Name: Treachery Deeper Than You Know
Lore: 'By foul craft, Saruman has crossed Orc with Goblin Men - he is breeding an army in the Caverns of Isengard.'
Text: Spell. Fellowship: Spot Gandalf to reveal an opponent's hand.

Name: A Wizard Is Never Late
Lore: 'A wizard is never late, Frodo Baggins, nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he means to.'
Text: Fellowship: Play a [GANDALF] character from your draw deck.

Name: An Able Guide
Lore: '...though I cannot disappear, I have hunted many wild and wary things and I can usually avoid being seen, if I wish.'
Text: Regroup: Spot a ranger to remove [4].

Name: Aragorn, Ranger of the North
Lore: 'Lonely men are we, Rangers of the wild, hunters - but hunters ever of the servants of the Enemy....'
Text: Ranger. Maneuver: Exert Aragorn to make him defender +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Aragorn, Ranger of the North (T)
Lore: 'Lonely men are we, Rangers of the wild, hunters - but hunters ever of the servants of the Enemy....'
Text: Ranger. Exert Aragorn to make him Defender +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Aragorn's Bow
Lore: Rangers learn the bow as well as the blade.
Text: Bearer must be Aragorn. He is an archer. Archery: Exert Aragorn to wound a minion
column19: Aragorn does not add to the fellowship archery total.

Name: Aragorn's Pipe
Lore: He had a tall tankard in front of him, and was smoking a long-stemmed pipe curiously carved.
Text: Bearer must be a [GONDOR] companion. Fellowship: Discard a pipeweed possession and spot X pipes to heal X companions.

Name: Armor
Lore: Then Elendil the Tall and his mighty sons, Isildur and Anárion, became great lords
Text: and the North-realm they made in Arnor, and the Southrealm in Gondor....
column19: Bearer must be a Man. Bearer takes no more than 1 wound during each skirmish phase.

Name: Arwen's Fate
Lore: For the love of a mortal Man, Arwen, daughter of Elrond, must forsake her Elven heritage, and give up forever her journey to the Undying Lands.
Text: Skirmish: Exert Aragorn to make Arwen strength +3, or exert Arwen to make Aragorn strength +3.

Name: Athelas
Lore: The hands of the king are the hands of a healer, and so shall the true king be known.
Text: Bearer must be a [GONDOR] Man. Fellowship: Discard this possession to heal a companion or to remove a Shadow condition from a companion.

Name: Blade of Gondor
Lore: With the valour of Boromir's mighty longsword, the Enemies of the West are kept at bay.
Text: Bearer must be Boromir. He is damage +1. Skirmish: Exert Boromir to wound an Orc or Uruk-hai he is skirmishing.

Name: Boromir, Lord of Gondor
Lore: '...Boromir will also be in the Company. He is a valiant man.'
Text: Ranger. Boromir is not overwhelmed unless his strength is tripled.

Name: Boromir, Lord of Gondor (T)
Lore: '...Boromir will also be in the Company. He is a valiant man.'
Text: Ranger. Boromir is not overwhelmed unless his strength is tripled.

Name: Boromir, Son of Denethor
Lore: 'Long has my father, the Steward of Gondor, held the forces of Mordor at bay - by the blood of our people are the lands of others kept safe.'
Text: Skirmish: Exert Boromir to make a Hobbit strength +3.

Name: Boromir's Cloak
Lore: He was cloaked and booted as if for a journey on horseback
Text: and indeed though his garments were rich, and his cloak was lined with fur, they were stained with long travel.
column19: Bearer must be Boromir. Maneuver: Exert Boromir to discard a weather condition.

Name: Change of Plans
Lore: 'Then let me help you. There are other ways, Frodo - other paths that we might take.'
Text: Regroup: Exert a ranger to make an opponent shuffle his hand into his draw deck and draw 8 cards.

Name: The Choice of Luthien
Lore: 'But she chose mortality, and to die from the world, so that she might follow him
Text: and it is sung that they met again beyond the Sundering Seas....'
column19: Tale. Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Exert Aragorn to heal Arwen, or exert Arwen to heal Aragorn.

Name: Coat of Mail
Lore: Soldiers of the White Tower have long appreciated the craftsmanship of the Gondorian metalsmiths.
Text: Bearer must be a Man. Bearer may not be overwhelmed unless his or her strength is tripled.

Name: Dagger Strike
Lore: Every warrior needs a sword, bow, or axe - but sometimes, a dagger is enough.
Text: Skirmish: Make a [GONDOR] or [SHIRE] companion bearing a hand weapon strength +2 and damage +1.

Name: Elendil's Valor
Lore: 'In panoply of ancient kings, / in chainéd rings he armoured him
Text: / his shining shield was scored with runes / to ward all wounds and harm from him....'
column19: Maneuver: Make a [GONDOR] companion defender +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Eregion's Trails
Lore: Guided by Aragorn they struck a good path. It looked to Frodo like the remains of an ancient road, that had once been broad and well planned....
Text: Maneuver: Exert a ranger to make each roaming minion strength -3 until the regroup phase.

Name: Foes of Mordor
Lore: Through the long years, the Men of the Tower of Guard have shielded the West from the minions of the Eye.
Text: Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Exert a [GONDOR] character to wound a [SAURON] minion.

Name: Gondor's Vengeance
Lore: A Ranger in the wild is a deadly foe for the forces of the Shadow.
Text: Regroup: Exert a ranger companion to discard a minion.

Name: Great Shield
Lore: The Kingdom of Gondor has smiths much practiced in creating strong tools of war.
Text: Bearer must be a Man. The minion archery total is -1.

Name: No Stranger to the Shadows
Lore: 'Ah, but you had not got me with you then,' laughed Strider. 'My cuts, short or long, don't go wrong.'
Text: Bearer must be a ranger. Limit 1 per ranger. Each site's shadow number is -1.

Name: One Whom Men Would Follow
Lore: 'The skill of the elves can reforge the Sword of Elendil - but only you have the power to wield it.'
Text: Maneuver: Exert Aragorn to spot an ally. Until the regroup phase, that ally is strength +2 and participates in archery fire and skirmishes.

Name: Pathfinder
Lore: 'Strider can take you by paths that are seldom trodden. Will you have him?'
Text: Fellowship or Regroup: Spot a ranger to play the fellowship's next site (replacing opponent's site if necessary).

Name: Pursuit Just Behind
Lore: 'We must do something to delay the enemy first. We will make them fear the Chamber of Mazarbul!'
Text: Regroup: Exert a ranger companion to wound every minion.

Name: Ranger's Sword
Lore: Aragorn is a trustworthy companion and a deadly foe. His years roaming the wild have honed his swordfighting skills.
Text: Bearer must be Aragorn. He is damage +1.

Name: A Ranger's Versatility
Lore: 'If you bring a Ranger with you, it is well to pay attention to him, especially if the Ranger is Aragorn.'
Text: Maneuver: Exert a ranger at a river or forest to exhaust a minion.

Name: The Saga of Elendil
Lore: From out of the depths of the Sea, from the foundered land of Númenor, came Elendil to Middle-earth to found the kingdoms of Arnor and Gondor.
Text: Tale. Bearer must be a [GONDOR] companion. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make bearer strength +2.

Name: The Saga of Elendil (T)
Lore: From out of the depths of the Sea, from the foundered land of Númenor, came Elendil to Middle-earth to found the kingdoms of Arnor and Gondor.
Text: Tale. Bearer must be a [GONDOR] companion. Skirmish: discard this condition to make bearer strength +2.

Name: Strength of Kings
Lore: 'Believe not that in the land of Gondor the blood of Númenor is spent, nor all its pride and dignity forgotten.'
Text: Response: If a Skirmish event is played during a skirmish involving a [GONDOR] Man, cancel that event.

Name: Swordarm of the White Tower
Lore: 'By our valour the wild folk of the East are still restrained, and the terror of Morgul kept at bay
Text: and thus alone are peace and freedom maintained in the lands behind us, bulwark of the West.'
column19: Skirmish: Make a [GONDOR] companion strength +2 (or +4 if he is defender +1).

Name: Swordsman of the Northern Kingdom
Lore: 'This is no mere Ranger. He is Aragorn, son of Arathorn ... and you owe him your allegiance.'
Text: Skirmish: Make a ranger strength +2 (or +4 when skirmishing a roaming minion).

Name: Valiant Man of the West
Lore: '...I swore to protect you.'
Text: Maneuver: Make Aragorn defender +1 and he takes no more than 1 wound during each skirmish phase until the regroup phase.

Name: What Are They?
Lore: 'They were men ... once.'
Text: Maneuver: Spot a ranger to discard a roaming minion.

Name: Alive and Unspoiled
Lore: 'Bring them to me.... Kill the others....'
Text: To play, exert an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Remove [3] and spot X burdens to make the Free Peoples player reveal X cards at random from hand. You may discard 1 revealed card.

Name: Bred for Battle
Lore: 'You are the Uruk-hai of Isengard! The blood in your veins is black and cold - you do not know pain, you do not know fear - for you are the servants of the White Hand - the hand that gives you Man flesh to eat!'
Text: Skirmish: Exert an Uruk-hai to make it strength +3.

Name: Breeding Pit
Lore: 'He is breeding an army in the Caverns of Isengard. An army that can move in sunlight and cover great distance at speed.'
Text: Response: If you play an Uruk-hai, take all copies of that card in your discard pile and place them beneath your draw deck.

Name: Caradhras Has Not Forgiven Us
Lore: 'It was no ordinary storm. It is the ill will of Caradhras.'
Text: Spell. Weather. Maneuver: Exert a [ISENGARD] minion and spot 5 companions to discard an exhausted companion (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: Cruel Caradhras
Lore: 'Yonder stands Barazinbar, the Redhorn, cruel Caradhras....'
Text: Spell. Weather. Maneuver: Exert a [ISENGARD] minion to make the opponent choose to either exert the Ring-bearer or add a burden.

Name: Greed
Lore: 'It is a strange fate that we should suffer so much fear and doubt over so small a thing....'
Text: To play, spot an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Spot 6 companions and remove [2] to wound a companion (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: Hunt Them Down!
Lore: 'Do not stop until they are found!
Text: Maneuver: Make an Uruk-hai fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Lurtz, Servant of Isengard
Lore: 'And now... perfected. Grown beyond the height of Men - straight-limbed and strong, fearing nothing.'
Text: Archer. Damage +1. Maneuver: Spot another Uruk-hai to make Lurtz fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Lurtz, Servant of Isengard (T)
Lore: 'And now... perfected. Grown beyond the height of Men - straight-limbed and strong, fearing nothing.'
Text: Archer. Damage +1. Maneuver: Spot another Uruk-hai to make Lurtz fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Lurtz's Battle Cry
Lore: 'Find the Halflings!'
Text: Skirmish: Make an Uruk-hai strength -1 and damage +1.

Name: The Misadventure of Mr. Underhill
Lore: 'You're drawing far too much attention to yourself... Mr. Underhill.'
Text: To play, exert an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. The twilight cost of each companion played to a site which is not a sanctuary is +2.

Name: No Ordinary Storm
Lore: 'So Gandalf... you try to lead them over Caradhras. And if that fails - where then will you go?'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time you play a weather condition, exert a [GANDALF] companion or [GANDALF] ally.

Name: Orthanc Assassin
Lore: Black-feathered arrows from Uruk-hai bows reign over the corpses of Saruman's enemies.
Text: Archer. Damage +1.

Name: Parry
Lore: Even the sword of a powerful warrior can be parried by the strength of an Uruk-hai.
Text: Maneuver: Spot an Uruk-hai to cancel the strength bonus from a possession until the regroup phase.

Name: Saruman's Ambition
Lore: 'I did not expect you to show wisdom, even in your own behalf
Text: but I gave you the chance of aiding me willingly, and so saving yourself much trouble and pain.'
column19: Plays to your support area. The twilight cost of your [ISENGARD] events is -1. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make an Uruk-hai strength +2.

Name: Saruman's Chill
Lore: Saruman's hand can control the chill of winter.
Text: Spell. Weather. To play, exert a [ISENGARD] minion. Plays on a site. Limit 1 per site. Each Hobbit who moves from this site must exert. Discard this condition at the end of the turn.

Name: Saruman's Frost
Lore: The small and weak suffer first from the The White Wizard's powerful sorcery.
Text: Spell. Weather. To play, exert a [ISENGARD] minion. Plays on a site. Limit 1 per site. Each Hobbit at this site is strength -2. Discard this condition at the end of the turn.

Name: Saruman's Power
Lore: The Uruks of Saruman are bred to be the instruments of his will, destroying his enemies with foul cruelty.
Text: Spell. Shadow: Exert a [ISENGARD] minion to discard all conditions.

Name: Saruman's Reach
Lore: Saruman used both magic and minions to impose his will.
Text: Search. Maneuver: Exert an Uruk-hai to make the opponent choose to either exert 2 companions or make the Ring-bearer put on The One Ring until the regroup phase.

Name: Saruman's Snows
Notes: Lists: EXL. Game text is a clarification.
Lore: Saruman's spells can hinder even the wary.
Text: Spell. Weather. To play, exert a [ISENGARD] minion. Plays on a site. No player may play skirmish events or use skirmish special abilities during skirmishes at this site. Discard this condition at the end of the turn.

Name: Savagery to Match Their Numbers
Notes: Lists: ERL, MXL. The strength +4 bonus lasts until the regroup phase.
Lore: Uruk-hai match their enemies' strength with their own feral rage.
Text: Skirmish: Make an Uruk-hai strength +2, or spot 5 companions to make an Uruk-hai strength +4 and fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Spies of Saruman
Lore: '...they are crebain out of Fangorn or Dunland. I do not know what they are about....'
Text: To play, exert a [ISENGARD] minion. Plays on a site. While the fellowship is at this site, skip the archery phase. Discard this condition at the end of the turn.

Name: Their Arrows Enrage
Lore: The ferocious charge of the Uruk-hai catches enemy archers groping for their swords.
Text: To play, spot Saruman or an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. Each archer companion and archer ally is strength -1.

Name: Traitor's Voice
Lore: 'In all the long wars with the Dark Tower treason has ever been our greatest foe.'
Text: Search. To play, spot an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. While the Ring-bearer is exhausted or you can spot 5 burdens, the move limit for this turn is -1 (to a minimum of 1).

Name: Troop of Uruk-hai
Lore: Attacking in swarming hordes, the Urukhai close with the enemy rapidly to make weapons useless.
Text: Damage +1. A character skirmishing this minion does not gain strength bonuses from weapons.

Name: Uruk Bloodlust
Lore: 'Take them alive!'
Text: Plays to your support area. Response: If your Uruk-hai wins a skirmish, remove [1] to heal him.

Name: Uruk Brood
Lore: 'He does not see the caverns hidden deep beneath this tower... nor does he know what is growing there.'
Text: Damage +1. Skirmish: Remove [2] to make this minion strength +1 for each other Uruk-hai you spot.

Name: Uruk Fighter
Lore: Not stealth or cunning, but strength and ferocity are the weapons of Saruman's army of abominations.
Text: Damage +1. Maneuver: Spot 5 companions to make this minion fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Uruk Guard
Lore: 'SWolves and orcs were housed in Isengard, for Saruman was mustering a great force....'
Text: Damage +1. Assignment: Exert this minion and spot a companion to prevent the opponent from assigning that companion to this minion.

Name: Uruk Lieutenant
Lore: Uruk-hai leaders gain savagery from their following hordes to maintain the rule of the strong.
Text: Damage +1. This minion is strength +1 for each other Uruk-hai you can spot.

Name: Uruk Messenger
Lore: Saruman uses his Uruks abroad to gain information on the movements - and weaknesses - of his many enemies.
Text: Damage +1. While you can spot a weather condition, this minion is strength +3.

Name: Uruk Rager
Lore: A bloodthirsty bellow from a huge Uruk can win a skirmish before it begins.
Text: Damage +1. Each time this minion wins a skirmish, the Free Peoples player must discard the top 2 cards of his draw deck.

Name: Uruk Savage
Lore: 'The friendship of Saruman is not lightly thrown aside. One ill turn deserves another .... We have work to do.'
Text: Damage +1.

Name: Uruk Shaman
Lore: Uruk shamans know the arts of healing as well as those of battle.
Text: Damage +1. Maneuver: Remove [2] to heal an Uruk-hai.

Name: Uruk Slayer
Lore: A foe who is willing to kill or die outright is a foe to be feared indeed.
Text: Damage +1. Skirmish: Remove [1] to make this minion strength +1 (limit +3).

Name: Uruk Soldier
Lore: Saruman's Uruk-hai band together as an extremely effective fighting unit.
Text: Damage +1. When you play this minion, you may make the Free Peoples player discard the top card of his draw deck.

Name: Uruk Spy
Lore: A wary eye on the mission could undo the quest.
Text: Response: If the Ring-bearer puts on The One Ring, exert this minion. Discard a card from the top of your draw deck for each [ISENGARD] minion you spot. Add a burden for each Shadow card discarded in this way.

Name: Uruk Warrior
Lore: Powerful and fearless, Uruk-hai warriors are not intimidated by the weapons or numbers of their enemies.
Text: Damage +1. Maneuver: Spot 6 companions to make this minion fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Uruk-hai Armory
Lore: The ranks of Saruman's army include forgers of weapons and armour.
Text: Plays to your support area. While you can spot an Uruk-hai, the fellowship archery total is -1.

Name: Uruk-hai Raiding Party
Lore: 'Imagine, Gandalf, an army - born from the earth of Isengard.'
Text: Damage +1.

Name: Uruk-hai Rampage
Lore: Victory breeds rage in Saruman's foul creations.
Text: To play, spot an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. Response: If your Uruk-hai wins a skirmish, remove [3] to make him fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Uruk-hai Sword
Lore: Their malevolent strength worsens the wounds from the gruesome weapons of the Uruks.
Text: Bearer must be an Uruk-hai. Each time bearer wins a skirmish, the Free Peoples player must discard the top card of his draw deck.

Name: Wariness
Lore: Even Hobbits have trouble evading the Uruk-hai.
Text: Search. Response: If a stealth event is played, exert or discard your Uruk-hai to cancel that event.

Name: Worry
Lore: 'One by one, regardless of their strength to good or evil... they fell.'
Text: To play, exert an Uruk-hai. Plays to your support area. Each time a companion or ally loses a skirmish involving an Uruk-hai, the opponent must choose to either exert the Ring-bearer or add a burden.

Name: Ancient Chieftain
Lore: ...a huge orc-chieftain, almost man-high, clad in black mail from head to foot, leaped into the chamber
Text: behind him his followers clustered in the doorway.
column19: For each other [MORIA] Orc you can spot, Ancient Chieftain is strength +1.

Name: Bitter Hatred
Lore: Bitter and long is the hatred of the Orcs for the Elves, and thus they prefer Elves as targets.
Text: Archery: Spot a [MORIA] archer to wound an Elf.

Name: Cave Troll of Moria, Scourge of the Black Pit
Lore: Frodo's quest nearly ended before his companions halted the Cave Troll's ferocious attack.
Text: Damage +1. Fierce. To play, spot a [MORIA] Orc. At an underground site, Cave Troll of Moria's twilight cost is -3.

Name: Cave Troll of Moria, Scourge of the Black Pit (T)
Lore: Frodo's quest nearly ended before his companions halted the Cave Troll's ferocious attack.
Text: Damage +1. Fierce. To play, spot a [MORIA] Orc. At an underground site, Cave Troll of Moria's twilight cost is -3.

Name: Cave Troll's Hammer
Lore: Suddenly the door burst into fragments and the Cave Troll was among them, his huge hammer striking like thunder.
Text: Bearer must be Cave Troll of Moria. Cave Troll of Moria is damage +1.

Name: Denizens Enraged
Lore: ...there came a great noise: a rolling Boom that seemed to come from depths far below, and to tremble in the stone at their feet.
Text: Skirmish: Make a [MORIA] Orc strength +1 for each other [MORIA] Orc you spot (limit +4).

Name: Drums in the Deep
Lore: The drum-beats broke out wildly: doomboom, doom-boom, and then stopped ... Doom, doom went the drum-beats again....
Text: Skirmish: Make a [MORIA] Orc strength +2 (or +4 if skirmishing a Dwarf).

Name: The End Comes
Lore: 'They have taken the Bridge and the second hall
Text: we have barred the gates -_but cannot hold them for long....'
column19: Assignment: Spot 5 [MORIA] minions to make the Free Peoples player assign the Ring-bearer to a skirmish.

Name: Fool of a Took!
Lore: 'Fool of a Took! Throw yourself in next time and rid us of your stupidity!'
Text: Shadow: Spot a Hobbit (except the Ring-bearer) to reveal cards from the top of your draw deck until you reveal one that is not a [MORIA] minion. Take the revealed cards into hand.

Name: Frenzy
Lore: The Goblins of the Misty Mountains, like all of their race, use their teeming numbers to slaughter their foes.
Text: Assignment: Assign an exhausted companion (except the Ring-bearer) to skirmish a [MORIA] Orc.

Name: Goblin Archer
Lore: An arrow whistled over Frodo's head.
Text: Archer. While you can spot another [MORIA] Orc, the fellowship archery total is -6.

Name: Goblin Armory
Lore: For scavenging vermin, the weapons of fallen foes are prized possessions.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time you play a [MORIA] weapon, add [1]. Response: If a [MORIA] Orc is about to take a wound, discard this condition to prevent that wound.

Name: Goblin Backstabber
Lore: An attack from behind provides a cowardly Goblin with a boldness much like courage.
Text: This minion is damage +2 while in the same skirmish as another [MORIA] Orc.

Name: Goblin Domain
Lore: The once beautiful kingdom of Khazaddûm has become Moria, the black pit.
Text: Search. To play, spot a [MORIA] minion. Plays to your support area. Each time a companion is played to site 4 or higher, that companion comes into play exhausted.

Name: Goblin Marksman
Notes: Italic text within parentheses is descriptive only, and has no added gameplay effect.
Lore: Arrows fell among them. One struck Frodo and sprang back. Another pierced Gandalf's hat and stuck there like a black feather.
Text: Archer.

Name: Goblin Patrol Troop
Lore: As they ran they heard the beat and echo of many hurrying feet behind. A shrill yell went up: they had been seen. There was a ring and clash of steel.

Name: Goblin Runner
Lore: ...a great horn was blown in the hall, and answering horns and harsh cries were heard further off. There was a hurrying sound of many feet.
Text: When you play this minion, you may add [2].

Name: Goblin Scavengers
Lore: 'The Orcs have often plundered Moria
Text: there is nothing left in the upper halls.'
column19: When you play this minion, you may play a weapon from your discard pile on your [MORIA] Orc.

Name: Goblin Scimitar
Lore: Some of the swords were crooked: orcscimitars with blackened blades.
Text: Bearer must be a [MORIA] Orc. When you play this possession, you may draw a card.

Name: Goblin Sneak
Lore: Their limber forms allow the Goblins of Moria to slither past barred doors and collapsed passageways.
Text: When you play this minion, you may place a [MORIA] Orc from your discard pile beneath your draw deck.

Name: Goblin Spear
Lore: Simple creatures with simple weapons can be as deadly as an armoured warrior with a fine sword.
Text: Bearer must be a [MORIA] minion. If bearer kills a companion in a skirmish, add 1 burden (or 2 burdens if that companion was a Hobbit).

Name: Goblin Swarms
Lore: Beyond the fire he saw swarming black figures....
Text: Plays to your support area. Response: If your [MORIA] Orc wins a skirmish, discard cards and wounds on that Orc and stack that Orc on this condition. Shadow: Play an Orc stacked here as if played from hand.

Name: Goblin Wallcrawler
Lore: Skittering along the walls of Moria, Goblins attack without warning.
Text: While at an underground site, this minion is strength +2. While you can spot another [MORIA] Orc, the fellowship archery total is -1.

Name: Goblin Warrior
Lore: The ancient enmity between Goblins and Dwarves burns brightly still.
Text: When you play this minion, you may discard a [DWARVEN] ally or [DWARVEN] condition.

Name: Guard Commander
Lore: His broad flat face was swart, his eyes were like coals, and his tongue was red....
Text: Skirmish: Remove [3] to make a [MORIA] Orc strength +2.

Name: Host of Thousands
Lore: Killing one is no victory, since a dozen from the warrens below will take his place.
Text: Shadow: Play a [MORIA] Orc from your discard pile.

Name: The Long Dark
Lore: 'So ended the attempt to retake Moria! It was valiant but foolish. The time is not come yet.'
Text: Plays to your support area. When the fellowship moves to site 4 or 5, add [2] for each Dwarf companion. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make your [MORIA] Orc strength +2.

Name: Lost to the Goblins
Lore: Dwarven graves stood open in plundered disarray.
Text: Response: If the Ring-bearer exerts or takes a wound, discard a card from the top of your draw deck for each [MORIA] minion you spot. For each Shadow card discarded in this way, add a burden (limit 3 burdens).

Name: Moria Axe
Lore: Goblins without scimitars wrest axes from the remains of fallen Dwarves.
Text: Bearer must be a [MORIA] Orc. Bearer is damage +1. Skirmish: Exert bearer to make him strength +2.

Name: Moria Scout
Lore: Like their kindred in the North, the Orcs of Moria have keen noses, often following their prey by scent.
Text: When you play this minion, spot an Elf to add [2].

Name: Pinned Down
Lore: Arrows whined and whistled down the corridor as he sprang back.
Text: Plays to your support area. While you can spot a [MORIA] archer, the fellowship archery total is -1.

Name: Plundered Armories
Notes: If a minion bearing a [MORIA] weapon is discarded due to losing a skirmish, Plundered Armories takes effect before optional actions triggered by winning/losing that skirmish occur. When an effect discards  "all " minions (thereby discarding their weapons), they are discarded at the same time. None of those minions may have weapons played on them with Plundered Armories.
Lore: The Goblins of Moria have oft plundered the deep armouries of Durin's folk.
