Text: Plays to your support area. Response: If your [MORIA] weapon is discarded, play it from your discard pile (that weapon's twilight cost is -1).

Name: Relentless
Lore: 'Then dig a hole in the ground,' said Legolas, 'if that is more after the fashion of your kind. But you must dig swift and deep, if you wish to hide from Orcs.'
Text: Search. Response: If a stealth event is played, spot 3 [MORIA] minions to cancel that event.

Name: Relics of Moria
Lore: By both the doors they could now see that many bones were lying, and among them were broken swords and axe-heads, and cloven shields and helms.
Text: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Remove [2] to play a [MORIA] possession from your discard pile.

Name: They Are Coming
Lore: 'The last thing written is in a trailing scrawl of elf-letters: they are coming.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Discard 3 cards from hand to play a [MORIA] Orc from your discard pile.

Name: Threat of the Unknown
Lore: The danger of what lay hidden in the dark was more terrifying than the known perils of Moria.
Text: Shadow: Exert your [MORIA] Orc to draw 2 cards.

Name: Through the Misty Mountains
Lore: 'One must tread the path that need chooses.'
Text: Search. To play, exert a [MORIA] minion. Plays to your support area. Each time the fellowship moves to site 4, 5, or 6 and contains a Dwarf or Elf, the Free Peoples player discards 2 cards at random from hand.

Name: Troll's Keyward
Lore: Though shorter than a Man, the Troll's Keyward is a deadly adversary.
Text: Cave Troll of Moria's twilight cost is -2.

Name: The Underdeeps of Moria
Lore: 'I am afraid Balin is buried deep, and maybe something else is buried there too.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Remove [3] to reveal the bottom card of your draw deck. If it is a [MORIA] Orc, take it into hand. Otherwise, discard it.

Name: Unfamiliar Territory
Lore: Knowing the dark terrain of Moria gives Orcs a strategic advantage when attacking their foes.
Text: Skirmish: Make a [MORIA] Orc strength +2 (or +4 if skirmishing an archer).

Name: What Is This New Devilry?
Lore: 'This foe is beyond any of you! Run!'
Text: Search. To play, exert a [MORIA] Orc. Plays to your support area. While the fellowship is at site 5 or higher, each companion's twilight cost is +2.

Name: All Blades Perish
Lore: '...all blades perish that pierce that dreadful King. More deadly to him was the name of Elbereth.'
Text: Response: If a Nazgul is about to take a wound, prevent that wound.

Name: All Veils Removed
Lore: 'Give up the Halfling...!'
Text: Skirmish: Make a Nazgul strength +2 (or +5 if the Ring-bearer wears The One Ring).

Name: Beauty Is Fading
Lore: '...the Three will fail, and many fair things will fade and be forgotten.'
Text: Maneuver: Exert a Nazgul to discard a Free Peoples possession or Free Peoples condition. If you can spot no such card, discard an ally or companion (except the Ring-bearer) instead.

Name: Bent on Discovery
Lore: The riding figure sat quite still.... From inside the hood came a noise as of someone sniffing....
Text: Search. Plays to your support area. At the beginning of each of your Shadow phases, draw 1 card. At the end of each of your Shadow phases, exert a Nazgul or discard this condition.

Name: Black Breath
Lore: Vile breath infects the living with Shadow.
Text: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Transfer this condition from your support area to a character skirmishing a Nazgul. Burdens and wounds may not be removed from bearer.

Name: Black Steed
Lore: '...these horses are born and bred to the service of the Dark Lord in Mordor.'
Text: Bearer must be a Nazgul. While at a plains site, bearer is strength +2. Discard this possession when at an underground site.

Name: Blade Tip
Text: Plays to your support area. Response: If your Nazgul wins a skirmish, transfer this condition from your support area to the losing character. Limit 1 per character. Wound bearer at the start of each fellowship phase. (If bearer is the Ring-bearer, add a burden instead )

Name: Dark Whispers
Lore: 'The Ring... The Ring... The Ring....'
Text: Skirmish: Spot 3 burdens to make a Nazgul strength +1 and damage +1, or spot 6 burdens to make a Nazgul strength +3 and damage +2.

Name: Drawn to Its Power
Notes: Version: *. Game text is a clarification.
Lore: 'And also the Ring drew them.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a companion is killed in a skirmish involving a Nazgul, add a burden.

Name: Fear
Lore: 'Never has such a thing happened in my time! ... Guests unable to sleep in their beds, and good bolsters ruined and all! What are we coming to?'
Text: Search. Maneuver: Exert your Nazgul to discard an ally.

Name: Frozen by Fear
Lore: ...he was quaking as if he was bitter cold, but his terror was swallowed up in a sudden temptation to put on the Ring.
Text: Skirmish: Make a Nazgul strength +2 (or +3 if the Ring-bearer is assigned to a skirmish that has not resolved).

Name: In the Ringwraith's Wake
Lore: 'He is fading.... We must get him to my father.'
Text: Response: If a Nazgul wins a skirmish, the Free Peoples player chooses to either exert the Ring-bearer or add a burden.

Name: The Master's Will
Lore: ...something seemed to be compelling him to disregard all warnings, and he longed to yield.
Text: Search. Shadow: Spot X Nazgul to reveal the top X cards of your draw deck. Take into your hand all [WRAITH] cards revealed and discard the rest.

Name: Morgul Blade
Lore: The gates of Minas Morgul issued Nine Riders into the free lands, a blasphemy to ancient kings.
Text: Bearer must be a Nazgul. This weapon may be borne in addition to 1 other hand weapon. Skirmish: Discard this possession to transfer Blade Tip from your support area or discard pile to a companion bearer is skirmishing.

Name: Morgul Gates
Text: Shadow: Play a Nazgul. His twilight cost is -2.

Name: Nazgul Sword
Lore: The weapons of the Nine are wielded by unseen hands willed by Sauron's hate.
Text: Bearer must be a Nazgul. While you can spot 3 burdens, bearer is damage +1.

Name: The Nine Servants of Sauron
Lore: 'That Black Rider was looking for something ... or someone - Frodo?'
Text: Search. Plays to your support area. Each time you play a Nazgul, you may exert a Hobbit (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: Not Easily Destroyed
Lore: 'They were Kings... great Kings of Men. Sauron gave to them Nine Rings of Power and with them the promise of eternal rule... unending life.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Maneuver or Skirmish: Remove [3] to heal a Nazgul.

Name: The Pale Blade
Lore: In his wretched grip, the Captain raised a Pale Sword.
Text: Bearer must be The Witch-king. He is damage +1. Response: If The Witch-king wins a skirmish, exert him to discard a Free Peoples condition.

Name: Paths Seldom Trodden
Notes: This card can replace sites only in the Fellowship block format.
Lore: 'You will have to leave the open road after tonight
Text: for the horsemen will watch it night and day.'
column19: Search. To play, spot a Nazgul. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Remove [3] to replace the fellowship's site with your version of the same site.

Name: Relentless Charge
Lore: Even the fastest arrows are of no avail against the Black Steeds of the Nine Riders.
Text: Maneuver: Exert a Nazgul to wound every archer companion.

Name: Return to Its Master
Notes: This card creates a skirmish in addition to regular and fierce skirmishes.
Lore: 'The Riders made straight for you....'
Text: Response: If the Ring-bearer wears The One Ring at the end of a skirmish phase, cancel all remaining assignments and assign a Nazgul to skirmish the Ring-bearer
column19: The One Ring's game text does not apply during this skirmish.

Name: Sword of Minas Morgul
Lore: The Morgul hilt seared the flesh that would touch it, but the pierce was painless.
Text: Bearer must be Ulaire Lemenya. He is damage +1. Skirmish: Exert Ulaire Lemenya to discard a possession borne by a character he is skirmishing.

Name: Their Power Is in Terror
Lore: 'In dark and loneliness they are strongest... and already some in Bree are in their clutch.'
Text: Maneuver: Exert a Nazgul to wound every ally.

Name: Threshold of Shadow
Lore: 'They did not need the guidance of their horses any longer: you had become visible to them....'
Text: Skirmish: Make a Nazgul strength +2 (or +4 if you spot 5 burdens).

Name: The Twilight World
Lore: Immediately, though everything else remained as before, dim and dark, the shapes became terribly clear. He was able to see beneath their black wrappings.
Text: Response: If Ring-bearer puts on The One Ring, exert a Nazgul to add 2 burdens.

Name: Ulaire Attea, Keeper of Dol Guldur
Lore: Those that knew the most power as kings were placed in particular ways for the Will of Sauron.
Text: Fierce. Skirmish: Remove [1] to make Ulaire Attea strength +1 (limit +5).

Name: Ulaire Cantea, Lieutenant of Dol Guldur
Lore: The Ringwraith has no semblance to the Man, its being passed into twilight, life spirit into void.
Text: Fierce. Skirmish: Exert Ulaire Cantea to discard a weapon borne by a character he is skirmishing.

Name: Ulaire Enquea, Lieutenant of Morgul
Lore: The Nine Riders were embodiments of Sauron's will, searching all of Middle-earth for his prize.
Text: Fierce. Maneuver: Spot 6 companions (or 5 burdens) and exert Ulaire Enquea to wound a companion (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: Ulaire Enquea, Lieutenant of Morgul (T)
Lore: The Nine Riders were embodiments of Sauron's will, searching all of Middle-earth for his prize.
Text: Fierce. Maneuver: Spot 6 companions (or 5 burdens) and exert Ulaire Enquea to wound a companion (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: Ulaire Lemenya, Lieutenant of Morgul
Lore: 'Do you wish them to find you? They are terrible!'
Text: Each companion or ally who bears a [WRAITH] condition is strength -2.

Name: Ulaire Nelya, Lieutenant of Morgul
Notes: Lists: EXL. This card can replace sites only in the Fellowship block format.
Lore: Many of the Nine were princes of majesty and power.
Text: Fierce. Shadow: Exert Ulaire Nelya and spot an opponent's site to replace it with your site of the same number.

Name: Ulaire Nertea, Messenger of Dol Guldur
Notes: Lists: MXL. If two or more minions are played, the Shadow player decides in what order those minions are played.
Lore: Some accepted Sauron's gift for glory and a notion of great deeds.
Text: When you play Ulaire Nertea, for each companion over 4, you may play 1 minion from your discard pile.

Name: Ulaire Otsea, Lieutenant of Morgul
Notes: Card title and game text are errata. Image fixed
Lore: ...under their mantles were long grey robes
Text: upon their grey hairs were helms of silver
column19: in their haggard hands were swords of steel.
column20: Shadow: Exert Ulaire Otsea to make a [WRAITH] minion fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Ulaire Toldea, Messenger of Morgul
Lore: 'Open, in the name of Mordor!' said a voice thin and menacing.
Text: Fierce. Assignment: Spot 4 burdens to assign a companion (except the Ring-bearer) to skirmish Ulaire Toldea.

Name: The Witch-king, Lord of Angmar
Lore: ...his hair was long and gleaming and on his helm was a crown.
Text: Fierce. For each other Nazgul you can spot, The Witch-king is strength +2.

Name: The Witch-king, Lord of Angmar (T)
Lore: ...his hair was long and gleaming and on his helm was a crown.
Text: Fierce. For each other Nazgul you can spot, The Witch-king is strength +2.

Name: Wreathed in Shadow
Lore: They are beings in twilight, without form to catch the points of weapons.
Text: To play, spot a Nazgul. Plays to your support area. Archery: Remove [1] to make the fellowship archery total -1.

Name: All Thought Bent on It
Lore: '...for the Ring yearns, above all else, to return to the hand of its Master: they are one....'
Text: Search. Maneuver: Spot a [SAURON] Orc and 5 companions to make the Free Peoples player exert a companion for each companion over 4.

Name: Band of the Eye
Lore: Far more Orcs has Sauron bred in the pits under Barad-dûr than Saruman could ever imagine.
Text: Response: If this minion wins a skirmish, remove [2] to make the Free Peoples player discard a card at random from hand.

Name: Curse From Mordor
Lore: The Dark Lord harbors an ancient hatred for descendants of Gil-galad and those that marched with his gleaming host.
Text: Shadow: Spot a [SAURON] Orc to discard an [ELVEN] condition.

Name: The Dark Lord's Summons
Lore: Orcs obey the Dark Lord unquestioningly.
Text: Search. To play, spot a [SAURON] Orc. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Remove [3] to reveal the top card of your draw deck. If it is a [SAURON] card, take it into hand. Otherwise, discard it and one other card from hand.

Name: Despair
Lore: 'The Nameless Enemy has arisen again. Smoke rises once more from Orodruin that we call Mount Doom.'
Text: Maneuver: If the total number of burdens and companions in the dead pile is at least 12, spot a [SAURON] Orc to corrupt the Ring-bearer.

Name: Desperate Defense of the Ring
Lore: The Company must defend the Ring at all costs.
Text: To play, exert a [SAURON] Orc. Plays on a companion. Each time bearer is assigned to a skirmish, the Free Peoples player chooses to either discard 3 cards from hand or add a burden.

Name: Desperate Measures
Lore: 'Go back, Sam. You can't swim. I'm going to Mordor alone.'
Text: Maneuver: Spot a [SAURON] Orc and remove a burden to make the Free Peoples player discard top 5 cards from his draw deck.

Name: Enduring Evil
Lore: 'The Dark Tower was broken, but its foundations were not removed
Text: for they were made with the power of the Ring, and while it remains they will endure.'
column19: Skirmish: Spot X burdens to make a character skirmishing a [SAURON] Orc strength -X.

Name: Enheartened Foe
Lore: Orcs feed on their own success. The greater their exploits in battle, the greater their confidence grows.
Text: Response: If a [SAURON] Orc wins a skirmish, make that Orc fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Forces of Mordor
Lore: '....the Dark Lord is not without allies. The Easterlings and Haradrim now pay tribute to Mordor.'
Text: Shadow: Spot X [SAURON] minions to add (X).

Name: Gleaming Spires Will Crumble
Lore: Gondor has long been a target for the wrath of Sauron the Great.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each [SAURON] Orc skirmishing a [GONDOR] character is strength +2. Discard this condition if your [SAURON] Orc loses a skirmish.

Name: Hate
Lore: Orcs are filled with hatred not only for their foes, but for all that lives.
Text: Maneuver: Exert a [SAURON] Orc to wound a companion (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: A Host Avails Little
Notes: If you can spot 7 or more companions, you may wound the same companion more than once.
Lore: 'Had I a host of Elves in armour of the Elder Days, it would avail little....'
Text: Search. Maneuver: Spot a [SAURON] Orc and 6 companions to wound a companion (except the Ring-bearer). Do this once for each companion over 5.

Name: The Irresistible Shadow
Lore: Once more the desire to slip on the Ring came over Frodo
Text: but this time it was stronger than before.
column19: To play, exert a [SAURON] Orc. Plays to your support area. If you can spot 5 burdens and the Free Peoples player has no cards in his or her draw deck, the Ring-bearer is corrupted.

Name: Journey Into Danger
Lore: 'I do not foretell, for all foretelling is now vain: on the one hand lies darkness, on the other only hope.'
Text: Search. To play, exert a [SAURON] Orc. Plays to your support area. While you can spot 5 companions, each companion's twilight cost is +2.

Name: Mordor Enraged
Lore: The armies of Elendil and Gil-galad inflamed Sauron's anger and hatred.
Text: Plays on a [SAURON] minion. Shadow: Exert bearer to add [1] for each archer companion.

Name: Mordor's Strength
Lore: 'It should have ended that day, but evil was allowed to endure.'
Text: Skirmish: Exert a [SAURON] Orc to wound a character he is skirmishing.

Name: Morgul Hunter
Lore: Sauron's hatred lives in the hearts of his minions.
Text: For each companion you can spot, this minion is strength +1.

Name: Morgul Hunter (T)
Lore: Sauron's hatred lives in the hearts of his minions.
Text: For each companion you can spot, this minion is strength +1.

Name: Morgul Skirmisher
Lore: The Orcs of Mordor, heartened by the promise of blood and plunder, are dangerous foes in battle.
Text: Maneuver: Remove [3] to exert a Hobbit (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: Morgul Skulker
Lore: Sly servants of the Ringwraiths of Morgul Vale, Morgul Orcs are alert to the desires of their masters.
Text: When you play this minion, you may shuffle up to 2 [WRAITH] cards from your discard pile into your draw deck.

Name: Morgul Warden
Lore: With blind devotion, the Orcs of Mordor follow orders issued from the Dark Tower.
Text: For each other [SAURON] Orc you can spot, Morgul Warden is strength +1.

Name: The Number Must Be Few
Lore: 'The number must be few, since your hope is in speed and secrecy.'
Text: Search. Plays to your support area. While you can spot 7 companions, the move limit for this turn is -1 (to a minimum of 1).

Name: Orc Ambusher
Notes: This Fellowship of the Ring card was misprinted in the Gimli Mines of Moria starter deck. The word  "non-native " should be  "roaming.  "
Lore: 'Orcs will often pursue foes for many leagues....'
Text: Tracker. The roaming penalty for each [SAURON] minion you play is -1. Response: If a Free Peoples regroup event is played, exert this minion to cancel that event.

Name: Orc Assassin
Notes: This Fellowship of the Ring card was misprinted in the Gimli Mines of Moria starter deck. The word  "non-native " should be  "roaming.  "
Text: Tracker. The roaming penalty for each [SAURON] minion you play is -1. Assignment: Spot 2 Hobbit companions to make the Free Peoples player assign a Hobbit to skirmish this minion.

Name: Orc Banner
Lore: Tribes of Orcs from throughout Mordor rally to the banner of the Dark Tower.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a companion or ally loses a skirmish that involves a [SAURON] Orc, each [SAURON] Orc is strength +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Orc Bowmen
Lore: Where volleys of Orcish arrows fly, the defenders of the West fall.
Text: Plays to your support area. While you can spot a [SAURON] Orc, add 1 to the minion archery total.

Name: Orc Butchery
Lore: For sport, Orcs hew cruelly at the bodies of those they slay.
Text: Response: If a companion is killed by a [SAURON] Orc, the Free Peoples player must discard 3 cards from the top of his draw deck for each card in the dead pile.

Name: Orc Chieftain
Lore: Orc chieftains are the most cruel of a heartless race. Both strength and malice are needed to lead such followers.
Text: When you play a weapon on this minion, add [2] (limit once per turn).

Name: Orc Hunters
Lore: Bred for battle, Sauron's soldiers live for the thrill of the fight - and the spoils of victory.
Text: Skirmish: Exert this minion to wound a character he is skirmishing.

Name: Orc Inquisitor
Lore: Cruel questioners of Mordor tore the secret from poor Gollum, that Sauron's most prized possession once again was found.
Text: When you play this minion, you may make the Free Peoples player discard a card at random from hand.

Name: Orc Scimitar
Lore: An Orc's weapon reflects his passion for war and cruelty.
Text: Bearer must be a [SAURON] Orc. Skirmish: Remove [1] to make bearer strength +1 (limit +3).

Name: Orc Scouting Band
Lore: The cunning ambushes of the Orc armies rely upon scouts first finding the enemy.
Text: Tracker. The roaming penalty for each [SAURON] minion you play is -1. Skirmish: Exert this minion to wound a character it is skirmishing.

Name: Orc Soldier
Lore: Bearing cruel weapons, Orcs go forth from Mordor to serve the Eye.
Text: Skirmish: Exert this minion to wound a character he is skirmishing.

Name: Orc War Band
Lore: Sauron has countless armies of Orcs at his disposal.
Text: Skirmish: Exert this minion to wound a character it is skirmishing.

Name: The Ring's Oppression
Lore: The Ring that hung upon its chain about his neck grew heavy, heavier than a great stone, and his head was dragged downwards.
Text: Response: If a [SAURON] Orc kills a companion, add 1 burden (or 3 if the Ring-bearer wears The One Ring).

Name: Sauron's Defenses
Lore: Sauron's minions are everywhere. Few roads escape the gaze of the Lidless Eye.
Text: To play, exert [SAURON] a Orc. Plays to your support area. While there are 3 or more companions in the dead pile, the move limit for this turn is -1 (to a minimum of 1).

Name: Seeking It Always
Lore: '...the only measure that he knows is desire, desire for power
Text: and so he judges all hearts.'
column19: Search. Plays to your support area. Response: If a stealth event is played, exert a [SAURON] tracker to cancel that event.

Name: Seeking Its Master
Lore: 'This at least is plain: the evil of the Ring is already at work even in the Company, and the Ring must leave them before it does more harm.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Exert a [SAURON] Orc and remove [2] to draw a card.

Name: Shadow's Reach
Lore: 'Is it secret? Is it safe?'
Text: Shadow: Exert a [SAURON] Orc to discard a Free Peoples condition.

Name: Strength Born of Fear
Lore: Fear of death in Barad-dûr's dungeons spurs Mordor's servants to even greater savagery.
Text: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Remove [3] to make a [SAURON] Orc strength +1.

Name: Thin and Stretched
Lore: 'I am old, Gandalf. I don't look it....'
Text: To play, exert a [SAURON] Orc. Plays on the Ring-bearer. Add a burden at the end of each turn during which bearer was not assigned to a skirmish (and another companion was).

Name: Tower Lieutenant
Lore: Sauron shows favour to those in his dungeons with the ambition to squeeze the information he needs from those caught spying out his borders.
Text: Each time this minion wins a skirmish, the Free Peoples player discards 2 cards at random from hand.

Name: Under the Watching Eye
Lore: What the Lidless Eye of Sauron does not see, his countless minions observe and report.
Text: Search. To play, exert a [SAURON] tracker. Plays to your support area. Each time the fellowship moves, the Free Peoples player must exert a companion.

Name: The Weight of a Legacy
Lore: 'It is because of Men, the Ring survives .... I was there the day the strength of Men failed.'
Text: To play, exert a [SAURON] Orc. Plays on Aragorn.

Name: You Bring Great Evil
Lore: 'And what is this? We have not had dealings with the Dwarves since the Dark Days.'
Text: To play, spot a [SAURON] Orc. Plays on a companion (except an Elf). While at a sanctuary, bearer cannot heal.

Name: Bilbo, Retired Adventurer
Notes: Card title is an erratum. Image fixed
Lore: '...I don't suppose I have the strength or luck left to deal with the Ring. It has grown, and I have not.'
Text: Fellowship: Exert Bilbo to shuffle a [SHIRE] card from your discard pile into your draw deck.

Name: Bilbo's Pipe
Lore: Bilbo has a fine pipe, carved for him by his Dwarven friends.
Text: Bearer must be a Hobbit. Fellowship: Discard a pipeweed possession and spot X pipes to shuffle X tales from your discard pile into your draw deck.

Name: Bounder
Lore: 'Aye, reckon we're in for a quiet night ... mind how you go.'
Text: Skirmish: Exert this ally to prevent a Hobbit from being overwhelmed unless that Hobbit's strength is tripled.

Name: Extraordinary Resilience
Lore: 'Don't despair!' said Strider. 'You must trust me now. Your Frodo is made of sterner stuff than I had guessed....'
Text: Response: If the Ring-bearer is about to heal, remove a burden instead.

Name: Farmer Maggot, Chaser of Rascals
Lore: 'Old Maggot is really a stout fellow - if you leave his mushrooms alone.'
Text: Fellowship: Exert Farmer Maggot to heal Merry or Pippin.

Name: Frodo, Old Bilbo's Heir
Lore: 'But be that as it may, Mr. Frodo is as nice a young hobbit as you could wish to meet.'
Text: Ring-bearer (resistance 10). At the start of each of your turns, you may heal a Hobbit ally.

Name: Frodo, Son of Drogo
Lore: 'I think you'll find there's more to this Hobbit than meets the eye.'
Text: Ring-bearer (resistance 10). Fellowship: Exert another companion who has the Frodo signet to heal Frodo.

Name: The Gaffer, Sam's Father
Lore: No one had a more attentive audience than old Ham Gamgee, commonly known as the Gaffer. He held forth at The Ivy Bush, a small inn on the Bywater road
Text: and he spoke with some authority, for he had tended the garden at Bag End for forty yea
column19: Fellowship: Exert The Gaffer to heal Frodo or Sam.

Name: The Gaffer's Pipe
Lore: 'This ... is the one art that we certainly claim to be our own invention. When Hobbits first began to smoke is not known....'
Text: Bearer must be a Hobbit. Fellowship: Discard a pipeweed possession and spot X pipes to remove (X).

Name: Halfling Deftness
Lore: ...though they are inclined to be fat and do not hurry unnecessarily, they are nonetheless nimble and deft in their movements.
Text: Skirmish: Exert a Hobbit to make him strength +3.

Name: Hobbit Appetite
Lore: 'What about Elevenses, Luncheon, Afternoon Tea and Supper - he knows about them, doesn't he?'
Text: Fellowship: Add (X) to heal a Hobbit companion X times.

Name: Hobbit Farmer
Lore: '...where our hearts truly lie is in peace and quiet and good-tilled earth....'
Text: While you can spot your site 1, this ally has the game text of that site. Fellowship: Exert this ally and spot opponent's site 1 to replace it with your site 1.

Name: Hobbit Intuition
Lore: 'What? That were just a little detour, that's all ... a shortcut.'
Text: Stealth. Skirmish: At sites 1 to 4, cancel a skirmish involving a Hobbit. At any other site, make a Hobbit strength +3.

Name: Hobbit Party Guest
Lore: 'More promising still (to the hobbits' mind): an enourmous open-air kitchen was erected....'
Text: At the start of each of your turns, heal this ally. Fellowship: Exert this ally to heal another Hobbit ally whose home is site 1.

Name: Hobbit Stealth
Lore: They possessed from the first the art of disappearing swiftly and silently, when large folk whom they do not wish to meet come blundering by....
Text: Stealth. Skirmish: At sites 1 to 5, cancel a skirmish involving a Hobbit. At any other site, make a Hobbit strength +2.

Name: Hobbit Sword
Lore: 'Strap these on....'
Text: Bearer must be a Hobbit.

Name: Longbottom Leaf
Lore: Longbottom Leaf is the pipeweed enjoyed by most Hobbits throughout the Shire.
Text: Pipeweed. Plays to your support area. When you play this possession, you may discard up to 2 cards from hand.

Name: Master Proudfoot, Distant Relative of Bilbo
Lore: His name, of course, was Proudfoot, and well merited
Text: his feet were large, exceptionally furry....
column19: Fellowship: If the twilight pool has fewer than 3 twilight tokens, add [2] to reveal the top 3 cards of your draw deck. Take all [SHIRE] cards revealed into hand and discard the rest.

Name: Merry, Friend to Sam
Lore: 'We're coming too! You'll have to send us home tied up in a sack to stop us!'
Text: Skirmish: If Merry is not assigned to a skirmish, exert him twice to add his strength to another companion.

Name: Merry, From O'er the Brandywine
Lore: 'I don't know why he's so upset, it's only a few carrots ... my point is, he's overreacting.'
Text: While Merry bears a weapon, he is strength +2.

Name: Noble Intentions
Lore: 'You carry the fate of us all, little one .... If this is indeed the will of the Council, then Gondor will see it done.'
Text: Skirmish: Exert a companion (except a Hobbit) to make a Hobbit strength +3.

Name: Old Toby
Lore: Bilbo's favorite pipeweed is Old Toby, the finest weed in the Southfarthing.
Text: Pipeweed. Plays to your support area. When you play this possession, you may draw a card.

Name: Pippin, Friend to Frodo
Lore: 'Baggins? Sure I know a Baggins - Frodo's my second cousin once-removed, on his mother's side and my third cousin twice-removed on his father's side, if you follow me.'
Text: Your opponent may not discard your [SHIRE] tales from play.

Name: Pippin, Hobbit of Some Intelligence
Lore: 'Anyway, you need people of intelligence on this sort of mission... quest... thing.'
Text: When you play Pippin, remove a burden or wound from a companion.

Name: Power According to His Stature
Lore: 'The ring had given him power according to his stature.'
Text: Skirmish: Add 1 burden to wound each minion skirmishing the Ring-bearer.

Name: Rosie Cotton, Hobbiton Lass
Lore: 'Go on Sam, ask Rosie for a dance.'
Text: Sam is strength +1. Fellowship: Exert Rosie Cotton to heal Sam.

Name: Sam, Faithful Companion
Lore: 'Mr. Frodo's not going anywhere without me!'
Text: Fellowship: Play Bill the Pony from your draw deck. Response: If Frodo dies, make Sam the Ring-bearer (resistance 5).

Name: Sam, Son of Hamfast
Lore: 'Oh, I've never held a girl's hand before. I ... I think I might just have myself another ale.'
Text: Fellowship: Exert Sam to remove a burden. Response: If Frodo dies, make Sam the Ring-bearer (resistance 5).

Name: Sorry About Everything
Lore: 'I am sorry that I brought this upon you ... sorry you must carry this burden.'
Text: Fellowship: Exert a Hobbit companion to remove a burden.

Name: Sting
Lore: 'This is Sting .... Take it, if you like.'
Text: Bearer must be Frodo. Fellowship or Regroup: Exert Frodo to reveal an opponent's hand. Remove [1] for each Orc revealed (limit [4]).

Name: Stone Trolls
Lore: For a couple o' pins,' says Troll, and grins, / 'I'll eat thee too, and gnaw thy shins. / A bit o' fresh meat will go down sweet!'
Text: Tale. To play, spot Bilbo. Plays on any character. Limit 1 per character. Each time bearer skirmishes a Troll or Uruk-hai, bearer is strength +3.

Name: Stout and Sturdy
Lore: 'You have a stout heart, little hobbit, but your courage alone will not save you.'
Text: Maneuver or Skirmish: Heal a Hobbit.

Name: A Talent for Not Being Seen
Lore: With their small size, Hobbits use any hole to hide in, and their trail is difficult to detect.
Text: Stealth. To play, exert a Hobbit. Plays to your support area. Each time the fellowship moves, spot 2 Hobbit companions to make the shadow number -1 (or spot 4 to make it -2).

Name: There and Back Again
Lore: 'So there I was - at the mercy of three monstrous trolls....'
Text: Tale. Bearer must be a Hobbit companion. Maneuver: Discard this condition to make each Hobbit companion strength +2 until the regroup phase.

Name: Thror's Map
Lore: Bilbo still keeps a map of Erebor, the Lonely Mountain, as a memento of his journey with the Dwarves many years ago.
Text: Plays to your support area. Fellowship or Regroup: Exert 2 Hobbits and discard Thror's Map to play the fellowship's next site (replacing opponent's site if necessary).

Name: Bag End
Text: Fellowship: Exert a Hobbit to play The Gaffer from your draw deck.

Name: East Road
Text: Each companion's twilight cost is +2

Name: Farmer Maggot's Fields
Text: Fellowship: Exert a Hobbit to play Merry or Pippin from your draw deck.

Name: Green Dragon Inn
Text: Fellowship: Exert a Hobbit to play Sam from your draw deck.

Name: Green Hill Country
Text: The twilight cost of each Hobbit is -1.

Name: The Prancing Pony
Text: Fellowship: Add a burden to play Aragorn from your draw deck.

Name: Shire Lookout Point
Text: Fellowship: Spot Gandalf to play Gandalf's Cart from your draw deck.

Name: Westfarthing
Text: Fellowship: Exert a Hobbit to play a companion or ally
column19: that character's twilight cost is -1.

Name: Bree Gate
Text: While you can spot a ranger, the move limit is +1 for this turn.

Name: Bree Streets
Text: The roaming penalty for each Nazgul you play to Bree Streets is -2.

Name: Breeland Forest
Text: Forest. Stealth events may not be played.

Name: Buckleberry Ferry
Text: River. While only Hobbits are in the fellowship, there are no assignment and skirmish phases at Buckleberry Ferry.

Name: Ettenmoors
Notes: Version: *. Game text is a clarification.
Text: Plains. Skirmish: Exert your companion or minion to make that character strength +2.

Name: Midgewater Marshes
Text: Marsh. Each time a Hobbit moves to Midgewater Marshes, that Hobbit must exert.

Name: Midgewater Moors
Text: Plains. Each time a minion is played, the Free Peoples player discards a card from hand.

Name: Trollshaw Forest
Text: Forest. Each time you play a possession or artifact on your companion, draw a card.

Name: Weatherhills
Text: Each Nazgul's twilight cost is -1.

Name: Weathertop
Text: Each Nazgul at Weathertop is fierce.

Name: Council Courtyard
Text: Sanctuary. When the fellowship moves from Council Courtyard, remove [2].

Name: Ford of Bruinen
Text: River. Sanctuary. The twilight cost of the first Nazgul played to Ford of Bruinen each turn is -5.

Name: Frodo's Bedroom
Text: Sanctuary. Fellowship: Play a Hobbit to draw a card.

Name: Rivendell Terrace
Text: Sanctuary. Fellowship: Play a Man to draw a card.

Name: Rivendell Valley
Text: Sanctuary. Fellowship: Play an Elf to draw a card.

Name: Rivendell Waterfall
Text: Forest. Sanctuary. While you can spot a ranger at Rivendell Waterfall, the move limit is +1 for this turn.

Name: Balin's Tomb
Text: Underground. Maneuver: Discard your tale from play or from hand to heal your companion.

Name: Dwarrowdelf Chamber
Text: Underground. When the fellowship moves to Dwarrowdelf Chamber, Gimli or 2 other companions must exert.

Name: Mithril Mine
Text: Underground. Shadow: Remove [1] to play a Shadow weapon from your discard pile.

Name: Moria Lake
Text: Marsh. When the fellowship moves to Moria Lake, Frodo or 2 other companions must exert.

Name: Moria Stairway
Text: Underground. Each companion and minion bearing a hand weapon is damage +1.

Name: Pass of Caradhras
Text: Mountain. Shadow: Spot a [ISENGARD] minion to play a weather card from your draw deck (limit one per turn).

Name: The Bridge of Khazad-dum
Text: Underground. Shadow: Play The Balrog from your draw deck or hand
column19: The Balrog's twilight cost is -6.

Name: Dimrill Dale
Text: Sanctuary. The twilight cost of the first [MORIA] Orc played each Shadow phase is -2.

Name: Galadriel's Glade
Text: Sanctuary. Fellowship: Exert an Elf to look at an opponent's hand.

Name: Lothlorien Woods
Text: Forest. Sanctuary. Each ally whose home is site 6 is strength +3.

Name: Anduin Confluence
Text: River. When the fellowship moves to Anduin Confluence, discard every ally.

Name: Anduin Wilderland
Text: Forest. River. While the fellowship is at Anduin Wilderland, skip the archery phase.

Name: Silverlode Banks
Text: River. When the fellowship moves to Silverlode Banks without a ranger, every companion must exert.

Name: Anduin Banks
Text: River. For each companion in the fellowship over 4, add 2 to the minion archery total.

Name: Brown Lands
Text: River. For each minion archer at Brown Lands, the minion archery total is +1 (limit +4).

Name: Pillars of the Kings
Text: River. Fellowship: Discard a [GONDOR] card from hand to heal a [GONDOR] companion.

Name: Shores of Nen Hithoel
Text: River. Shadow: Spot 5 Orc minions to prevent the fellowship from moving again this turn.

Name: Emyn Muil
Notes: Version: *. Game text is a clarification.
Text: Maneuver: Exert your minion to make that minion fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Slopes of Amon Hen
Text: The twilight cost of each [ISENGARD] minion is -1.

Name: Summit of Amon Hen
Text: When the fellowship moves to Summit of Amon Hen, each Shadow player may draw a card for each burden.

Name: Tol Brandir
Text: River. Shadow: Play up to 3 trackers from your discard pile
column19: end your Shadow phase.

Name: Gandalf, The Grey Wizard
Lore: ...his long white hair, his sweeping silver beard, and his broad shoulders, made him look like some wise king of ancient legend.
Text: Fellowship: Exert Gandalf to play a companion who has the Gandalf signet. The twilight cost of that companion is -2.

Name: Aragorn, King in Exile
Lore: 'He turned from that path a long time ago. He has chosen exile....'
Text: Ranger. At the start of each of your turns, you may heal another companion who has the Aragorn signet.

Name: The Lord of the Rings, Trading Card Game (M)
Notes: Oversized. Decipher, Inc. is proud to present... The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game. Coming November 6th, 2001.

Name: The Lord of the Rings, Trading Card Game (M)
Notes: Oversized. Release schedule for the first nine sets: 1. The Fellowship of the Ring - November 2001. 2. Mines of Moria - March 2002. 3. Realms of the Elf-lords - July 2002. 4. The Two Towers - November 2002. 5. Battle of Helm's Deep - March 2003. 6. Ents of Fangorn - July 2003. 7. The Return of the King - November 2003. 8. Siege of Gondor - March 2004. 9. Mount Doom - July 2004

Name: Lurtz, Servant of Isengard (M)
Text: Archer. Damage +1. Maneuver: Spot another Uruk-hai to make Lurtz fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Beneath the Mountains
Lore: 'There forged was blade, and bound was hilt
Text: / The delver mined, the mason built.'
column19: Tale. Plays to your support area. Fellowship: Discard the top 3 cards from your draw deck to play a [DWARVEN] weapon from your discard pile.

Name: Disquiet of Our People
Lore: 'Ah, alas!...When will the day come of our revenge?'
Text: Maneuver: Exert a Dwarf to make that Dwarf defender +1 (or defender +2 if you spot an Orc) until the regroup phase.

Name: Dwarven Bracers
Lore: Dwarven-smiths forge bracers for fit and agility.
Text: Bearer must be a Dwarf. Response: If bearer is about to take a wound, discard this possession to prevent that wound.

Name: Endurance of Dwarves
Lore: 'Dwarves too can go swiftly, and they do not tire sooner than Orcs.'
Text: Bearer must be a Dwarf. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make bearer strength +1.

Name: Flurry of Blows
Lore: With a second axe, a warrior of Erebor can parry on either flank and counter quickly.
Text: Skirmish: Make a Dwarf strength +2 (or +4 and damage +1 if bearing 2 hand weapons).

Name: Fror, Gimli's Kinsman
Lore: It appeared that amid the splendour of their works of hand the hearts of the Dwarves of the Lonely Mountain were troubled.
Text: To play, spot a Dwarf. While skirmishing an Uruk-hai, Fror is strength +3.

Name: Gloin, Friend to Thorin
Lore: 'But what then would happen, if the Ruling Ring were destroyed, as you counsel?'
Text: For each [DWARVEN] tale you can spot, Gloin is strength +1 (limit +4).

Name: Golden Light on the Land
Lore: 'The Orcs will not, maybe, come out till after dusk, but we must be far away before nightfall.'
Text: To play, spot a Dwarf. Plays to your support area. At a site which is not underground, each [MORIA] Orc's twilight cost is +2. Discard this condition during the regroup phase.

Name: Great Works Begun There
Lore: 'Moria! Moria!... Long have its vast mansions lain empty since the children of Durin fled.'
Text: Tale. Plays to your support area. Each time you play a Dwarf, you may discard the top 2 cards from your draw deck to take a [DWARVEN] event into hand from your discard pile.

Name: Hand Axe
Lore: Their captain rallied two other orcs to attack. In answer, Gimli's side axe brought him down.
Text: Bearer must be a Dwarf. This weapon may be borne in addition to 1 other hand weapon. Archery: Discard this weapon to make the fellowship archery total +1.

Name: Make Light of Burdens
Lore: A Dwarf does not readily notice the weight on his back, or in his heart.
Text: Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Exert a Dwarf companion and discard the top 3 cards from your draw deck to discard either a Shadow condition from a Dwarf or a weather condition.

Name: Realm of Dwarrowdelf
Lore: 'There must have been a mighty crowd of dwarves here... and every one of them busier than badgers....'
Text: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Discard the top 3 cards from your draw deck to make a Dwarf strength +1 (limit +3) and, if underground, damage +1 (limit +3).

Name: Tidings of Erebor
Lore: '...we have so far been fortunate, though we do not escape the shadow of these times.'
Text: Regroup: Spot a Dwarf to draw 3 cards. Any Shadow player may remove [3] to prevent this.

Name: Till Durin Wakes Again
Lore: Gimli was silent. Having sung his song, he would say no more.
Text: Tale. Plays to your support area. Each time a Dwarf companion moves from an underground site, you may heal that Dwarf.

Name: What Are We Waiting For?
Notes: If a second copy of this card is played and that Shadow player has already chosen to skip his or her next Shadow phase, that player may choose to skip the same Shadow phase again (which has no effect).
Lore: 'It is not despair, for despair is only for those who see the end beyond all doubt.'
Text: Fellowship: Exert a Dwarf to make an opponent draw 2 cards. That player then chooses to either discard 2 Shadow cards from hand or skip his or her next Shadow phase.

Name: A Blended Race
Lore: '...he has been doing something to them.... For these Isengarders are more like wicked Men.'
Text: To play, spot an Elf. Plays to your support area. Each Uruk-hai is strength -2 and loses all damage bonuses. Discard this condition during the regroup phase.

Name: Dismay Our Enemies
Lore: Reeling from the bite of an arrow, the Cave Troll became enraged trying to strike the nimble Elf.
Text: Response: If an Elf archer wins a skirmish, make an opponent choose a minion to discard. That opponent may remove [3] to prevent this.

Name: Hosts of the Last Alliance
Lore: '...many great princes and captains were assembled.'
Text: Tale. Plays to your support area. While you can spot an Elf companion, the minion archery total is -1. Response: If an Elf is about to take a wound, discard this condition to prevent that wound.

Name: Release the Angry Flood
Lore: The three Riders that were still in the midst of the Ford were overwhelmed.... Their piercing cries were drowned in the roaring of the river as it carried them away.
Text: Maneuver: Exert an Elf to wound each Nazgul once (or twice if at a river).

Name: Secret Sentinels
Lore: 'Yet so little faith and trust do we find now in the world beyond LothlÃ³rien... that we dare not by our own trust endanger our land.'
Text: Maneuver: Exert an Elf ally to discard a condition (or 2 conditions if you spot an Orc).

Name: Erland, Advisor to Brand
Lore: 'They are good folk the Bardings. The grandson of Bard the Bowman rules them, Brand son of Bain son of Bard.'
Text: To play, spot Gandalf. Shadow players may not look at or reveal cards in your hand.

Name: Gandalf's Staff
Lore: As the wizard passed on ahead up the great steps, he held his staff aloft, and from its tip there came a faint radiance.
Text: Bearer must be Gandalf. The twilight cost of each [GANDALF] spell is -1. Skirmish: Exert Gandalf twice to cancel a skirmish involving him.

Name: Gandalf's Wisdom
Lore: Now as the companions sat or walked together they spoke of Gandalf, and all that each had known and seen of him came clear before their minds.
Text: Plays to your support area. The twilight cost of each possession or artifact played on Gandalf or a character who has the Gandalf signet is -1.

Name: Hugin, Emissary from Laketown
Lore: Several wise Bardings were sent to Elrond to tell of the Dark Lord's new offer.
Text: To play, spot Gandalf. Fellowship: Exert Hugin to reveal a Free Peoples card from your discard pile and place it beneath your draw deck.

Name: Jarnsmid, Merchant from Dale
Lore: The Men of Dale freely traded with the Dwarves of the Lonely Mountain for fine metalwork.
Text: To play, spot Gandalf. Each time you play a shield, armor, helm, or hand weapon, its twilight cost is -1.

Name: Speak  "Friend " and Enter
Lore: Picking up his staff he stood before the rock and said in a clear voice: Mellon!
Text: Fellowship or Regroup: Spot Gandalf to play the fellowship's next site (replacing opponent's site if necessary). Draw a card if you play an underground site.

Name: Staff Asunder
Lore: At that moment Gandalf lifted his staff, and crying aloud he smote the bridge before him.
Text: Spell. Skirmish: Discard a staff Gandalf is bearing and then exert him twice to discard a minion he is skirmishing.

Name: Wielder of the Flame
Lore: The Balrog made no answer. The fire in it seemed to die, but the darkness grew.
Text: Spell. Maneuver: Spot Gandalf to make a companion defender +1 until the regroup phase. Any Shadow player may remove [3] to prevent this.

Name: Wizard Staff
Lore: 'We must have power - power to order things as we will for that Good which only the Wise can see.'
Text: Bearer must be a Wizard. Skirmish: Exert bearer twice to make a minion strength -3.

Name: You Cannot Pass!
Lore: The Balrog fell back and its sword flew up in molten fragments. The wizard swayed on the bridge, stepped back a pace, and then again stood still.
Text: Spell. Maneuver: Spot Gandalf bearing a staff to prevent a minion from being fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Blood of Numenor
Lore: 'I do not know what strength is in my blood, but I swear to you - I will not let the White City fall....'
Text: To play, exert a [GONDOR] companion. Plays to your support area. Each [SAURON] Orc comes into play exhausted. Skip the archery phase. Discard this condition during the regroup phase.

Name: Flaming Brand
Lore: ...a glimpse of Strider leaping out of the darkness with a flaming brand of wood in either hand.
Text: Bearer must be a Man. This weapon may be borne in addition to 1 other hand weapon. Bearer is strength +2 and damage +1 while skirmishing a Nazgul.

Name: Flee in Terror
Lore: Aragorn smote to the ground the captain that stood in his path, and the rest fled in terror of his wrath.
Text: Response: If a [GONDOR] companion wins a skirmish, discard an exhausted Orc. That minion's owner may remove [3] to prevent this.

Name: Gondor Will See It Done
Lore: 'Boromir!... Go after those two young hobbits, and guard them at the least, even if you cannot find Frodo.'
Text: Response: If a companion is about to take a wound, exert a [GONDOR] companion to prevent that wound.

Name: Natural Cover
Lore: The tree, the bough, the leaf. To a ranger, these are all defenses against the enemy.
Text: To play, spot a ranger. Plays to your support area. While the fellowship is at a forest, the minion archery total is -2.

Name: No Mere Ranger
Lore: 'If by my life or death, I can protect you, I will....'
Text: Skirmish: Exert Aragorn to make another companion strength +2 (or +3 if that companion has the Aragorn signet).

Name: Sentinels of Numenor
Lore: ...they still preserved through the suns and rains of forgotten years the mighty likenesses in which they had been hewn.
Text: Skirmish: Make a [GONDOR] companion strength +2 (or +4 if in a fierce skirmish).

Name: Shield of Boromir
Lore: Boromir bore the heirlooms of the Steward's house with pride.
Text: Bearer must be a [GONDOR] companion. The minion archery total is -1. If bearer is Boromir, each minion skirmishing him does not gain strength bonuses from weapons.

Name: Beyond the Height of Men
Lore: 'Whom do you serve?'
Text: Maneuver: Exert an Uruk-hai to discard an armor possession, helm possession, or shield possession (or all such Free Peoples possessions if you can spot 6 companions).

Name: Demands of the Sackville-Bagginses
Lore: In the middle of the commotion, the Sackville-Bagginses arrived.
Text: To play, spot an [ISENGARD] minion. Plays to your support area. Each time a [SHIRE] ally exerts, add [1].

Name: Evil Afoot
Lore: 'It is not the Eastern Shore I am worried about. A shadow and a threat has been growing in my mind. Something draws near, I can feel it.'
Text: Shadow: Exert an Uruk-hai and spot X burdens to shuffle X minions from your discard pile into your draw deck.

Name: Goblin Man
Lore: 'He looks more than half like a goblin.'
Text: Discard this minion if underground. Shadow: Exert this minion to look at the Free Peoples player's hand.

Name: Lurtz's Sword
Lore: The Uruk giant laid down his bow and drew a broad-bladed weapon.
Text: Bearer must be Lurtz. He is damage +1. Each time Lurtz wins a skirmish, the Free Peoples player must discard the top 2 cards of his or her draw deck.

Name: No Business of Ours
Lore: 'Goblins? Cobblers! Far-off tales and children's stories, that's all that is!'
Text: To play, spot an [ISENGARD] minion. Plays to your support area. The Free Peoples player may not look at or reveal cards in any Shadow player's hand.

Name: Too Much Attention
Lore: 'A little more caution from you - that is not a trinket you carry.'
Text: Response: If the Ring-bearer puts on The One Ring, spot an [ISENGARD] minion to make the Free Peoples player discard the top 5 cards of his or her draw deck.

Name: Uruk Captain
Lore: The captains marched the Uruk-hai to the great river without halting.
Text: Damage +1. Shadow: Remove [1] and exert Uruk Captain to play an Uruk-hai from your discard pile.

Name: Uruk Scout
Notes: The special ability of this minion may only cancel an event that specifically requires a ranger in its game text.
Lore: Forward Uruk troops caught the fellowship unaware.
Text: Tracker. Damage +1. The roaming penalty for each [ISENGARD] minion you play is -1. Response: If an event is played that spots or exerts a ranger, exert this minion to cancel that event.

Name: Wizard Storm
Lore: There was a black look in the sky, and the sun was wan. The wind had gone now round to the north-east.
Text: Spell. Weather. To play, exert an [ISENGARD] minion. Plays on a site. Limit 1 per site. When the fellowship moves from this site, every companion must exert. Discard this condition at the end of the turn.

Name: Archer Commander
Lore: Their commander led the Goblin bowmen to the highest rise across the gap.
Text: Archer. Each other [MORIA] archer is strength +2.

Name: The Balrog's Sword
Lore: In its right hand was a blade like a stabbing tongue of fire....
Text: Bearer must be The Balrog. It is damage +1. This weapon may be borne in addition to 1 other hand weapon.

Name: The Balrog, Durin's Bane
Lore: 'Indeed I saw upon the bridge that which haunts our darkest dreams....'
Text: Damage +1. Fierce. While you can spot The Balrog, discard all other minions. Skip the archery phase. Discard The Balrog if not underground.

Name: The Balrog, Flame of Udun
Lore: ...suddenly it drew itself up to a great height, and its wings were spread from wall to wall....
Text: Damage +1. Fierce. To play, spot a [MORIA] Orc. Discard The Balrog if not underground. Shadow: Exert The Balrog and remove [2] to play a [MORIA] Orc from your discard pile.

Name: The Balrog, Flame of Udun (T)
Lore: ...suddenly it drew itself up to a great height, and its wings were spread from wall to wall....
Text: Damage +1. Fierce. To play, spot a [MORIA] Orc. Discard The Balrog if not underground. Shadow: Exert The Balrog and remove [2] to play a [MORIA] Orc from your discard pile.

Name: Cave Troll's Chain
Notes: When an exhausted Cave Troll, armed with the Cave Troll's Chain, takes its last wound during the archery phase, the Chain cannot be used to wound an archer companion (since the wound is a required action and takes effect before the Chain can be used).
Lore: 'They have a Cave Troll!'
Text: Bearer must be Cave Troll of Moria. The Free Peoples player may choose for the archery phase to be skipped. Each time Cave Troll of Moria takes a wound during the archery phase, you may wound an archer companion.

Name: Dark Fire
Lore: ...he seemed small, and altogether alone: grey and bent, like a wizened tree before the onset of a storm.
Text: To play, spot The Balrog. Plays on Gandalf. Each time the fellowship moves, Gandalf must exert.

Name: Dark Places
Notes: This card can replace sites only in the Fellowship block format.
Lore: 'There is some new devilry here... devised for our welcome, no doubt.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each unique [MORIA] minion is strength +1. Shadow: Spot an opponent's site to replace it with your marsh or underground site of the same number.

Name: Fill With Fear
Lore: He drew, but his hand fell, and the arrow slipped to the ground. He gave a cry of dismay and fear.
Text: Plays to your support area. While you can spot The Balrog, skip the archery phase. Maneuver: Exert The Balrog to discard a ranged weapon.

Name: Final Cry
Lore: ...it swung its whip, and the thongs lashed and curled about the wizard's knees, dragging him to the brink.
Text: Response: If a skirmish that involved The Balrog bearing Whip of Many Thongs is about to end, wound a companion in that skirmish twice.

Name: Foul Tentacle
Lore: Its fingered end had hold of Frodo's foot, and was dragging him into the water.
Text: Tentacle. When you play this minion, you may play a tentacle from your draw deck. This minion may not bear possessions and is discarded if not at a marsh.

Name: Foul Things
Lore: 'Something has crept, or has been driven out of dark waters under the mountains.'
Text: Shadow: Play a [MORIA] minion from your discard pile.

Name: Goblin Bowman
Lore: The crude arrows of the Goblins served notice of the dangers of Moria.
Text: Archer.

Name: Goblin Flankers
Lore: 'There are Orcs, very many of them.... And some are large and evil....'
Text: When you play this minion, you may add [3] if the fellowship has moved more than once this turn.

Name: Goblin Pursuer
Lore: Had the fellowship remained in Dimrill Dale, pursuers from Moria would have overwhelmed them.
Text: If the fellowship has moved more than once this turn, this minion is strength +3.

Name: Goblin Reinforcements
Lore: 'We don't have a moment! Come nightfall these hills will swarm with Orcs!'
Text: When you play this minion, you may heal a [MORIA] minion.

Name: Goblin Scrabbler
Lore: Orcs were as keen as hounds on a scent, it was said, but they could also climb.
Text: When you play this minion, you may discard an [ELVEN] condition. The roaming penalty for each [MORIA] Orc you play is -1.

Name: Goblin Spearman
Lore: ...with the speed of a striking snake, he charged into the Company and thrust with his spear....
Text: While bearing a Goblin Spear, this minion is damage +2.

Name: Huge Tentacle
Lore: Out from the water a long sinuous tentacle had crawled
Text: it was pale-green and luminous and wet.
column19: Tentacle. Damage +1. When you play this minion, you may play Watcher in the Water from your draw deck. This minion may not bear possessions and is discarded if not at a marsh.

Name: Moria Archer Troop
Lore: Most of the Goblin arrows flew harmlessly into the chasm, but there were so many!
Text: Archer. While you can spot another [MORIA] archer, add 1 to the minion archery total.

Name: Must Do Without Hope
Lore: His enemy halted again, facing him, and the shadow about it reached out like two vast wings.
Text: Maneuver: Exert The Balrog to add a burden.

Name: Old Differences
Lore: 'I'll be dead before I see the Ring in the hands of an Elf!'
Text: Skirmish: Make an Elf or Dwarf skirmishing a [MORIA] Orc strength -1 (or -3 if you spot an Elf and a Dwarf).

Name: Power and Terror
Lore: The ranks of the orcs had opened, and they crowded away, as if they themselves were afraid.
Text: Shadow: Reveal any number of [MORIA] Orcs from your hand to play The Balrog. Its twilight cost is -2 for each Orc revealed.

Name: Throw Yourself in Next Time
Lore: 'This is a serious journey, not a hobbit walking-party....Now be quiet!'
Text: To play, spot a [MORIA] Orc. Plays on a Hobbit companion. Bearer may be exerted only by Shadow cards.

Name: Troubled Mountains
Lore: 'The Dimrill Dale is full of vapour and clouds of smoke....There are noises in the deeps of the earth.'
Text: Shadow: Exert a [MORIA] minion and spot X burdens to add (X) (limit [5]).

Name: Watcher in the Water, Keeper of Westgate
Lore: The dark water boiled... there was a hideous stench.
Text: Damage +1. While you can spot Watcher in the Water, discard all other minions (except tentacles). Each tentacle is strength +2 and damage +1. This minion may not bear possessions and is discarded if not at a marsh.

Name: Whip of Many Thongs
Lore: It raised the whip, and the thongs whined and cracked.
Text: Bearer must be The Balrog. Skirmish: Exert The Balrog to discard a helm, shield, or armor borne by a character The Balrog is skirmishing.

Name: Bill Ferny, Swarthy Sneering Fellow
Lore: '...as for Ferny, he would sell anything to anybody
Text: or make mischief for amusement.'
column19: Nazgul are not roaming. The Free Peoples player may not assign a character to skirmish Bill Ferny. Discard Bill Ferny if underground.

Name: Helpless
Lore: He heard Frodo's voice, but it seemed to come from a great distance, or from under the earth, crying out strange words.
Text: To play, spot Frodo and a Nazgul. Plays on Sam. Sam's game text does not apply.

Name: His Terrible Servants
Lore: '...in the dark they perceive many signs and forms that are hidden from us: then they are most to be feared.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Response: If a twilight Nazgul is about to take a wound, remove [1] to prevent that wound.

Name: It Wants to be Found
Lore: ...perhaps it had tried to reveal itself in response to some wish or command that was felt in the room.
Text: Maneuver: Spot a twilight Nazgul to add a burden.

Name: Resistance Becomes Unbearable
Lore: Not with the hope of escape, or of doing anything, either good or bad: he simply felt that he must take the Ring and put it on his finger.
Text: Maneuver: Exert a twilight Nazgul to exert the Ring-bearer.If the Ring-bearer is then exhausted, he puts on The One Ring until the regroup phase.

Name: Stricken Dumb
Lore: He felt his tongue cleave to his mouth and his heart labouring. His sword broke and fell out of his shaking hand.
Text: Maneuver: Exert The Witch-king to discard a tale or weapon.

Name: They Will Find the Ring
Lore: ...to the dismay of Frodo and his friends out from the trees and rocks away on the left four other Riders came flying.
Text: Maneuver: Exert 2 Nazgul and spot X burdens to exert X companions.

Name: Ulaire Attea, The Easterling
Lore: 'They had words with Harry at Westgate on Monday.... He was white and shaking when they left him.'
Text: Twilight. When you play Ulaire Attea, you may wound an ally.

Name: Ulaire Enquea, Ringwraith in Twilight
Lore: In their white faces burned keen and merciless eyes....
Text: Twilight. Each time Ulaire Enquea wins a skirmish, you may exert him to wound the Ring-bearer once (or twice if you spot 5 burdens).

Name: Ulaire Nelya, Ringwraith in Twilight
Lore: Over the lip of the little dell, on the side away from the hill, they felt, rather than saw, a shadow rise, one shadow or more than one.
Text: Twilight. While you can spot 2 burdens or 2 wounds on the Ring-bearer, Ulaire Nelya is fierce and damage +1.

Name: The Witch-king, Lord of the Nazgul
Lore: 'A great king and sorcerer he was of old, and now he wields a deadly fear.'
Text: Twilight. Return to Its Master may not be played. Each time The Witch-king wins a skirmish, you may exert him to wound the Ring-bearer twice.

Name: Wraith-world
Lore: 'He is passing into the shadow world, he will soon become a wraith like them.'
Text: Skirmish: Spot a twilight Nazgul and the Ring-bearer wearing The One Ring to add 3 burdens.

Name: The Eye of Sauron
Lore: '...he has indeed arisen again and left his hold in Mirkwood and returned to his ancient fastness in the Dark Tower of Mordor.'
Text: Shadow: Exert a [SAURON] Orc and spot X burdens to draw X cards (limit 5).

Name: Memory of Many Things
Lore: 'But my memory reaches back even to the Elder Days.... I have seen three ages in the West of the world, and many defeats, and many fruitless victories.'
Text: Maneuver: Exert a [SAURON] Orc to discard an ally (or 2 [ELVEN] allies).

Name: Orc Scout
Notes: The special ability of this minion may only cancel an event that specifically requires a ranger in its game text.
Lore: 'Orc!...Not very near, and yet too near, it seems.'
Text: Tracker. The roaming penalty for each [SAURON] minion you play is -1. Response: If an event is played that spots or exerts a ranger, exert or discard this minion to cancel that event.

Name: Orc Taskmaster
Lore: An Orc acts when the taskmaster promises reward or the whip.
Text: Shadow: Exert this minion to add [1].

Name: Southern Spies
Lore: 'They will know all the news now, for they have visited Bill Ferny
Text: and probably that Southerner was a spy as well.'
column19: Response: If the Ring-bearer puts on The One Ring, spot a [SAURON] minion to make the Free Peoples player discard his or her hand.

Name: Spies of Mordor
Lore: 'Mordor Orcs patrol the Eastern Shore. We must wait for the cover of darkness.'
Text: Search. To play, spot a [SAURON] Orc. Plays to your support area. Each time the fellowship moves during the regroup phase, you may draw a card (or 2 cards if you spot a [SAURON] tracker).

Name: Tower Assassin
Lore: A Ring of Power would not stop the blade of an assassin lying in wait.
Text: Maneuver: Exert Tower Assassin to wound an ally.

Name: Verily I Come
Lore: There was an eye in the Dark Tower that did not sleep. He knew that it had become aware of his gaze.
Text: To play, exert a [SAURON] Orc. Plays on the Ring-bearer. Each time the Free Peoples player draws a card (or takes a card into hand) during the fellowship phase, add a burden.

Name: Vile Blade
Lore: The blood of enemies slain that day blackened the edge of the commander's blade.
Text: Bearer must be a [SAURON] Orc. Bearer is strength +2 while skirmishing a Man or Elf.

Name: Bilbo, Well-spoken Gentlehobbit
Notes: Card title is an erratum. Image fixed
Lore: ...as Mr. Baggins was generous with his money, most people were willing to forgive him his oddities and his good fortune.
Text: Fellowship: Exert Bilbo and discard a tale to discard a Shadow condition from an opponent's support area.

Name: Consorting With Wizards
Lore: 'He wasn't always this peculiar! When I were a lad, old Bilbo was a most respectable Hobbit.'
Text: Tale. Bearer must be Bilbo. Bilbo may not take wounds (except during the archery phase). Fellowship or Regroup: Exert Bilbo or discard this condition to remove [1].

Name: Dear Friends
Lore: He pressed him for news of himself and of the wide world... and they stayed up far into the night.
Text: Fellowship: Exert a companion to place a Free Peoples card from your discard pile beneath your draw deck (or 2 Free Peoples cards if that companion has the Frodo signet).

Name: Deft in Their Movements
Lore: They possessed from the first the art of disappearing swiftly and silently, when large folk who they do not wish to meet come blundering by.
Text: Stealth. Regroup: Spot 2 Hobbits to make each site's Shadow number -2 until the end of the turn.

Name: Fearing the Worst
Lore: 'Even if we are allowed to leave Bree unhindered, we can hardly hope now to leave it unnoticed.'
Text: Stealth. To play, exert 2 Hobbits. Plays to your support area. The twilight cost of each search card and each tracker is +2.

Name: Filibert Bolger, Wily Rascal
Lore: Filibert knows paths and tracks that few have trodden. He is not adventurous by nature, but his escapades often require rapid departures.
Text: Skirmish: Exert a Hobbit companion twice to cancel a fierce skirmish involving that Hobbit.

Name: Frodo, Reluctant Adventurer
Lore: 'I am not made for perilous quests. I wish I had never seen the Ring! Why did it come to me? Why was I chosen?'
Text: Ring-bearer (resistance 10). The cost of each artifact, possession, and [SHIRE] tale played on Frodo is -1.

Name: Frodo, Reluctant Adventurer (T)
Lore: 'I am not made for perilous quests. I wish I had never seen the Ring! Why did it come to me? Why was I chosen?'
Text: Ring-bound. Ring-bearer. The cost of each artifact, possession, and [SHIRE] tale played on Frodo is -1.

Name: Hobbit Sword-play
Lore: Boromir sensed that a blade in a Halfling's hand would surprise a larger foe.
Text: Maneuver: Exert a Hobbit bearing a weapon to wound a minion. That minion's owner may remove [3] to prevent this.

Name: Merry, Horticulturalist
Lore: 'Ow... I think I've broken somehing.'
Text: Fellowship: Exert Merry to play Farmer Maggot from your draw deck.

Name: Mithril-coat
Lore: '...its worth was greater than the value of the whole Shire and everything in it.'
Text: Bearer must be Frodo. The minion archery total is -1. Each minion skirmishing Frodo does not gain strength bonuses from weapons and loses all damage bonuses.

Name: Mithril-coat (T)
Lore: '...its worth was greater than the value of the whole Shire and everything in it.'
Text: Bearer must be Frodo. The minion archery total is -1. Each minion skirmishing Frodo does not gain strength bonuses from weapons and loses all damage bonuses.

Name: Nice Imitation
Lore: 'Very life-like!... But what will happen when they have penetrated the disguise?'
Text: Stealth. Plays to your support area. Response: If a Hobbit is about to take a wound, discard this condition to prevent that wound.

Name: Not Feared in Sunlight
Lore: '...our shapes cast shadows in their minds, which only the noon sun destroys....'
Text: To play, spot 2 Hobbits. Plays to your support area. Each Nazgul is strength -4. Discard this condition during the regroup phase.

Name: O Elbereth! Gilthoniel!
Notes: As skirmishes involving the Ring-bearer cannot be cancelled, the skirmish action of this condition can only be used to take off The One Ring.
Lore: With a last effort Frodo... slipped the Ring from his finger and closed his right hand tight upon it.
Text: Tale. Bearer must be the Ring-bearer. Skirmish: Discard this condition to take off The One Ring or to cancel a skirmish involving the Ring-bearer and a Nazgul.

Name: Orc-bane
Lore: Glamdring shone with a pale light, and Sting glinted at the edges.
Text: Maneuver: Spot Sting or Glamdring and exert its bearer X times to wound X Orcs or X Uruk-hai.

Name: Pippin, Mr. Took
Lore: Pippin was evidently much enjoying the attention he was getting, and had become quite forgetful of their danger.
Text: Fellowship: Play Gandalf or Aragorn
column19: his twilight cost is -2.

Name: Practically Everyone Was Invited
Lore: Thank you, I shall certainly come.
Text: Fellowship: Exert Bilbo to play a Hobbit from your draw deck.

Name: A Promise
Lore: 'But I'm glad Sam. I cannot tell you how glad. Come along! It is plain that we were meant to go together.'
Text: Plays to your support area. While you can spot Frodo and Sam and neither is exhausted, each is strength +1.

Name: Red Book of Westmarch
Lore: 'Don't adventures ever have an end? I suppose not. Someone else always has to carry on the story.'
Text: Tale. Plays to your support area. Each time you play a tale, you may spot Bilbo to draw a card.

Name: Sam, Proper Poet
Lore: 'First he was a conspirator, now he's a jester. He'll end up by becoming a wizard - or a warrior!'
Text: Maneuver: Exert Sam twice to make him defender +1 until the regroup phase. Response: If Frodo dies, make Sam the Ring-bearer (resistance 5).

Name: Hobbiton Party Field
Text: Fellowship: Exert a Hobbit to play Bilbo from your draw deck.

Name: Hobbiton Woods
Text: Forest. Fellowship: Exert a Hobbit to play your site 2 (replacing opponent's site if necessary).

Name: Town Center
Text: Fellowship: Play a [SHIRE] ally to draw a card.

Name: Great Chasm
Text: Underground. The twilight cost of the first [MORIA] archer played each Shadow phase is -2.

Name: Hollin
Text: Plains. Uruk-hai are not roaming.

Name: Valley of the Silverlode
Text: River. Sanctuary. When the fellowship moves to Valley of the Silverlode, each Hobbit companion may heal.

Name: Gimli, Dwarf of the Mountain-race
Lore: 'In the ruins of the Dwarves, a dwarf's head will be less easy to bewilder than Elves or Men or Hobbits.'
Text: Damage +1. Each underground site's Shadow number is -2.

Name: Gandalf, The Grey Pilgrim
Lore: 'When evening in the Shire was grey / his footsteps on the Hill were heard
Text: / before the dawn he went away / on journey long without a word.'
column19: At the start of each of your turns, you may draw a card.

Name: The Witch-king, Lord of the Nazgul (M)
Text: Twilight. Return to Its Master may not be played. Each time The Witch-king wins a skirmish, you may exert him to wound the Ring-bearer twice.

Name: Frodo, Reluctant Adventurer (M)
Text: Ring-bearer (resistance 10). The cost of each artifact, possession, and [SHIRE] tale played on Frodo is -1.

Name: Sam, Proper Poet (M)
Text: Maneuver: Exert Sam twice to make him defender +1 until the regroup phase. Response: If Frodo dies, make Sam the Ring-bearer (resistance 5).

Name: Gimli, Dwarf of the Mountain-race (M)
Text: Damage +1. Each underground site's Shadow number is -2.

Name: Book of Mazarbul
Lore: 'It seems to be a record of the fortunes of Balin's folk....'
Text: Tale. Bearer must be a Dwarf. At the start of each fellowship phase when the fellowship is at site 4 or higher, you may draw a card for each Dwarf companion.

Name: Gimli's Pipe
Lore: 'And certainly it was from Bree that the art of smoking the genuine weed spread in the recent centuries among Dwarves and such other folk....'
Text: Bearer must be Gimli. Fellowship: Exert Gimli to add 1 to the number of pipes you can spot.

Name: Mines of Khazad-Dum
Lore: 'Moria! Moria! Wonder of the Northern world!'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time you play a [DWARVEN] tale, you may heal a Dwarf companion.

Name: A Royal Welcome
Lore: 'There is even a chance that Dwarves are there, and that in some deep hall of his fathers, Balin son of Fundin may be found.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Regroup: Exert a Dwarf ally to heal a Dwarf companion.

Name: Song of Durin
Lore: No harp is wrung, no hammer falls: / The darkness dwells in Durin's halls....
Text: Tale. To play, exert a Dwarf. Plays to your support area. The twilight cost of each [MORIA] weapon is +2. Fellowship: Discard this condition to discard up to 2 [MORIA] conditions.

Name: Storm of Argument
Lore: 'I will be dead before I see the Ring in the hands of an Elf!'
Text: Fellowship: Reveal a card at random from an opponent's hand. Shuffle up to X [DWARVEN] cards from your discard pile into your draw deck, where X is the twilight cost of the card revealed.

Name: Arwen, Elven Rider
Lore: 'If I can cross the river, the power of my people will protect him.'
Text: Ranger. Response: If the Ring-bearer is about to take a wound, discard 3 cards from hand to prevent that wound.

Name: Arwen, Lady Undomiel
Lore: Queenly she looked, and thought and knowledge were in her glance, as of one who has known many things that the years bring.
Text: While you can spot 3 [ELVEN] allies whose home is site 3, each minion skirmishing Arwen is strength -3.

Name: Beren and Luthien
Lore: 'Tinúviel! Tinúviel! / He called her by her elvish name
Text: / And there she halted listening.'
column19: Tale. Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Exert an [ELVEN] ally to discard the bottom card of your draw deck. If that card is an [ELVEN] card, make a minion skirmishing an Elf strength -1.

Name: Calaglin, Elf of Lorien
Lore: 'We have been keeping watch on the rivers, ever since we saw a great troop of Orcs going north toward Moria....'
Text: Archer. Regroup: Exert Calaglin to wound a minion.

Name: Cast It Into the Fire!
Lore: 'It should have been cast then into Orodruin's fire nigh at hand where it was made.'
Text: Maneuver: Spot an Elf to make each opponent discard a card from his or her hand. Draw a card for each card discarded in this way.

Name: Dinendal, Silent Scout
Lore: He was almost certain that he could hear stealthy movements.... Not Elves
Text: for the woodland folk were altogether noiseless in their movements.
column19: Archer. Regroup: Exert Dinendal to remove [2].

Name: Elrond, Herald to Gil-galad
Lore: Venerable he seemed as a king crowned with many winters, and yet hale as a tried warrior....
Text: At the start of each of your turns, you may spot an ally whose home is site 3 to heal that ally twice. Regroup: Exert Elrond twice to heal a companion.

Name: Erestor, Chief Advisor to Elrond
Lore: 'Then there are but two courses... to hide the Ring for ever, or to unmake it.'
Text: To play, spot an Elf. Response: If an Elf is about to take a wound from a [SAURON] minion or [SAURON] event, exert Erestor to prevent that wound.

Name: Forests of Lothlorien
Lore: 'Alas for Lothlórien that I love! It would be a poor life in a land where no mallorn grew.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time the fellowship moves, you may spot 3 [ELVEN] allies to wound a minion.

Name: Friends of Old
Lore: 'You have been summoned here to answer the threat of Mordor.'
Text: Fellowship: Reveal a card at random from an opponent's hand. Heal X [ELVEN] allies, where X is the twilight cost of the card revealed.

Name: Galadriel, Lady of the Golden Wood
Lore: 'There is in her and in this land no evil, unless a man bring it hither himself. Then let him beware!'
Text: At the start of each of your turns, you may heal an Elf. Fellowship: Exert Galadriel to play the fellowship's next site if it is a forest (replacing opponent's site if necessary).

Name: Galdor, Councilor From the West
Lore: 'My heart tells me that Sauron will expect us to take the western way, when he learns what has befallen. He soon will.'
Text: To play, spot an Elf. Regroup: Exert Galdor and spot a minion to return that minion to its owner's hand.

Name: Gift of the Evenstar
Lore: 'It is mine to give to whom I will... like my heart.'
Text: To play, spot Arwen. Bearer must be Aragorn. Skirmish: Exert Aragorn or discard 2 cards from hand to make a minion skirmishing Aragorn strength -1.

Name: Golradir, Councilor of Imladris
Lore: Their stay at Rivendell provided the Fellowship with counsel from many sources.
Text: To play, spot an Elf. Skirmish: Exert Golradir to make an Orc strength -1.

Name: Long-knives of Legolas
Lore: Sharp, bone-handled knives defend the Elves of Mirkwood at close quarters.
Text: Bearer must be Legolas. Each Orc or Uruk-hai skirmishing Legolas is strength -2.

Name: Master of Healing
Lore: 'Elrond has cured you: he has tended you for days, ever since you were brought in.'
Text: Fellowship or Regroup: Spot Elrond (or 2 [ELVEN] allies) to heal a companion or ally.

Name: Nenya
Lore: 'Verily it is in the land of Lórien upon the finger of Galadriel that one of the Three remains. This is Nenya, the Ring of Adamant, and I am its keeper.'
Text: Bearer must be Galadriel. At the start of each regroup phase, you may discard up to 2 cards from hand to draw the same number of cards.

Name: Phial of Galadriel
Lore: 'May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out. Remember Galadriel and her Mirror!'
Text: To play, exert an Elf. Bearer must be the Ring-bearer. Bearer's resistance is +2.

Name: Saelbeth, Elven Councilor
Lore: The wisdom of Saelbeth prepared the Company for the dangers they would face.
Text: To play, spot an Elf. Skirmish: Exert Saelbeth to make an Uruk-hai strength -1.

Name: Something Draws Near
Lore: 'We have hunted and slain many Orcs in the woods....'
Text: Fellowship or Maneuver: Exert an Elf to discard an [ISENGARD] possession or [ISENGARD] artifact.

Name: Vilya
Lore: Upon his finger was a ring of gold with a great blue stone, Vilya, mightiest of the Three.
Text: Bearer must be Elrond. Maneuver: Exert Elrond twice and spot a Shadow condition to return that condition to its owner's hand.

Name: Voice of Nimrodel
Lore: 'Beside the falls of Nimrodel, / By water clear and cool, / Her voice as falling silver fell / Into the shining pool.'
Text: Tale. Skirmish: Exert an Elf at a river or forest to cancel a skirmish involving that Elf.

Name: Betrayal of Isengard
Lore: 'There is only one Lord of the Ring.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time an opponent draws a card (or takes a card into hand) during the Shadow phase, you may remove [1]. Maneuver: Exert Gandalf to wound Saruman twice.

Name: Deep in Thought
Lore: He was... trying to recall every memory of his former journey in the Mines, and considering anxiously the next course that he should take....
Text: Spell. Maneuver: Spot Gandalf and 4 twilight tokens to discard all Shadow conditions.

Name: Depart Silently
Lore: 'Be careful, both of you.'
Text: Stealth. Maneuver: At sites 1 to 5, spot Gandalf to prevent Hobbits from being assigned to skirmishes until the regroup phase. At any other site, spot Gandalf to make a Hobbit strength +3 until the regroup phase.

Name: Fireworks
Lore: 'The finest rockets ever seen: / they burst in stars of blue and green....'
Text: Spell. Fellowship: Spot Gandalf to shuffle up to 2 [GANDALF] or up to 2 [SHIRE] cards from your discard pile into your draw deck.

Name: His First Serious Check
Lore: ...a false turn now might be disastrous.
Text: Maneuver: Spot Gandalf to reveal a card at random from an opponent's hand. You may add (X) to discard that card, where X is the twilight cost of the card revealed.

Name: Narya
Lore: 'For this is the Ring of Fire, and with it you may rekindle hearts in a world that grows chill.'
Text: Bearer must be Gandalf. At the start of each of your turns, you may add [3] to remove a burden.

Name: Trust Me as You Once Did
Lore: 'Do not take me for some conjurer of cheap tricks! I am not trying to rob you. I am trying to help you.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Exert Gandalf to make a companion strength +1 for each companion with the Gandalf signet you can spot (limit +3).

Name: Unknown Perils
Lore: Suddenly he stopped as if listening. Frodo became aware that all was very quiet, inside and outside.
Text: Plays to your support area. Response: If a companion is about to take a wound, spot 4 twilight tokens and exert Gandalf to prevent that wound.

Name: Answering the Cries
Lore: Drawing his bright sword and crying Elendil! Elendil! he crashed through the trees.
Text: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Discard a [GONDOR] tale from hand to make a [GONDOR] companion strength +2.

Name: Aragorn, Heir to the White City
Lore: '...his hood was cast back, and his dark hair was blowing in the wind, a light was in his eyes: a king returning from exile in his own land.'
Text: Ranger. Each time the fellowship moves during the fellowship phase, remove [2].

Name: Banner of the White Tree
Lore: 'Many Elves and many mighty Men, and many of their friends, had perished in the war.'
Text: Tale. Maneuver: Exert a [GONDOR] companion to make that companion strength +3 and defender +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Citadel of Minas Tirith
Lore: 'One day our paths will lead us there, and the Tower guards shall take up the call - The Lords of Gondor have returned.'
Text: Plays to your support area. You may heal a [GONDOR] companion at the end of each turn during which no companion or ally lost a skirmish.

Name: Gondor Bowmen
Lore: Arrows of the Last Alliance brought death to Sauron's forces.
Text: Tale. Plays to your support area. Archery: Exert a [GONDOR] companion and discard this condition to make the fellowship archery total +2.

Name: Horn of Boromir
Lore: On a baldric he wore a great horn tipped with silver....
Text: Bearer must be Boromir. Maneuver: Exert Boromir and spot an ally. Until the regroup phase, that ally is strength +3 and participates in archery fire and skirmishes.

Name: Might of Numenor
Lore: 'But the lords of Minas Tirith still fight on....'
Text: Tale. Maneuver: Spot a [GONDOR] companion to reveal a card at random from an opponent's hand. Heal X companions, where X is the twilight cost of the card revealed.

Name: The Shards of Narsil
Lore: '...Narsil was broken and its light extinguished, and it had not yet been forged again.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Fellowship: Stack a [GONDOR] card from hand here. Fellowship: Add [1] to take a card stacked here into hand.

Name: Some Who Resisted
Lore: 'In the south the realm of Gondor long endured
Text: and for a while its splendour grew....'
