column19: Tale. Maneuver: Spot a [GONDOR] companion to make the twilight cost of each maneuver event +2.

Name: Still Sharp
Lore: 'The shards of Narsil... the blade that cut the Ring from Sauron's hand.'
Text: Skirmish: Spot The Shards of Narsil to make a [GONDOR] companion strength +3 and damage +1.

Name: Voice of Rauros
Lore: As he ran the cries came louder, but fainter now and desperately the horn was blowing.
Text: Maneuver: Exert Aragorn to make each companion with the Aragorn signet damage +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: We Must Go Warily
Lore: 'This is the lawn of Parth Galen: a fair place in the summer days of old. Let us hope that no evil has yet come here.'
Text: Response: If the fellowship moves in the regroup phase, exert a [GONDOR] companion twice to make each minion's twilight cost +1 until the next regroup phase.

Name: Abandoning Reason for Madness
Lore: 'And why not, Gandalf?... Why not? The Ruling Ring? If we could command that, then the power would pass to us.'
Text: Shadow: Spot an [ISENGARD] minion to discard up to 3 cards from hand and draw an equal number of cards.

Name: Can You Protect Me From Yourself?
Lore: 'Where is the Ring?'
Text: Maneuver: Spot an [ISENGARD] minion to exhaust Aragorn. The Free Peoples player may add 2 burdens to prevent this.

Name: Coming for the Ring
Lore: 'This evil cannot be concealed by the power of the Elves....'
Text: Regroup: Reveal a card at random from the Free Peoples player's hand. Heal X [ISENGARD] minions, where X is the twilight cost of the card revealed.

Name: A Fell Voice on the Air
Lore: 'He's trying to bring down the mountain!'
Text: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Exert Saruman to play an [ISENGARD] weather condition from your discard pile. Its twilight cost is -2.

Name: Hate and Anger
Lore: The frenzy of Uruks is born of the fear of the very Goblins that work the pits.
Text: Shadow: Spot an Uruk-hai and a [MORIA] minion to draw 3 cards.

Name: Hollowing of Isengard
Lore: 'Rip them all down!'
Text: To play, spot an [ISENGARD] Orc. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Discard this condition to add [3].

Name: Isengard Axe
Lore: Axes eat into the forests of Isengard as well as the victims of Saruman's Orcs.
Text: Bearer must be an [ISENGARD] Orc. When you play this weapon, add [1].

Name: Isengard Forger
Lore: 'I looked on it and saw that, whereas it had once been green and fair, it was now filled with pits and forges.'
Text: Shadow: Exert this minion to add [1].

Name: Isengard Retainer
Lore: '...the Eagles of the mountain went far and wide, and they saw many things: the gathering of wolves and the mustering of Orcs....'
Text: Regroup: Exert this minion to make the Free Peoples player wound a companion.

Name: Isengard Servant
Lore: The servants of Isengard worked tirelessly to spread the influence of their master.
Text: Regroup: Exert this minion to make the Free Peoples player wound a companion.

Name: Isengard Shaman
Lore: 'Over all his works a dark smoke hung and wrapped itself about the sides of Orthanc.'
Text: Response: If an [ISENGARD] Orc is about to take a wound, remove [2] to prevent that wound.

Name: Isengard Smith
Lore: 'No other folk make such a trampling....'
Text: Regroup: Exert this minion to discard a weapon (or all Free Peoples possessions if you can spot 5 companions).

Name: Isengard Warrior
Lore: 'There is evil afoot in Isengard, and the West is no longer safe.'
Text: While you can spot another [ISENGARD] Orc, no player may use archery special abilities. Regroup:Exert this minion and spot 3 wounds on the Ring-bearer to exert every companion.

Name: Isengard Worker
Lore: 'They were Elves once. Taken by the dark powers - tortured and mutilated....'
Text: Regroup: Exert this minion to make the Free Peoples player wound a companion.

Name: One of You Must Do This
Lore: 'And if we fail, what then? What happens when Sauron takes back what is his?'
Text: Maneuver: Exert an [ISENGARD] minion to make the Free Peoples player exert X companions, where X is the number of these races you can spot in the fellowship: Dwarf, Elf, Man, and Wizard.

Name: Orc Commander
Lore: 'It seems their delight to slash and beat down growing things that are not even in their way.'
Text: Each other [ISENGARD] Orc is strength +1. Regroup: Exert Orc Commander to make the Free Peoples player wound a companion.

Name: Orc Overseer
Lore: 'What orders from Mordor, my Lord? What does the Eye command?'
Text: Regroup: Exert Orc Overseer twice to exhaust a companion (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: Orthanc Berserker
Lore: The voice of Saruman compels his minions to stop at nothing to earn his favor.
Text: Damage +1. Maneuver: Spot 5 burdens and exert Orthanc Berserker twice to exhaust a companion (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: The Palantir of Orthanc
Lore: 'Seven stars and seven stones....'
Text: To play, spot an [ISENGARD] minion. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Spot an [ISENGARD] minion and remove [1] to reveal a card at random from the Free Peoples player's hand. Place that card on top of that player's draw deck.

Name: Saruman, Keeper of Isengard
Text: Saruman may not take wounds during the archery phase and may not be assigned to a skirmish. Uruk-hai are fierce. Response: If an Uruk-hai is about to take a wound, exert Saruman to prevent that wound.

Name: Saruman, Servant of the Eye
Text: Saruman may not take wounds during the archery phase and may not be assigned to a skirmish. Assignment: Exert Saruman to assign an [ISENGARD] minion to a companion (except the Ring-bearer). That companion may exert to prevent this.

Name: Servants to Saruman
Lore: 'This is grievous news concerning Saruman... for we trusted him and he is deep in all our counsels.'
Text: Skirmish: Make an [ISENGARD] Orc strength +2 (or +3 if you have fewer than 3 cards in hand).

Name: Tower of Orthanc
Lore: 'It was not made by Saruman, but by the men of Númenor long ago
Text: and it is very tall and has many secrets
column19: yet it looks not to be a work of craft.'
column20: To play, spot an [ISENGARD] minion. Plays to your support area. Each time the fellowship moves, you may spot an exhausted companion to add [3].

Name: Trapped and Alone
Lore: '...I had no chance of escape, and my days were bitter.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each character skirmishing an [ISENGARD] Orc loses all damage bonuses from weapons.

Name: The Trees Are Strong
Lore: 'Their roots go deep.'
Text: Regroup: Discard X [ISENGARD] Orcs to make the Free Peoples player wound X companions.

Name: Uruk Raider
Lore: There is no safety where Saruman's emblem is shown.
Text: Damage +1. While an ally is in the dead pile, this minion is strength +3 and fierce.

Name: Uruk Ravager
Lore: '...a ruined and terrible form of life.'
Text: Damage +1. When you play this minion, you may spot Saruman to add [2].

Name: Dangerous Gamble
Lore: Almost they began to hope that they would escape.
Text: Shadow: Spot a [MORIA] minion to reveal a card at random from the Free Peoples player's hand. Add (X), where X is the twilight cost of the card revealed.

Name: Depths of Moria
Lore: ...a great fissure had opened. Out of it a fierce red light came, and now and again flames licked at the brink.... Wisps of dark smoke wavered in the hot air.
Text: To play, spot a [MORIA] Orc. Plays to your support area. Each time the fellowship moves during the regroup phase, add [2].

Name: Hide and Seek
Lore: 'Which way shall we go?'
Text: Search. Skirmish: Spot 2 [SHIRE] companions to make a [MORIA] minion damage +1.

Name: Malice
Lore: Fueled by Sauron's hatred of living things, Orcs searched for the Ring of Power.
Text: Archery: Spot a [MORIA] Orc and a [SAURON] Orc to wound an archer.

Name: Such a Little Thing
Lore: 'Boromir... give the Ring to Frodo.'
Text: Maneuver: Spot a [MORIA] minion to wound Boromir 3 times. The Free Peoples player may discard 2 Free Peoples possessions to prevent this.

Name: Gates of the Dead City
Lore: '...and they took Minas Ithil and abode in it, and they made it into a place of dread....'
Text: To play, spot a Nazgul. Plays to your support area. Each time a [WRAITH] card adds a burden, the Free Peoples player must exert a companion.

Name: News of Mordor
Lore: 'Build me an army worthy of Mordor.'
Text: Skirmish: Spot an [ISENGARD] minion to make a Nazgul damage +1.

Name: The Ring Draws Them
Lore: 'If I move I shall be seen and hunted!'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time the fellowship moves, add [1] for each burden you can spot. At the end of each of your Shadow phases, exert a Nazgul or discard this condition.

Name: They Will Never Stop Hunting You
Lore: 'They're looking for Baggins, and if they mean well, then I'm a hobbit.'
Text: Maneuver: Spot a Nazgul to reveal a card at random from the Free Peoples player's hand. Exert a companion bearing a ranged weapon X times, where X is the twilight cost of the card revealed.

Name: Too Great and Terrible
Lore: His eyes flashed and his face was lit as by a fire within. 'Do not tempt me! For I do not wish to become like the Dark Lord himself.'
Text: Maneuver: Spot a Nazgul to wound Gandalf twice. The Free Peoples player may discard 2 [GANDALF] cards from hand to prevent this.

Name: Ulaire Otsea, Ringwraith in Twilight
Notes: If Frodo dies in a skirmish involving Otsea with Sam also in play, The One Ring is transferred to Sam before Blade Tip may be transferred with Otsea's game text.
Lore: '...at all times they smell the blood of living things, desiring and hating it.'
Text: Twilight. Each time Ulaire Otsea wins a skirmish, you may exert him to transfer Blade Tip from your support area to the Ring-bearer.

Name: The Dark Lord Advances
Lore: 'A power was there that we have not felt before.'
Text: Regroup: Exert a [SAURON] minion to reveal a card at random from the Free Peoples player's hand. That player must discard X cards from hand, where X is the twilight cost of the card revealed.

Name: Get Off the Road!
Lore: 'The Morgul-lord and his Black Riders have come forth. War is preparing!'
Text: Search. Shadow: Spot a [SAURON] minion and a Nazgul to make the Free Peoples player discard a card from the top of his or her deck for each burden you can spot.

Name: Gleaming in the Snow
Lore: 'A Ring of Power looks after itself.... It may slip off treacherously, but its keeper never abandons it.'
Text: Regroup: Exert a [SAURON] Orc and spot a [GONDOR] companion to add a burden.

Name: Hand of Sauron
Lore: 'The power of the Ring could not be undone.'
Text: Maneuver: Exert a [SAURON] minion to make the Free Peoples player discard a card at random from his or her hand.

Name: His Cruelty and Malice
Lore: 'Into this Ring he poured his cruelty, his malice, and his will to dominate all life.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Regroup: Exert a [SAURON] minion to make the Free Peoples player discard the top card from his or her draw deck.

Name: Massing in the East
Lore: 'The power of the Black Land grows....'
Text: Regroup: Exert a [SAURON] minion to discard a card from the top of the Free Peoples player's draw deck for each of these races you can spot in the fellowship: Dwarf, Elf, Man, and Wizard.

Name: Morgul Slayer
Lore: 'Sauron was diminished, but not destroyed. His Ring was lost but not unmade.'
Text: Regroup: Exert this minion to wound a companion (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: Orc Butcher
Lore: 'And yet we see that Sauron can torture and destroy the very hills.'
Text: For each [SAURON] condition you can spot, this minion is strength +1.

Name: Orc Guard
Lore: The malice of the Dark Tower thins the hopes of Men.
Text: Maneuver: Exert this minion and discard your [SAURON] condition to discard a Free Peoples condition.

Name: Orc Pillager
Lore: Weapons of the West are often powerless against the threat of Sauron.
Text: For each Free Peoples card borne by a character this minion is skirmishing, that character is strength -1.

Name: Orc Slayer
Lore: For it is a long tale, full of deeds great and terrible....
Text: Regroup: Exert this minion to wound a companion (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: Orc Swordsman
Lore: 'Many evil things there are that your strong walls and bright swords do not stay.'
Text: While this minion bears a weapon, he is strength +2.

Name: Orc Trooper
Lore: The Dark Lord's power grows in unseen ways.
Text: For each card in your hand, this minion is strength +1.

Name: Orc Veteran
Lore: 'There was war, and the land was laid waste....'
Text: Skirmish: Discard your [SAURON] condition to make a character skirmishing this minion strength -1.

Name: Orc Warrior
Lore: Orcs were multiplying again in the mountains.
Text: Maneuver: Exert this minion and discard your [SAURON] condition to make the Free Peoples player discard the top 2 cards from his or her draw deck.

Name: Our List of Allies Grows Thin
Lore: 'The enemy is moving.... His eye is fixed on Rivendell. And Saruman, you tell me, has betrayed us.'
Text: To play, exert a [SAURON] minion. Plays to your support area. Each time the fellowship moves, add [1] for each ally you can spot.

Name: Terrible as the Dawn
Lore: 'In the place of the Dark Lord, you would have a Queen... All shall love me and despair!'
Text: Maneuver: Spot a [SAURON] minion to wound Galadriel 3 times. The Free Peoples player may discard 2 Elves to prevent this.

Name: Tower of Barad-dur
Lore: The Dark Tower had been rebuilt, it was said. From there the power was spreading....
Text: To play, exert a [SAURON] minion. Plays to your support area. Each time the fellowship moves, the Free Peoples player must discard a card from hand.

Name: Why Shouldn't I Keep It?
Lore: 'No, wait, it's here in my pocket. Isn't that... isn't that odd now?'
Text: Maneuver: Spot a [SAURON] minion to discard Bilbo. The Free Peoples player may discard 2 Free Peoples conditions to prevent this.

Name: Bill the Pony
Notes: When the fellowship moves with Bill the Pony to an underground site, the Shadow number of that site is reduced before Bill the Pony is discarded. Lists: ERL, MXL.
Lore: 'That animal can nearly talk.... He gave me a look as plain as Mr. Pippin could speak....'
Text: Bearer must be a Hobbit companion. The Shadow number of each site is -1. Discard Bill the Pony when at an underground site.

Name: Frodo's Pipe
Lore: 'All the same, observations that I have made on my own many journeys south have convinced me that the weed itself is not native to our parts of the world.'
Text: Bearer must be Frodo. Fellowship: Discard a pipeweed possession and spot X pipes to heal a companion with the Frodo signet X times.

Name: Frying Pan
Lore: 'I think I'm getting the hang of this!'
Text: Bearer must be a Hobbit. Skirmish: Exert bearer to wound an Orc he or she is skirmishing.

Name: Meant to Be Alone
Lore: 'You are a Ring-bearer, Frodo... to bear a Ring of Power is to be alone.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot a Hobbit companion (except the Ring-bearer) to reveal a card at random from an opponent's hand. Remove (X), where X is the twilight cost of the card revealed.

Name: Melilot Brandybuck, Merry Dancer
Lore: Master Everard Took and Miss Melilot Brandybuck got on a table and with bells in their hands began to dance the Springle-ring: a pretty dance, but rather vigorous.
Text: Response: If a burden is about to be added by a Shadow card, exert Melilot Brandybuck to prevent that burden.

Name: Old Noakes, Purveyor of Wisdoms
Notes: If a Shadow card gives you the choice of discarding a card from hand or taking a different action, that card does not activate Old Noakes' game text.
Lore: 'There's been some strange folk crossing the Shire - Dwarves and others of a less than savoury nature.'
Text: Each time a Shadow card makes you discard a card from hand, you may also discard a minion or Shadow condition.

Name: Seek and Hide
Lore: A Hobbit's best friends in Moria are the very pillars that support its structure.
Text: Stealth. Skirmish: Spot 2 [SHIRE] companions to make a minion lose all damage bonuses.

Name: The Shire Countryside
Lore: 'Life in the wide world goes on... scarcely even aware of the existence of hobbits....'
Text: To play, spot 2 [SHIRE] companions. Plays to your support area. Each time you remove a burden (except by a Hobbit's game text), you may heal a companion.

Name: Three Monstrous Trolls
Lore: 'Great big nasty twenty foot high smelly things _- and they're arguing... arguing about how they were going to cook us!'
Text: Tale. Plays to your support area. Response: If a Shadow card is about to add any number of twilight tokens, exert a Hobbit ally to prevent this.

Name: Caras Galadhon
Text: Forest. Sanctuary. While the fellowship is at Caras Galadhon, no more than one minion may be assigned to each skirmish.

Name: Eregion Hills
Text: When the fellowship moves to Eregion Hills, add a burden.

Name: Gates of Argonath
Text: River. Maneuver events may not be played.

Name: The Great River
Text: River. While the fellowship is at The Great River, cards may not be played from draw decks or discard piles.

Name: House of Elrond
Text: Sanctuary. When the fellowship moves to House of Elrond, the Free Peoples player may spot 2 Elves to remove a burden.

Name: Wastes of Emyn Muil
Text: Maneuver: Spot 4 companions and exert your [ISENGARD] Orc to make the Free Peoples player wound a companion.

Name: Legolas, Son of Thranduil
Lore: 'Praised be the bow of Galadriel, and the hand and eye of Legolas!... That was a mighty shot in the dark, my friend!'
Text: Archer. While Legolas is at a river or forest, add 1 to the fellowship archery total.

Name: Boromir, Defender of Minas Tirith
Lore: ...seated a little apart was a tall man with a fair and noble face... proud and stern of glance.
Text: Ranger. Fellowship: Add [2] to heal Boromir.

Name: Arwen, Elven Rider (M)
Text: Ranger. Response: If the Ring-bearer is about to take a wound, discard 3 cards from hand to prevent that wound.

Name: Hand of Sauron (M)
Text: Maneuver: Exert a [SAURON] minion to make the Free Peoples player discard a card at random from his or her hand.

Name: The One Ring, Answer To All Riddles
Lore: '...thought to have perished from the world.'
Text: While wearing The One Ring, the Ring-bearer is strength +2, and each time he is about to take a wound in a skirmish, add a burden instead. Skirmish: Add a burden to wear The One Ring until the regroup phase.

Name: The One Ring, The Answer To All Riddles (T)
Lore: '...thought to have perished from the world.'
Text: While wearing The One Ring, the Ring-bearer is strength +2, and each time he is about to take a wound in a skirmish, add a burden instead. Skirmish: Add a burden to wear The One Ring until the regroup phase.

Name: The One Ring, The Ruling Ring
Lore: One Ring to rule them all....
Text: Response: If bearer is about to take a wound in a skirmish, he wears The One Ring until the regroup phase. While wearing The One Ring, each time the Ring-bearer is about to take a wound during a skirmish, add a burden instead.

Name: Anger
Lore: Rage filled the hearts of the Dunlending attackers.
Text: Skirmish: Spot 3 [DUNLAND] minions or a site you control to make a [DUNLAND] Man fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Band of Wild Men
Lore: 'The Wild Men of Dunland have no love for Théoden of Rohan since he took their land.'
Text: Each time this minion wins a skirmish, you may make it fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Burn Every Village
Lore: 'Take your rabble through the Westemnet
Text: take back the lands they stole from you.'
column19: Skirmish: Make a [DUNLAND] Man strength +2 (or +4 if you control a site).

Name: Constantly Threatening
Lore: The men of Dunland have hated the Rohirrim for many years.
Text: Plays to your support area. Shadow: If the fellowship has moved more than once this turn, remove [2] to play a [DUNLAND] Man from your discard pile.

Name: Dark Fury
Lore: Dunland and Dunlendings are the names that the Rohirrim gave to them, because they were swarthy and dark-haired....
Text: Skirmish: Make a [DUNLAND] Man strength +2 (or +4 if at a sanctuary).

Name: Death to the Strawheads
Lore: The dark Dunlendings called their fairhaired enemies from Rohan Strawheads.
Text: Skirmish: Make a [DUNLAND] Man strength +1 for each companion you spot.

Name: Dunlending Arsonist
Lore: 'They bring fire... and they are burning as they come, rick, cot, and tree.'
Text: Each time this minion wins a skirmish, you may play a [DUNLAND] Man from hand
column19: his twilight cost is -2. That Man is fierce and damage +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Dunlending Brigand
Lore: 'This was a rich vale and had many homesteads. Alas for my folk!'

Name: Dunlending Looter
Lore: ...the Dunlendings raided often over the Isen.
Text: When this minion wins a skirmish, you may stack him on a site you control. Shadow: If stacked on a site you control, play this minion. His twilight cost is -2.

Name: Dunlending Madman
Lore: 'They hate us, and they are glad
Text: for our doom seems certain to them.'
column19: Each time this minion wins a skirmish, you may make him strength +2 and fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Dunlending Pillager
Lore: 'Not in half a thousand years have they forgotten their grievance that the lords of Gondor gave the Mark to Eorl the Young and made alliance with him.'
Text: Each time this minion wins a skirmish, you may discard a Free Peoples possession (or 2 possessions if you spot 6 companions).

Name: Dunlending Ransacker
Lore: 'Yet there are many that cry in the Dunland tongue.'
Text: Each time this minion wins a skirmish, you may spot another [DUNLAND] Man to take control of a site.

Name: Dunlending Ravager
Lore: 'They will not give way now for dusk or dawn, until Théoden is taken, or they themselves are slain.'
Text: While skirmishing a [ROHAN] Man, this minion is strength +2. Assignment: Spot an ally to make that ally participate in skirmishes and assign this minion to skirmish that ally.

Name: Dunlending Robber
Lore: 'We will fight....'
Text: Each time this minion wins a skirmish, you may make him strength +2 and fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Dunlending Savage
Lore: The Dunlendings' fury could only end in the death of the king of Rohan.

Name: Dunlending Warrior
Lore: These were a remnant of the peoples that had dwelt in the vales of the White Mountains in ages past.
Text: Assignment: Spot an ally to make that ally participate in skirmishes and assign this minion to skirmish that ally.

Name: Hides
Lore: Only heavy animal skins armored the Dunlendings.
Text: Plays to your support area. When you play this possession, you may draw a card. Response: If a [DUNLAND] Man is about to take a wound, remove [2] or discard this possession to prevent that wound.

Name: Hides (T)
Lore: Only heavy animal skins armored the Dunlendings.
Text: When you play this possession, you may draw a card. Response: If a [Dunland] Man is about to take a wound, remove [2] or discard this possession to prevent that wound.

Name: Hill Chief
Lore: '...Saruman has armed the wild hillmen and herdfolk of Dunland beyond the rivers, and these also he loosed upon us.'
Text: Shadow: Spot a site you control and exert Hill Chief to draw 3 cards.

Name: Hillman Band
Lore: As in years past, the Dunlendings marched in force to the west.
Text: Each time the fellowship moves, you may spot another [DUNLAND] Man to take control of a site.

Name: Hillman Horde
Lore: 'They are fierce folk when roused.'
Text: While you control 2 sites, skip the archery phase. While you control 3 sites, each of your [DUNLAND] Men is fierce. While you control 4 sites, each of your [DUNLAND] Men is damage +1.

Name: Hillman Mob
Lore: 'That old hatred Saruman has inflamed.'
Text: Each time this minion wins a skirmish, you may play a [DUNLAND] Man from hand
column19: his twilight cost is -2. That Man is fierce and damage +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Hillman Rabble
Lore: The relentless fury of the Dunlendings consumed one village after another.
Text: Each time this minion wins a skirmish, you may stack it on a site you control. Shadow: If stacked on a site you control, play this minion. Its twilight cost is -2.

Name: Hillman Tribe
Lore: 'They will not quail at the sun... the wild men of the hills.'
Text: Each time this minion wins a skirmish, you may spot another [DUNLAND] minion to take control of a site.

Name: Iron Axe
Lore: Saruman armed the Dunlendings with weapons forged by his Orcs in Isengard.
Text: Bearer must be a [DUNLAND] Man.

Name: Living Off Rock
Lore: 'The Horsemen took your land
Text: they drove your people into the hills to scratch living off rock.'
column19: Plays to your support area. Each time a [DUNLAND] Man wins a skirmish involving a [ROHAN] Man, you may make that minion strength +2 and fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: No Defense
Text: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Remove [3] to place a [DUNLAND] token here. Skirmish: Spot a [DUNLAND] Man and remove a [DUNLAND] token from this card. A character skirmishing that [DUNLAND] Man does not gain strength bonuses from possessions.

Name: No Refuge
Lore: As their homes were ravaged by the wild men, refugees fled to the safety of Helm's Deep.
Text: Plays to your support area. While a [DUNLAND] Man is stacked on a site, the Shadow number of each site is +5.

Name: No Retreat
Lore: Hordes from Dunland laid waste to villages as their numbers grew.
Text: Plays on a site you control. Regroup: Spot 2 [DUNLAND] Men and discard this condition to make the Free Peoples player choose to move again this turn (if the move limit allows).

Name: Over the Isen
Lore: Like their ancestors years before, the Dunlendings came down from Isengard.
Text: Plays to your support area. Assignment: Spot a site you control and remove [2] to assign a [DUNLAND] Man to an unbound companion.

Name: Ravage the Defeated
Lore: What the Dunlendings cannot steal, they destroy.
Text: Response: If your [DUNLAND] Man wins a skirmish, discard all Free Peoples cards borne by the companion or ally he was skirmishing.

Name: Saruman, Rabble-rouser
Text: Saruman may not be assigned to a skirmish. Each time the fellowship moves, the Free Peoples player must exert a companion for each [DUNLAND] Man you can spot. Skirmish: Exert Saruman to make a [DUNLAND] Man strength +2.

Name: Secret Folk
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a companion or ally loses a skirmish involving a [DUNLAND] Man, you may place a [DUNLAND] token on this card. Maneuver: Discard a Free Peoples possession for each [DUNLAND] token here (limit 3). Discard this condition.

Name: Wake of Destruction
Lore: The anger of the wild men increased with every home they pillaged.
Text: Maneuver: Spot 2 sites you control to make each of your [DUNLAND] Men fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: War Club
Lore: The wooden weapons of the wild men slew scores of unarmed villagers.
Text: Bearer must be a [DUNLAND] Man. Each time bearer wins a skirmish, you may discard 2 Free Peoples possessions.

Name: War Cry of Dunland
Lore: 'Death to the Forgoil!'
Text: Response: If a [DUNLAND] Man wins a skirmish, make him fierce and strength +4 until the regroup phase.

Name: Wild Man of Dunland
Lore: 'By our blood... we swear to fight for you....'
Text: Each time this minion wins a skirmish, you may play a [DUNLAND] Man from hand
column19: his twilight cost is -2. That Man is fierce and damage +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Wild Man Raid
Lore: Not even the smallest of trinkets was safe from the destruction of the Dunlendings.
Text: Maneuver: Spot 3 [DUNLAND] Men to discard a Free Peoples possession or condition.

Name: Wulf, Dunlending Chieftain
Lore: 'Do you not hear their voices?'
Text: Fierce. Response: If another [DUNLAND] Man wins a skirmish, exert Wulf to take control of a site.

Name: Axe of Erebor
Lore: '...wherever thou goest my thought goes with thee. But have a care to lay thine axe to the right tree!'
Text: Bearer must be Gimli. He is damage +1. Skirmish: Discard a [DWARVEN] condition or a card stacked on a [DWARVEN] condition to make Gimli strength +1.

Name: Best Company
Lore: An axe swung and swept back. Two Orcs fell headless. The rest fled.
Text: Skirmish: Make a Dwarf strength +2 (or +4 if at a battleground).

Name: Come Here Lad
Lore: 'You are the canniest, luckiest, most reckless fool I've ever met! Bless you.'
Text: Fellowship: Stack the top 2 cards from your draw deck on a [DWARVEN] condition that has a card already stacked on it.

Name: Courtesy of My Hall
Lore: 'Now my guests, come!... Come and take such refreshment as haste allows.'
Text: Plays to your support area. When you play this condition, stack a card from your discard pile here. Fellowship: Discard a Free Peoples card stacked here to heal a Dwarf.

Name: Dwarven Foresight
Lore: 'I would guess that the burned bones of the hobbits are now mingled with the Orcs'.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot a Dwarf to take a Free Peoples card stacked on a [DWARVEN] condition into hand.

Name: Ever My Heart Rises
Text: Tale. Plays to your support area. When you play this condition, reveal the top 6 cards of your draw deck and stack them here. Fellowship: Spot a Dwarf and discard the top card of your draw deck to take a Free Peoples card stacked here into hand.

Name: From the Armory
Lore: 'It's a bit tight around the chest.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Exert a Dwarf and stack a Free Peoples card from hand here to prevent all wounds to that Dwarf.

Name: Gimli, Lockbearer
Lore: 'You speak evil of that which is fair beyond the reach of your thought, and only little wit can excuse you.'
Text: Damage +1. Gimli is strength +1 for each unbound Hobbit companion you can spot.

Name: Gimli, Unbidden Guest
Lore: But a small dark figure that none had observed sprang out of the shadows and gave a hoarse shout: Baruk Khazâd!
Text: Damage +1. Skirmish: Exert Gimli to make an unbound companion strength +1 (or +2 if that companion is Legolas).

Name: Here Is Good Rock
Lore: 'Give me a year and a hundred of my kin and I would make this a place that armies would break upon like water.'
Text: Tale.Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Stack a Free Peoples card from hand here to make a Dwarf damage +1.

Name: Khazad Ai-menu
Lore: 'The Orcs are behind the wall. Ai-oi! Come, Legolas! There are enough for both of us.'
Text: Skirmish: Make a Dwarf strength +2 (or strength +3 and damage +1 if you spot Legolas).

Name: My Axe Is Notched
Notes: The strength bonus derived from this condition is based on the lowest number of tokens on either card. For example: If there are two [ELVEN] tokens on Final Count and three [DWARVEN] tokens on My Axe Is Notched, the strength bonus is +2.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time Gimli wins a skirmish, place a [DWARVEN] token on this card. While you can spot X [DWARVEN] tokens on this card and the same number of [ELVEN] tokens on Final Count, Gimli is strength +X (limit +3).

Name: Quick As May Be
Lore: 'I think, nonetheless, that we no longer need any trail to tell us which way to go.'
Text: Maneuver: Spot a Dwarf companion and an Elf companion to wound a minion.

Name: Rest by Blind Night
Lore: 'And yet even I, Dwarf of many journeys... cannot run all the way to Isengard without any pause....'
Text: Regroup: Shuffle any number of [DWARVEN] conditions (and all cards stacked on them) into your draw deck.

Name: Restless Axe
Lore: 'Give me a row of orc-necks and room to swing and all weariness will fall from me!'
Text: Regroup: Exert a Dwarf to shuffle a [DWARVEN] condition (and all cards stacked on it) into your draw deck. Exert a minion for each card shuffled into your draw deck.

Name: Search Far and Wide
Lore: 'We have been set many riddles since we came to Tol Brandir, but this is the hardest to unravel.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot a Dwarf and discard the top card of your draw deck to draw 2 cards.

Name: Stout and Strong
Lore: 'Never did I see an axe so wielded.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a Dwarf wins a skirmish, you may place a [DWARVEN] token on this card. Skirmish: Make an unbound companion strength +1 for each [DWARVEN] token here (limit +3). Discard this condition.

Name: Alliance Reforged
Lore: 'If we do not trust the strength of Men, then we trust to the victory of Sauron.'
Text: Tale. Fellowship: Draw a card for each Elf companion you spot.

Name: Arrow and Blade
Lore: The Elven bow and the sword of Man fought together as one weapon.
Text: Skirmish: Exert X Elf companions to make a minion skirmishing an unbound companion strength -X.

Name: Blades Drawn
Lore: The sword skills of the Elven archers were unexpected.
Text: To play, spot 3 Elves. Plays to your support area. For each wound on each minion, that minion is strength -2. Discard this condition during the regroup phase.

Name: Company of Archers
Lore: The Naith Company, a veteran band from the South of Lórien, concentrated fire on the Uruk machines.
Text: Archery: Spot 2 Elf companions to discard a condition.

Name: Elven Bow
Lore: No finer bows could defend Helm's Deep than those of the Golden Wood.
Text: Bearer must be an Elf. Bearer is an archer.

Name: Elven Brooch
Lore: 'Not idly do the leaves of Lórien fall.'
Text: To play, spot an Elf. Bearer must be a companion. Response: If another possession borne by bearer is about to be discarded by a Shadow card, discard this possession instead.

Name: Elven Sword
Lore: Fine blades forged by Elven smiths are centuries-old heirlooms.
Text: Bearer must be an Elf. Skirmish: Exert bearer or discard 2 cards from hand to make a minion skirmishing bearer strength -1.

Name: Erethon, Naith Lieutenant
Lore: At close range, Erethón's accuracy is uncanny.
Text: To play, spot an Elf. While Erethon bears a ranged weapon, he is strength +1 and damage +1, and he does not add to the fellowship archery total.

Name: Feathered
Lore: Elven swords found the same targets as their arrows.
Text: Skirmish: Make a minion skirmishing an Elf strength -2 for each wound on that minion.

Name: Fereveldir, Son of Thandronen
Lore: Thandronen's sons patrol the borders of Lórien together.
Text: To play, spot an Elf. Skirmish: Exert Fereveldir and discard an [ELVEN] token from your condition to wound a minion Fereveldir is skirmishing.

Name: Ferevellon, Son of Thandronen
Lore: The Uruks at Helm's Deep fell to his blade as easily as Goblins from the mountains.
Text: To play, spot an Elf. Skirmish: Exert Ferevellon to make a minion skirmishing him strength -2.

Name: Final Count
Notes: The strength bonus derived from this condition is based on the lowest number of tokens on either card. For example: If there are two [ELVEN] tokens on Final Count and three [DWARVEN] tokens on My Axe Is Notched, the strength bonus is +2.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time Legolas wins a skirmish, you may place an [ELVEN] token on this card. While you can spot X [ELVEN] tokens on this card and the same number of [DWARVEN] tokens on My Axe Is Notched, Legolas is strength +X (limit +3).

Name: Flashing Steel
Lore: 'Good!... But my count is now two dozen. It has been knife-work up here.'
Text: Skirmish: Exert an Elf to make a minion skirmishing that Elf strength -3.

Name: Haldir, Emissary of the Galadhrim
Lore: 'In days of old, my people stood beside the King of Gondor - we come to honor that allegiance.'
Text: While no opponent controls a site, Haldir is strength +2. Regroup: Exert Haldir at a battleground and exert another Elf to liberate a site.

Name: Killing Field
Lore: The courage of the defenders blunted the Uruk assaults.
Text: To play, spot 3 Elves. Plays to your support area. Each wounded minion is prevented from being fierce. Discard this condition during the regroup phase.

Name: Legolas, Dauntless Hunter
Lore: 'They are far, far away.... I know in my heart that they have not rested this night.'
Text: Archer. The twilight cost of each Shadow event and Shadow condition is +1 for each unbound Hobbit you can spot.

Name: Legolas, Dauntless Hunter (T)
Lore: 'They are far, far away.... I know in my heart that they have not rested this night.'
Text: Archer. The twilight cost of each Shadow event and Shadow condition is +1 for each unbound Hobbit you can spot.

Name: Legolas, Elven Comrade
Lore: 'Come, you shall sit behind me, friend Gimli.'
Text: Archer. Skirmish: Exert Legolas to make a minion skirmishing an unbound companion strength -1 (or -2 if that companion is Gimli).

Name: Lembas
Lore: Sam thought that it tasted far better, somehow, than it had for a good while....
Text: To play, spot 3 Elves. Bearer must be a companion. Regroup: Discard this possession to reconcile your hand.

Name: Lorien Guardian
Lore: Haldir's Elven bowmen were experienced defenders of the borders of the Golden Wood
Text: Regroup: Exert this companion to make a Shadow player wound a minion.

Name: Lorien Is Most Welcome
Lore: 'We are proud to fight alongside Men once more....'
Text: To play, spot 3 Elves. Plays to your support area. Each wounded minion loses all damage bonuses. Discard this condition during the regroup phase.

Name: Lorien Swordsman
Lore: Long, curved Elven steel cut down Uruks already weakened by Elven arrows.
Text: Each minion skirmishing this companion is strength -2 for each wound on that minion.

Name: Night Without End
Lore: 'Would that this night would end, and I could have better light for shooting.'
Text: Response: If an Elf wins a skirmish, exert that Elf to liberate a site or wound a minion.

Name: Ordulus, Young Warrior
Lore: Ordulus always has an arrow nocked and a full quiver too.
Text: To play, spot an Elf. The twilight cost of each ranged weapon played on Ordulus is -1.

Name: Pengedhel, Naith Warrior
Lore: Pengedhel can wield an arrow like a short spear.
Text: To play, spot an Elf. While Pengedhel bears a ranged weapon, he is strength +2 and he does not add to the fellowship archery total.

Name: Strength of Arms
Lore: Elvish weapons were more than a match for the Uruks.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time an Elf wins a skirmish, you may place an [ELVEN] token on this card. Skirmish: Make a minion skirmishing an Elf strength -1 for each [ELVEN] token here (limit -3). Discard this condition.

Name: Supporting Fire
Lore: Sword-work is made easier with archery support.
Text: Skirmish: Make an Elf strength +2 (or +3 if you spot 3 Elf companions).

Name: Sword-wall
Lore: A fixed line of Elven blades can hold off great numbers of the Enemy's hordes.
Text: Skirmish or Regroup: Spot 3 Elf companions to liberate a site or exert a minion.

Name: Thandronen, Veteran Protector
Lore: The twin sons of Thandronen marched with their father to defend Helm's Deep.
Text: To play, spot an Elf. Regroup: Exert Thandronen to discard a minion stacked on a condition or stacked on a site.

Name: Thonnas, Naith Captain
Lore: Elves of Lórien hone their knife-work fighting Goblin raiders.
Text: To play, spot an Elf. While Thonnas bears a ranged weapon, each minion skirmishing him is strength -2 and Thonnas does not add to the fellowship archery total.

Name: Valor
Lore: An Elf avoids taking up arms, but once committed to the fray, his will is resolute.
Text: Skirmish: Make an Elf strength +2 (or +3 if skirmishing a wounded minion).

Name: Behold the White Rider
Lore: 'Gandalf is come again.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time Gandalf wins a skirmish, you may place a [GANDALF] token here. Skirmish: Wound a minion skirmishing Gandalf for each [GANDALF] token here. Discard this condition.

Name: Gandalf, Greyhame
Lore: 'Dangerous!... And so am I, very dangerous
Text: more dangerous than anything you will ever meet....'
column19: Fellowship: If the twilight pool has fewer than 2 twilight tokens, add [2] to play a character from your discard pile.

Name: Gandalf, The White Wizard
Lore: 'Behold, I am not Gandalf the Grey, whom you betrayed. I am Gandalf the White, who has returned from death.'
Text: While you can spot 3 twilight tokens, Gandalf is strength +3.

Name: Gandalf, The White Wizard (T)
Lore: 'Behold, I am not Gandalf the Grey, whom you betrayed. I am Gandalf the White, who has returned from death.'
Text: While you can spot 3 twilight tokens, Gandalf is strength +3.

Name: Gandalf's Staff, Walking Stick
Lore: 'The staff in the hand of a Wizard may be more than a prop for age....'
Text: Bearer must be Gandalf. While you can spot 2 twilight tokens, Gandalf is damage +2.

Name: Grown Suddenly Tall
Lore: His hood and grey rags were flung away. His white garments shone.
Text: Spell. Fellowship: Spot Gandalf to discard all conditions.

Name: Have Patience
Lore: 'Go where you must go, and hope!'
Text: Fellowship: Spot Gandalf to heal an unbound companion twice.

Name: Hearken to Me
Lore: 'Not all is dark. Take courage, Lord of the Mark
Text: for better help you will not find.'
column19: Spell. To play, spot Gandalf. Bearer must be Theoden. Discard all Shadow conditions on Theoden. Shadow conditions may not be played on Theoden.

Name: Into Dark Tunnels
Lore: 'Even Sauron knows them not. They are older than he. Now I have walked there, but I will bring no report to darken the light of day.'
Text: Spell. Response: If you play a [GANDALF] event, exert Gandalf twice to place that event in your hand instead of your discard pile.

Name: Keep Your Forked Tongue
Lore: 'A witless worm you have become.'
Text: Skirmish: Spot Gandalf and 3 twilight tokens to prevent all wounds to a companion who has the Gandalf signet.

Name: Long I Fell
Lore: 'His fire was about me. I was burned.'
Text: Spell. Skirmish: Spot Gandalf to prevent all wounds to him. Any Shadow player may make you wound a minion to prevent this.

Name: Mithrandir, Mithrandir!
Lore: The wild men fell on their faces before him.
Text: Spell. Maneuver: Exert Gandalf to wound each minion who has strength of 6 or less.

Name: Roll of Thunder
Lore: 'I have not passed through fire and death to bandy crooked words with a serving-man till the lightning falls.'
Text: Fellowship or Maneuver: Spot Gandalf to discard a Shadow possession or Shadow artifact.

Name: Shadowfax
Lore: 'He is the chief of the Mearas, lords of horses....'
Text: Bearer must be Gandalf. Discard any hand weapon he bears. Gandalf may not bear a hand weapon. At the start of each skirmish involving Gandalf, each minion skirmishing him must exert.

Name: Shadowfax (T)
Lore: 'He is the chief of the Mearas, lords of horses....'
Text: Bearer must be Gandalf. Discard any hand weapon he bears. Gandalf may not bear a hand weapon. At the start of each skirmish involving Gandalf, each minion skirmishing him must exert.

Name: Stump and Bramble
Lore: 'Many of those trees were my friends... many had voices of their own that are lost for ever now.'
Text: Maneuver: Spot an [ISENGARD] minion and an Ent ally. Until the regroup phase, that ally is damage +2 and participates in archery fire and skirmishes.

Name: Task Was Not Done
Lore: 'Naked I was sent back - for a brief time, until my task is done. And naked I lay upon the mountain-top.'
Text: Spell. Regroup: Exert Gandalf to discard up to 2 wounded minions.

Name: Treebeard, Earthborn
Lore: 'Do not be hasty, that is my motto.'
Text: Unhasty. Response: If an unbound Hobbit is about to be discarded, stack him here instead. Fellowship: Exert Treebeard and add[1] to play an unbound Hobbit stacked here.

Name: Treebeard, Earthborn (T)
Lore: 'Do not be hasty, that is my motto.'
Text: Unhasty. Response: If an unbound Hobbit is about to be discarded, stack him here instead. Fellowship: Exert Treebeard and add [1] to play an unbound Hobbit stacked here.

Name: Treebeard, Oldest Living Thing
Lore: 'No, I am not tired. I do not easily get tired. And I do not sit down. I am not very, hm, bendable.'
Text: Unhasty. Fellowship: Exert Treebeard and discard an unbound companion from hand to heal an unbound companion.

Name: Under the Living Earth
Notes: The twilight token added for the cost of this card adds to the strength bonus provided by its effect. For example: if the twilight pool is empty when this card is played, Gandalf is strength +1.
Lore: 'Thither I came at last, to the uttermost foundations of stone. He was with me still.'
Text: Skirmish: Make Gandalf strength +1 for each twilight token you spot (limit +5).

Name: Well Met Indeed
Lore: 'And what may you be doing in these parts? An Elf, a Man, and a Dwarf, all clad in elvish fashion.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot an Elf, a [GONDOR] Man, and a Dwarf to play Gandalf from your dead pile.

Name: Windows in a Stone Wall
Text: To play, exert an Ent. Plays on that Ent. Response: If an [ISENGARD] minion is killed, discard this condition to reveal the top 10 cards of an opponent's draw deck. Discard 1 Shadow card and 1 Free Peoples card revealed. Your opponent reshuffles that deck.

Name: Wizardry Indeed
Lore: The hosts of Isengard roared, swaying this way and that, turning from fear to fear.
Text: Maneuver: If you can spot more minions than companions, exert Gandalf to make an opponent discard a minion.

Name: Aragorn, Heir of Elendil
Lore: 'Sauron fears you, Aragorn, he fears what you may become.'
Text: Defender +1.

Name: Arrows Thick in the Air
Lore: He came to rest in the fern a few feet away, face downward, green arrow-feathers sticking from his neck below a golden collar.
Text: Archery or Skirmish: Exert 2 Ring-bound Men to wound each roaming minion.

Name: Boromir, My Brother
Lore: 'Where is thy horn? Whither goest thou? O Boromir! But he was gone.'
Text: Bearer must be Faramir. Skirmish: Discard a [GONDOR] card from hand to make a Ring-bound Man strength +1.

Name: Boromir's Gauntlets
Lore: '...now Boromir has taken his road, and we must make haste to choose our own.'
Text: Bearer must be a [GONDOR] Man. Skirmish: Exert bearer to cancel a skirmish involving bearer. Any Shadow player may remove [1] to prevent this.

Name: Curse Them
Lore: 'It is close on ten leagues hence to the eastshore of Anduin... and we seldom come so far afield.'
Text: Skirmish: Exert a Ring-bound Man to cancel a skirmish involving a roaming minion.

Name: Damrod, Ranger of Ithilien
Lore: 'I doubt not that the days of Gondor are numbered, and the walls of Minas Tirith are doomed, so great is His strength and malice.'
Text: Ring-bound. Ranger. To play, spot a Ring-bound Man. Skirmish: Exert Damrod to exhaust a Man he is skirmishing.

Name: Defend It and Hope
Lore: 'Is it not said that no foe has ever taken the Hornburg, if men defended it?'
Text: Maneuver: Exert a [GONDOR] Man to wound a minion once (or twice if that minion is an Uruk-hai).

Name: Faramir, Captain of Gondor
Lore: 'He leads us now in all perilous ventures.'
Text: Ring-bound. Ranger. The twilight cost of each other [GONDOR] Man in your starting fellowship is -1. While skirmishing a roaming minion, Faramir is strength +2.

Name: Faramir, Son of Denethor
Lore: He could see Faramir's face, which was now unmasked
Text: it was stern and commanding, and a keen wit lay behind his searching glance.
column19: Ring-bound. Ranger. An opponent may not play skirmish events or use skirmish special abilities during skirmishes involving Faramir.

Name: Faramir's Bow
Lore: 'Were I as hasty as you, I might have slain you long ago.'
Text: Bearer must be Faramir. He is an archer. Skirmish: If Faramir is skirmishing a Man or a roaming minion, exert Faramir to wound that minion.

Name: Faramir's Cloak
Lore: Captain Faramir and his rangers were clad in green and brown of varied hues, better to walk unseen in the glades of Ithilien.
Text: Bearer must be Faramir. Each roaming minion skirmishing a Ring-bound Man is strength -1.

Name: Forbidden Pool
Lore: '...tonight you have come where it is death to come.'
Text: Plays to your support area. While the fellowship is at site 6T, each Ring-bound Man takes no more than 1 wound during each skirmish phase. Fellowship: Add [2] and discard this condition to heal a Ring-bound Man.

Name: Forests of Ithilien
Lore: ...a fair country of climbing woods and swift-falling streams.
Text: Plays to your support area. While the fellowship is at site 5T, the site number of each Man in a skirmish is +2. Regroup: Discard this condition and exert a Ring-bound Man to liberate a site.

Name: Gondorian Ranger
Lore: Green gauntlets covered their hands, and their faces were hooded and masked with green, except for their eyes, which were very keen and bright.
Text: Ring-bound. Ranger. The site number of each minion assigned to skirmish a Ring-bound Man is +2.

Name: Hard Choice
Lore: 'Shall we rest by night, or shall we go on while our will and strength hold?'
Text: Fellowship: Spot Aragorn to heal a companion who has the Aragorn signet twice.

Name: Help in Doubt and Need
Lore: 'The Heir of Elendil would be a strength indeed to the Sons of Eorl in this evil tide.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Exert an unbound [GONDOR] Man to make a [ROHAN] companion strength +2, or exert a [ROHAN] companion to make an unbound [GONDOR] Man strength +2.

Name: Henneth Annun
Lore: 'This is the Window of the Sunset....'
Text: Plays to your support area. While the fellowship is at site 6T, each roaming minion skirmishing a Ring-bound companion is strength -2. Skirmish: Spot a [GONDOR] Man and discard this condition to wound a roaming minion.

Name: Ithilien Trap
Lore: He was glad he could not see the dead face.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a [GONDOR] Man wins a skirmish, you may place a [GONDOR] token here. Maneuver: Exert a minion for each [GONDOR] token here (limit 3). Discard this condition.

Name: Mablung, Soldier of Gondor
Lore: '...we have a new errand on this journey....'
Text: Ring-bound. Ranger. To play, spot a Ring-bound Man. Skirmish: Exert Mablung to exhaust a roaming minion he is skirmishing.

Name: New Errand
Lore: '...we come to ambush the Men of Harad.'
Text: Skirmish: Spot a Ring-bound Man to make a minion's site number +2. If that minion loses this skirmish, you may wound a minion.

Name: Pathfinder
Lore: 'If you take my counsel, you will not turn eastward yet. Go straight on, for thus you will have the cover of the woodland for many miles.'
Text: Fellowship or Regroup: Spot a ranger to play the fellowship's next site (replacing opponent's site if necessary).

Name: Ranger of Ithilien
Lore: ...they were goodly men, pale-skinned, dark of hair, with grey eyes and faces sad and proud.
Text: Ring-bound. Ranger. When this companion is in your starting fellowship, his twilight cost is -1. While skirmishing a roaming minion, this companion is strength +2.

Name: Ranger's Bow
Lore: Two had great bows, almost of their own height, and great quivers of long green-feathered arrows.
Text: Bearer must be Ring-bound Man. Skirmish: If bearer is skirmishing a Man or a roaming minion, exert bearer to wound that minion.

Name: Ranger's Sword, Blade of Aragorn
Lore: 'I am not weaponless.'
Text: Bearer must be Aragorn. While skirmishing an Uruk-hai, Aragorn is strength +2.

Name: Ruins of Osgiliath
Lore: The Citadel of the Stars had fallen into ruin.
Text: Plays to your support area. While the fellowship is at site 7T, each Ring-bound Man is defender +1. Skirmish: Spot a Ring-bound Man and discard this condition to wound an opponent's Man.

Name: Sword of Gondor
Lore: Four tall Men stood there.... All had swords at their sides....
Text: Bearer must be a [GONDOR] Man. While skirmishing a Man or a roaming minion, bearer is damage +1.

Name: War and Valor
Lore: 'So even was my brother, Boromir: a man of prowess, and for that he was accounted the best man in Gondor.'
Text: Skirmish: Make a [GONDOR] Man strength +2 (or +3 and damage +1 if skirmishing a roaming minion).

Name: Advance Uruk Patrol
Lore: 'This is no rabble of mindless Orcs.'
Text: Damage +1. While at a battleground, this minion is fierce. While you control a battleground, this minion is strength +4.

Name: Attack on Helm's Deep
Lore: 'Ten thousand strong at least....'
Text: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Play an Uruk-hai to place an [ISENGARD] token on this card. Regroup: Remove 3 [ISENGARD] tokens from this card and discard an Uruk-hai to take control of a site.

Name: Band of Uruk Bowmen
Lore: Taking the high ground provides a better field of fire.
Text: Archer. Damage +1. While you control a site, the minion archery total is +1.

Name: Banished
Lore: 'Oh, but this is not from me - it comes from the King. He signed it this morning.'
Text: To play, exert Saruman or an [ISENGARD] Man. Plays on a Free Peoples Man. Each time another ally or companion loses a skirmish, bearer must exert.

Name: Beyond All Hope
Lore: 'How shall any tower withstand such numbers and such reckless hate?'
Text: Maneuver: Exert 2 Uruk-hai to add a burden for each card in the dead pile.

Name: Beyond Dark Mountains
Lore: Where now was the Ring-bearer? How thin indeed was the thread upon which doom still hung!
Text: Response: If a companion or ally is killed, exert an [ISENGARD] minion to add a burden (or 2 burdens if Aragorn, Gandalf, or Theoden is killed).

Name: Broad-bladed Sword
Lore: They were armed with short broad-bladed swords, not with the curved scimitars usual with Orcs....
Text: Bearer must be an Uruk-hai. Bearer may not take wounds (except during skirmish phases).

Name: Brought Back Alive
Lore: 'What are they wanted for?... Why alive? Do they give good sport?'
Text: Search. Assignment: Exert an [ISENGARD] tracker to assign it to an unbound companion. That companion may exert to prevent this (unless that companion is a Hobbit).

Name: Burning of Westfold
Lore: 'We have found many of our folk lying slain as they fled....'
Text: Plays to your support area. Shadow: If you control a site, play an Uruk-hai to discard a Free Peoples condition.

Name: Cloud of Arrows
Lore: Behind them orc-archers crowded, sending a hail of darts against the bowmen on the walls.
Text: Archery: Exert an [ISENGARD] archer to make the minion archery total +1 and the fellowship archery total -1.

Name: Come Down
Notes: This card allows all allies to take wounds from archery fire.
Lore: 'We are the fighting Uruk-hai.... Bring out your skulking king!'
Text: Plays to your support area. Archery: Spot 2 [ISENGARD] archers to make allies take wounds from archery fire instead of companions.

Name: Covering Fire
Lore: Archers cowered on the walls, unable to reply.
Text: To play, spot 2 [ISENGARD] archers. Plays to your support area. The Free Peoples player may not play archery events or use archery special abilities. Discard this condition during the regroup phase.

Name: Down to the Last Child
Lore: The Uruks brought death to the villages of Rohan.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a companion or ally loses a skirmish involving an Uruk-hai, place an [ISENGARD] token on this card. Shadow: Remove 2 [ISENGARD] tokens from this card to take control of a site.

Name: Driven Back
Lore: With each fallen defender, the morale of the attacking army rose.
Text: Archery: Spot 2 [ISENGARD] archers to make the minion archery total +1 for each card in the dead pile.

Name: Elite Crossbowmen
Lore: The best archers were held in reserve, awaiting the final assault.
Text: Archer. Damage +1. Archery: Exert Elite Crossbowmen to make the Free Peoples player wound an unbound companion
column19: this minion does not add to the minion archery total.

Name: Ferocity
Lore: Uruk savagery remained despite their battle training.
Text: Skirmish: Make an Uruk-hai strength +2 (or +3 if at a battleground).

Name: Get Back
Lore: 'We do not answer to Mordor scum!'
Text: Assignment: Prevent an [ISENGARD] tracker from being assigned to a skirmish by any player.

Name: Grima, Son of Galmod
Lore: 'Did I not counsel you, lord, to forbid his staff?'
Text: Each unbound companion (or ally) bearing a Shadow condition is strength -1.

Name: Grima, Wormtongue
Lore: 'I care for you and yours as best I may. But do not weary yourself, or tax too heavily your strength.'
Text: Maneuver: Exert Grima and spot an unbound companion bearing 3 or more cards to return each Free Peoples card that companion bears to its owner's hand.

Name: Grima, Wormtongue (T)
Lore: 'I care for you and yours as best I may. But do not weary yourself, or tax too heavily your strength.'
Text: Maneuver: Exert Grima and spot an unbound companion bearing 3 or more cards to return each Free Peoples card that companion bears to its owner's hand.

Name: Haunting Her Steps
Lore: 'What was the promised price? When all the men were dead, you were to pick your share of the treasure and take the woman you desire?'
Text: Response: If a special ability of an ally or unbound companion is used, exert Grima to cancel that action.

Name: Kill Them Now
Lore: 'They're a cursed nuisance, and we're in a hurry.'
Text: Skirmish: Make an [ISENGARD] tracker strength +2 (or +4 if skirmishing a character bearing a search card).

Name: Leechcraft
Lore: 'Your leechcraft ere long would have had me walking on all fours like a beast.'
Text: Spell. To play, exert Saruman or an [ISENGARD] Man. Plays on a Free Peoples Man. Special abilities in bearer's game text may not be used.

Name: Lieutenant of Orthanc
Lore: 'Do you wish to see the greatness of our army? We are the fighting Uruk-hai.'
Text: Damage +1. Maneuver: Exert Lieutenant of Orthanc to make another Uruk-hai fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Many Riddles
Lore: 'It will be hard news for Frodo....'
Text: Search. To play, exert an [ISENGARD] tracker. Plays on a companion (except the Ring-bearer). Assignment: Exert an [ISENGARD] tracker and remove [2] to assign that tracker to bearer. Bearer may exert to prevent this.

Name: Mauhur, Patrol Leader
Lore: 'Mauhúr and his lads are in the forest, and they should turn up any time now.'
Text: Tracker. Fierce. Skirmish: Remove [2] to prevent an [ISENGARD] tracker from taking wounds.

Name: Men Will Fall
Lore: 'The Ring of Barahir. So, Gandalf Greyhame thinks he has found Isildur's heir, the Lost King of Gondor... Fool! That line was broken years ago.'
Text: Skirmish: Spot Saruman or an [ISENGARD] Man to make an unbound companion strength -2.

Name: New Power Rising
Lore: 'For those who aid the Great Eye there will be rich reward.'
Text: Regroup: Spot Saruman or an [ISENGARD] Man, reveal your hand, and discard all Free Peoples cards revealed to take an [ISENGARD] card into hand from your discard pile.

Name: No Dawn for Men
Lore: 'This night, the land will be stained with the blood of Rohan....'
Text: Maneuver: Exert an Uruk-hai to exert X unbound companions, where X is the number of sites you control.

Name: Orthanc Champion
Lore: A warrior trained in single combat, he tore a swath through the defenders.
Text: Damage +1. Assignment: Exert Orthanc Champion to assign it to an unbound companion. That companion may exert to prevent this.

Name: Orthanc Warrior
Lore: The Uruk-hai bred by Saruman are stronger and more fell than Orcs of Mordor.
Text: Damage +1.

Name: The Palantir of Orthanc, Seventh Seeing-stone
Lore: 'The name meant that which looks far away.'
Text: To play, spot an [ISENGARD] minion. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Spot an [ISENGARD] minion and remove [2] to reveal the top card of any draw deck. You may place that card beneath that draw deck.

Name: Pillage of Rohan
Lore: Rumor of plunder swelled the ranks of the Isengarders.
Text: Plays on a site you control. While an Uruk-hai is stacked on this site, the Free Peoples player may not play skirmish events or use skirmish special abilities.

Name: Race Across the Mark
Lore: 'But in the meantime, the Uruk-hai of Isengard can do the dirty work as usual.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Spot a site you control and remove [2] to cancel a skirmish involving an Uruk-hai.

Name: Ranged Commander
Lore: Hand-picked Uruks led Saruman's crossbowmen.
Text: Archer. The twilight cost of each [ISENGARD] archer is -1. Archery: Exert Ranged Commander to make the Free Peoples player wound an unbound companion
column19: this minion does not add to the minion archery total.

Name: Ranks Without Number
Lore: 'All Isengard must be emptied....'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time the Free Peoples player assigns an ally to a skirmish, you may play an [ISENGARD] minion from your discard pile. That minion's twilight cost is -2.

Name: Rest While You Can
Text: Search. To play, spot an [ISENGARD] tracker. Plays on a companion. Limit 1 per companion. If bearer is killed, reveal the top 10 cards of opponent's draw deck and discard 1 Shadow card and 1 Free Peoples card. Your opponent reshuffles that deck.

Name: Rohan Is Mine
Lore: 'You have no power here, Gandalf the Grey.'
Text: To play, spot Saruman or an [ISENGARD] Man. Plays on a Free Peoples Man. Each time the Free Peoples player assigns bearer to a skirmish, exert each ally.

Name: Saruman, Black Traitor
Text: Saruman may not take wounds during the archery phase and may not be assigned to a skirmish. When you play Saruman, you may discard a condition. Shadow: Exert Saruman to play Saruman's Staff from your discard pile.

Name: Saruman, Black Traitor (T)
Text: Saruman may not take wounds during the archery phase and may not be assigned to a skirmish. When you play Saruman, you may discard a condition. Shadow: Exert Saruman to play Saruman's Staff from your discard pile.

Name: Saruman's Staff, Wizard's Device
Lore: His hand clutched his heavy black staff like a claw.
Text: Plays on Saruman. He is fierce and damage +1. Maneuver: Make the first sentence of Saruman's game text not apply until the regroup phase.

Name: Still They Came
Lore: Before the wall's foot the dead and broken were piled like shingle in a storm
Text: ever higher rose the hideous mounds....
column19: Skirmish: Exert an Uruk-hai who is not assigned to a skirmish to make another Uruk-hai strength +3.

Name: Ugluk, Servant of Saruman
Lore: 'I am Uglúk. I command.'
Text: Tracker. Fierce. The roaming penalty for each [ISENGARD] tracker you play is -2. While you can spot 2 [ISENGARD] trackers, Ugluk is strength +3. While you can spot 3 [ISENGARD] trackers, Ugluk is damage +1.

Name: Ugluk, Servant of Saruman (T)
Lore: 'I am Uglúk. I command.'
Text: Tracker. Fierce. The roaming penalty for each [ISENGARD] tracker you pay is -2. While you can spot 2 [ISENGARD] trackers, Ugluk is strength +3. While you can spot 3 [ISENGARD] trackers, Ugluk is damage +1.

Name: Ugluk's Sword
Text: Bearer must be an Uruk-hai. Shadow: If bearer is Ugluk, exert it and discard a minion from hand to play a minion. Its twilight cost is -3.

Name: Unferth, Grima's Bodyguard
Lore: Gríma promised him riches when Rohan fell to Saruman.
Text: Each time the Free Peoples player assigns a companion or ally to an [ISENGARD] Man, that companion or ally must exert.

Name: Uruk Assault Band
Text: Damage +1. To play, spot an Uruk-hai. While at a battleground, this minion is fierce. While you control a battleground, this minion is strength +6. While you control 2 battlegrounds, this minion may not take wounds.

Name: Uruk Besieger
Lore: Fresh troops awaited to attack any weakness.
Text: Damage +1. Regroup: Stack this minion on a site you control. Shadow: If stacked on a site you control, play this minion. Its twilight cost is -1.

Name: Uruk Chaser
Lore: 'Now we'll have to leg it double quick.'
Text: Tracker. Fierce. During a fierce skirmish involving this minion, it is strength +2.

Name: Uruk Crossbow Troop
Lore: Bolts from the Uruk crossbows shattered the shields of the defenders.
Text: Archer. When you play this minion, you may place an [ISENGARD] token on a machine.

Name: Uruk Crossbowman
Lore: Both the weapon and its wielder were foul creations of Saruman.
Text: Archer. Archery: Exert this minion to make the Free Peoples player wound an unbound companion
column19: this minion does not add to the minion archery total.

Name: Uruk Defender
Lore: Saruman's Uruk army trained in formation tactics.
Text: Damage +1. Skirmish: Exert this minion at a battleground to make another Uruk-hai strength +2.

Name: Uruk Fanatic
Lore: Despite intensive training, the smell of blood still enraged the Uruk warriors.
Text: Damage +1. If there are at least 3 cards in the dead pile, this minion is fierce.

Name: Uruk Follower
Lore: But at the moment Uglúk was not engaged in sport. He needed speed and had to humour unwilling followers.
Text: Tracker. Fierce. Unbound Hobbits may not be discarded. Response: If an unbound Hobbit is killed, exert this minion to add a burden.

Name: Uruk Foot Soldier
Lore: 'Evening's coming on, and we ought to get a move on.'
Text: Tracker. Fierce. During a fierce skirmish involving this minion, it is strength +3 and damage +1.

Name: Uruk Hunter
Lore: 'We came out of Isengard, and led you here, and we shall lead you back the way we choose.'
Text: Tracker. Fierce. Unbound Hobbits may not be discarded. Response: If an unbound Hobbit is killed, exert this minion twice to exhaust a companion.

Name: Uruk Plains Runner
Lore: 'Run! Or you'll never see your beloved holes again!'
Text: Tracker. Fierce. During a fierce skirmish involving this minion, it is strength +3 and damage +1.

Name: Uruk Pursuer
Lore: 'None of that! Hold your tongues.'
Text: Tracker. Fierce. Unbound Hobbits may not be discarded. Response: If an unbound Hobbit is killed, exert this minion to make the Free Peoples player wound an unbound companion.

Name: Uruk Rear Guard
Lore: Promised a fair share of plunder, they defended against possible reinforcements.
Text: Damage +1. Skirmish: Exert this minion at a battleground to make another Uruk-hai strength +1.

Name: Uruk Regular
Notes: This card's special ability makes the twilight cost of an Uruk-hai -1 for each Uruk-hai you spot other than this card. For example: if you have four Uruk Regulars in play and you use the special ability on one of them to play an Uruk Searcher (twilight cost of 4), the Searcher's twilight cost is 1.
Lore: 'We are the Uruk-hai
Text: we do not stop the fight for night or day, for fair weather or for storm.'
column19: Damage +1. Shadow: Exert this minion to play an Uruk-hai
column20: its twilight cost is -1 for each other Uruk-hai you can spot.

Name: Uruk Runner
Lore: 'Run, curse you! Run while night lasts!'
Text: Tracker. Fierce. During a fierce skirmish involving this minion, it is strength +2.

Name: Uruk Searcher
Lore: 'Why don't we search them and find out?'
Text: Tracker. Fierce. While skirmishing a character bearing a search card, this minion is strength +2 and damage +1.

Name: Uruk Seeker
Lore: 'No crying out, no trying to escape.'
Text: Tracker. Fierce. While skirmishing a character bearing a search card, this minion is strength +2 and damage +1.

Name: Uruk Spear
Lore: The Uruk-hai braced their long pikes to challenge the oncoming Riders.
Text: Bearer must be an Uruk-hai. Maneuver: Exert bearer to discard a Free Peoples mount.

Name: Uruk Stalker
Lore: A moment they hesitated, and then on they came.
Text: Damage +1. While an ally is in the dead pile, this minion is strength +3 and fierce.

Name: Uruk Stormer
Lore: They wavered, broke, and fled back
Text: and then charged again, broke and charged again
column19: and each time, like the incoming sea, they halted at a higher point.
column20: Damage +1. Each time a companion or ally is killed during a skirmish involving an Uruk-hai, you may take control of a site.

Name: Uruk Trooper
Lore: Thousands of Uruk-hai came to take the Hornburg.
Text: Damage +1. Regroup: Stack this minion on a site you control. Shadow: If stacked on a site you control, play this minion. Its twilight cost is -1.

Name: Uruk Vanguard
Lore: 'These are Uruk-hai - their armour is thick, their shields broad.'
Text: Damage +1 (or damage +2 if at a battleground). To play, spot an Uruk-hai. While at a battleground, this minion is fierce.

Name: Uruk Veteran
Lore: 'We come to kill, by sun or moon.'
Text: Damage +1. Regroup: Stack this minion on a site you control. Shadow: If stacked on a site you control, play this minion. Its twilight cost is -1.

Name: Uruk-hai Band
Lore: There were four... of greater stature, swart, slant-eyed, with thick legs and broad hands.
Text: Damage +1. This minion is strength +2 for each site you control.

Name: Uruk-hai Horde
Lore: The rumour of war grew behind them.
Text: Damage +1. The twilight cost of this minion is -1 for each site you control.

Name: Uruk-hai Marauder
Lore: 'We shall have some fun later.'
Text: Damage +1. The twilight cost of this minion is -1 for each site you control.

Name: Uruk-hai Mob
Lore: 'Let the fighting Uruk-hai do the work, as usual.'
Text: Damage +1. The twilight cost of this minion is -1 for each site you control.

Name: Uruk-hai Patrol
Lore: 'We are the servants of Saruman the Wise....'
Text: Damage +1(or damage +2 while you control a site).

Name: Uruk-hai Raiding Party
Lore: Bands of Uruks crossed the plains of Rohan.
Text: Damage +1.

Name: Vengeance
Lore: Saruman instilled a spirit for revenge in his fighting brood.
Text: Skirmish: Make an [ISENGARD] tracker strength +2 for each card borne by the character it is skirmishing.

Name: Volley Fire
Lore: Defenders on the walls made perfect targets for the Isengard crossbowmen.
Text: Archery: Discard 2 [ISENGARD] archers to exhaust an unbound companion.

Name: We Are the Fighting Uruk-hai
Lore: 'But for us you'd all have run away.'
Text: Skirmish: Make an Uruk-hai strength +2 (and damage +1 if you control a site).

Name: Weapons of Isengard
Lore: Crossbowmen arrived with munitions from Isengard.
Text: Machine. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Play an [ISENGARD] archer to place an [ISENGARD] token on this card. Archery: Remove 2 [ISENGARD] tokens from this card to make the minion archery total +2. Discard this condition.

Name: Weary
Lore: 'We shall not turn back here.'
Text: Search. Plays on a companion or ally. Limit 1 per character. Each time the Free Peoples player assigns bearer to skirmish an [ISENGARD] tracker, bearer must exert.

Name: What Did You Discover?
Lore: 'The scouts have come back at last.'
Text: Search. Plays to your support area. Each time the fellowship moves during the regroup phase, you may discard 2 cards from hand to take an [ISENGARD] tracker from your discard pile into hand.

Name: Where Has Grima Stowed It?
Lore: 'Loth was he to render up the keys. Many other things are there which men have missed.'
Text: Maneuver: Spot Grima to discard a possession borne by an ally or unbound companion.

Name: Wounded
Lore: 'He's alive!'
Text: To play, exert an [ISENGARD] Man. Plays on a Free Peoples Man. When you play this condition, exert bearer. Wounds may not be removed from bearer.

Name: Arrow From the South
Lore: Haradrim is the Gondorian name for Southrons.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a companion or ally loses a skirmish involving a [RAIDER] Man, you may place a [RAIDER] token here. Archery: Heal a [RAIDER] archer for each [RAIDER] token here. Discard this condition.

Name: Desert Lancers
Lore: 'Mordor has allied itself with... the cruel Haradrim....'
Text: Southron. To play, spot a [RAIDER] Man. Regroup: Exert Desert Lancers twice to take control of a site.

Name: Desert Legion
Text: Southron. Ambush [1]. While you can spot 4 burdens, this minion is strength +5. While you can spot 5 burdens, this minion is fierce. While you can spot 6 burdens, this minion is damage +1.

Name: Desert Lord
Lore: Southron legends tell of powerful warrior leaders and the kingdoms they have conquered.
Text: Southron. Archer. Archery: Exert Desert Lord to exert a companion (except the Ring-bearer)
column19: Desert Lord does not add to the minion archery total.

Name: Desert Lord (T)
Lore: Southron legends tell of powerful warrior leaders and the kingdoms they have conquered.
Text: Southron. Archer. Archery: Exert Desert Lord to exert a companion (exept the Ring-bearer)
column19: Desert Lord does not add to the minion archery total.

Name: Desert Soldier
Lore: 'Not nice
Text: very cruel wicked Men they look.'
column19: Southron. At the start of each skirmish involving this minion, you may remove [3] to wound a companion or ally he is skirmishing.

Name: Desert Spearman
Lore: Long spears are used by Southrons to attack while riding desert beasts.
Text: Southron. At the start of each skirmish involving this minion, you may remove [3] to wound a companion or ally he is skirmishing.

Name: Desert Warrior
Lore: The Haradrim wear cloaks and head wraps to survive the deserts of their homeland.
Text: Southron. At the start of each skirmish involving this minion, you may remove [3] to wound a companion or ally he is skirmishing.

Name: Discovered
Lore: The voices and the clink of weapons and harness were very close.
Text: Maneuver: Exert a [RAIDER] Man to discard a Free Peoples condition (or 2 Free Peoples conditions if you spot 3 burdens).

Name: Easterling Axeman
Lore: Poleaxes wielded by tall Easterling warriors cut through armor and bone.
Text: Easterling. While you can spot 2 burdens, this minion is strength +3 and fierce.

Name: Easterling Captain
Text: Easterling. Fierce. Skirmish: Spot 2 burdens and remove [2] to make an Easterling strength +2. Skirmish: Spot 4 burdens and remove [2] to make an Easterling strength +3. Skirmish: Spot 6 burdens and remove [2] to make an Easterling strength +4.

Name: Easterling Captain (T)
Text: Easterling. Fierce. Skirmish: Spot 2 burdens and remove [2] to make an Easterling strength +2. Skirmish: Spot 4 burdens and remove [2] to make an Easterling strength +3. Skirmish: Spot 6 burdens and remove [2] to make an Easterling strength +4.

Name: Easterling Guard
Lore: Armored Easterlings protect their commanders from enemy assaults.
Text: Easterling. Each time this minion is assigned to an unbound companion, you may exert him to add a burden.

Name: Easterling Infantry
Lore: Sometimes called the Men of Rhûn, the Easterlings hated Gondor for her riches.
Text: Easterling. While you can spot 3 burdens, this minion is fierce and damage +1.

Name: Easterling Lieutenant
Lore: 'Easterlings... have passed through the Black Gate....'
Text: Easterling. Each time this minion is assigned to an unbound companion, you may exert him to add a burden.

Name: Easterling Skirmisher
Lore: Enemy formations are threatened by the spears of Easterling light troops.
Text: Easterling. When you play this minion, you may spot another Easterling to add [1] for each burden (limit [4]).

Name: Easterling Trooper
Lore: Trained Easterling fighters formed ranks of axes and spears to charge the knights of Gondor.
Text: Easterling. While you can spot 3 burdens, this minion is fierce and damage +1.

Name: Eastern Emyn Muil
Lore: The Emyn Muil was a strange, twisted knot of hills.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each Ring-bound companion moving from site 2T must exert twice. Maneuver: Discard this condition and exert a [RAIDER] Man to exert a Ring-bound companion.

Name: Elite Archer
Lore: Veteran bowmen are highly valued in the kingdoms of the South.
Text: Southron. Archer. Archery: Exert this minion to exert a companion (except the Ring-bearer)
column19: this minion does not add to the minion archery total.

Name: Fearless
Lore: Despite their foreign ways, the Men from the South and East were formidable fighters.
Text: Skirmish: Make a Southron strength +1 for each burden you spot (limit +5), or make a [RAIDER] Man strength +2.

Name: Flanking Attack
Lore: 'Our scouts report more Haradrim making their way up here....'
Text: Maneuver or Skirmish: Exert a Southron to add [3].

Name: Gathering to the Summons
Lore: These were Men of other race, out of the wide Eastlands....
Text: Skirmish: Spot a [RAIDER] Man skirmishing a Ring-bound companion to add a burden.

Name: Howl of Harad
Lore: Blood-curdling cries rout the Southrons' enemies from the battlefield.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a companion or ally loses a skirmish involving a Southron, you may remove [4] to make the Free Peoples Player wound a Ring-bound companion.

Name: Ithilien Wilderness
Text: Plays to your support area. At the end of each phase during which the fellowship moved to site 7[TOWER], 8[TOWER], or 9[TOWER] and the twilight pool has fewer than 7 twilight tokens, you may add [8]. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make a [RAIDER] Man strength +2.

Name: Men of Harad
Lore: The savage Haradrim, men from the kingdoms south of Gondor and Mordor, were called Southrons.
Text: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Spot a site you control, spot 3 Southrons, and remove [2] to draw a card.

Name: Men of Rhun
Lore: Sudden war came upon Gondor out of Rhûn, land of the East.
Text: Skirmish: Make a [RAIDER] Man strength +3 (or +4 if you spot 4 burdens).

Name: New Fear
Lore: They heard singing and coarse shouting. At first it seemed a long way off, but it drew nearer....
Text: Regroup: Exert a [RAIDER] Man to add a burden for each companion over 4. The Free Peoples player may discard 2 companions (except the Ring-bearer) to prevent this.

Name: On the March
Lore: Easterlings traveled up the ancient roads of Gondor to swell the hosts of the Dark Tower.
Text: Skirmish: Make a [RAIDER] Man strength +3 (or +5 if you spot 6 companions).

Name: Raiders From the East
Lore: The Easterlings raid their enemies to gather supplies and equipment.
Text: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Remove [3] and exert a [RAIDER] Man to place a [RAIDER] token here. Maneuver: Remove a [RAIDER] token here to add [1].

Name: Rapid Fire
Lore: Wars between the southern kingdoms taught speed and precision to the archers of the Haradrim.
Text: Archery: Exert a [RAIDER] archer to make the minion archery total +1 for each burden (limit +5).

Name: Regiment of Haradrim
Lore: 'One of their regiments is due by our reckoning to pass by, some time ere noon....'
Text: Southron. To play, spot a [RAIDER] Man. Regroup: Exert Regiment of Haradrim twice to take control of a site.

Name: Southron Archer
Lore: 'They have passed on to the Black Gate
Text: but more may follow.'
column19: Southron. Archer. While you can spot another Southron, the minion archery total is +1 for each site you control.

Name: Southron Assassin
Lore: 'Some of the Southrons have broken from the trap and are flying from the road.'
Text: Southron. Each time a companion or ally loses a skirmish involving a Southron, you may remove [1] to make the Free Peoples player wound a Ring-bound companion.

Name: Southron Bow
Lore: Volleys from Southron bows are deadly in large numbers.
Text: Bearer must be a [RAIDER] Man. Bearer is an archer. While you can spot another [RAIDER] Man, the minion archery total is +1.

Name: Southron Bowman
Lore: The Southron armies deploy archers to harass enemy troop formations.
Text: Southron. Archer. Archery: Exert this minion to exert a companion (except the Ring-bearer)
column19: this minion does not add to the minion archery total.

Name: Southron Commander
Lore: 'Almost as bad as Orcs, and much bigger.'
Text: Southron. Ambush [1]. Assignment: Spot 6 companions to assign this minion to the Ring-bearer. The Free Peoples player may discard an unbound companion to prevent this.

Name: Southron Explorer
Lore: Scouts find oases for Southron armies as they cross the deserts of Harad.
Text: Southron. Regroup: Exert this minion and remove [5] to take control of a site.

Name: Southron Fighter
Notes: The foil version of this card has a different image from the non-foil version.
Lore: '...they have come out of the South beyond the Great River's end....'
Text: Southron. Ambush [1]. Maneuver: Exert this minion and spot 5 companions to make the Free Peoples player exert a companion.

Name: Southron Scout
Lore: 'They have black eyes, and long black hair, and gold rings in their ears....'
Text: Southron. Ambush [2].

Name: Southron Sentry
Lore: Pickets guarded the borders of the Southron encampment.
Text: Southron. Maneuver: Exert this minion to add [2] for each site you control.

Name: Southron Soldier
Lore: The kingdoms of Harad fight countless wars and train thousands of warriors.
Text: Southron. Ambush [2].

Name: Southron Spear
Lore: Long pikes defend the Southrons against the armored knights of Gondor.
