Text: Bearer must be a Southron. Skirmish: Remove [4] and exert bearer to wound a companion or ally bearer is skirmishing.

Name: Southron Troop
Text: Southron. Archer. Ambush [1]. To play, spot a Southron. Assignment: Spot 7 companions to assign this minion to the Ring-bearer. The Free Peoples player may make you discard a companion (except the Ring-bearer) to prevent this.

Name: Southron Veterans
Lore: He caught a glimpse of swarthy men... running down the slope some way off....
Text: Southron. Ambush [1]. Maneuver: Exert this minion and spot 6 companions to make the Free Peoples player exert 2 companions.

Name: Southron Wanderer
Lore: Some desert warriors have no allegiance and work for any faction that will pay them.
Text: Southron. Ambush [1]. Assignment: Exert this minion and spot 5 companions to assign this minion to the Ring-bearer. The Free Peoples player may add [4] to prevent this.

Name: Vision From Afar
Lore: Then he knew that the hope that had for one wild moment stirred in his heart was vain.
Text: Assignment: Assign an Easterling to the Ring-bearer. The Free Peoples player may add a burden to prevent this.

Name: Whirling Strike
Lore: The Southrons fight with tactics the men of Gondor have never before seen.
Text: Skirmish: Wound a companion or ally skirmishing a [RAIDER] Man.

Name: Wrath of Harad
Lore: Massed Southron troops prepared to attack Gondor.
Text: Plays to your support area. While you can spot a [RAIDER] Man, each Free Peoples event that spots or exerts a ranger gains this cost: 'wound a companion.' Skirmish: Discard this condition to make a [RAIDER] Man strength +2.

Name: Aldor, Soldier of Edoras
Lore: Fighting to defend his people, Aldor found courage to replace his youth.
Text: Archery: Exert Aldor and spot a villager to make the fellowship archery total +1.

Name: Brego
Lore: Brego was named for the second King of Rohan.
Text: To play, spot a [ROHAN] Man. Bearer must be a Man, Elf, or Wizard. When you play Brego, you may heal bearer. At the start of each skirmish involving bearer, each minion skirmishing bearer must exert.

Name: Ceorl, Weary Horseman
Lore: 'We were driven back yesterday over the Isen with great loss
Text: many perished at the crossing.'
column19: Response: If your opponent is about to take control of a site, exert Ceorl and a villager to prevent this.

Name: Elite Rider
Lore: After him they rode: a long line of mailclad men, swift, shining, fell and fair to look upon.
Text: When this companion is in your starting fellowship, his twilight cost is -1. While skirmishing a wounded minion, this companion is strength +2.

Name: Eomer, Sister-son of Theoden
Lore: 'Now indeed there is hope of victory!'
Text: While you can spot a [ROHAN] Man, Eomer's twilight cost is -1. At the start of each turn, you may heal a [ROHAN] ally.

Name: Eomer, Third Marshal of Riddermark
Lore: Then one rode forward, a tall man, taller than the rest
Text: from his helm as a crest a white horsetail flowed.
column19: While you can spot a [ROHAN] Man, Eomer's twilight cost is -1. Eomer is strength +2 for each wound on each minion he is skirmishing.

Name: Eomer's Spear
Lore: He advanced until the point of his spear was within a foot of Aragorn's breast.
Text: Bearer must be a [ROHAN] Man. If bearer is Eomer and he is mounted, Eomer is damage +2.

Name: Eothain, Scout of the Mark
Lore: 'Time is pressing.... We must hasten south, lord.'
Text: Each time the fellowship moves to a plains site, each minion must exert.

Name: Eowyn, Lady of Rohan
Lore: Thus Aragorn... beheld Éowyn... and thought her fair, fair and cold, like a morning of pale spring that is not yet come to womanhood.
Text: Valiant. Response: If an unbound companion is about to take a wound, exert Eowyn and add [1] to prevent that wound.

Name: Eowyn, Sister-daughter of Theoden
Lore: Slender and tall she was... but strong she seemed and stern as steel, a daughter of kings.
Text: Valiant. Response: If Eowyn is exhausted and about to take a wound in a skirmish, discard 2 cards from hand to prevent that wound.

Name: Eowyn's Sword
Lore: ...the sword was set upright before her, and her hands were laid upon the hilt.
Text: Bearer must be Eowyn. While you can spot a villager, Eowyn is damage +1.

Name: Fight for the Villagers
Lore: 'Bar the gates, set a watch on the surrounds, and get the women and children to the caves.'
Text: Skirmish: Make a [ROHAN] Man strength +2 (or +3 if you spot a villager).

Name: Firefoot
Lore: Riders of his éored claimed that Éomer's horse had no equal, save Shadowfax.
Text: Bearer must be a [ROHAN] Man. If bearer is Eomer, he is defender +1. At the start of each skirmish involving bearer, each minion skirmishing bearer must exert.

Name: Forth Eorlingas!
Lore: Behind them from the Deep came the stern cries of men issuing from the caves, driving forth the enemy.'
Text: Maneuver: Exert Theoden to make a companion who has the Theoden signet defender +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Fortress Never Fallen
Lore: '...it was the spirit of your people that held it strong.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a [ROHAN] Man wins a skirmish, you may place a [ROHAN] token on this card. Regroup: Discard a Shadow condition for each [ROHAN] token here. Discard this condition.

Name: Guma, Plains Farmer
Lore: Foodstores swelled as refugees like Guma brought provisions to the Hornburg.
Text: Villager. Discard Guma if an opponent controls his home site. Fellowship: Exert Guma to heal a [ROHAN] Man.

Name: Heavy Chain
Lore: What Man of an earlier age wore this chain? Was his end worth a song?
Text: Bearer must be a Man. Bearer may not be overwhelmed unless his or her strength is tripled.

Name: Helm! Helm!
Lore: And with that shout the king came. His horse was white as snow, golden was his shield, and his spear was long.
Text: Regroup: Spot 2 mounted [ROHAN] Men to liberate a site or draw 3 cards.

Name: Herugrim
Lore: 'Here, lord, is Herugrim, your ancient blade....'
Text: Bearer must be Theoden. He is damage +1.

Name: Hlafwine, Village Farmhand
Lore: Too old to fight, Hlafwine prepared meals for the defenders.
Text: Villager. Discard Hlafwine if an opponent controls his home site. Skirmish: Exert Hlafwine to make a [ROHAN] Man strength +2.

Name: An Honorable Charge
Lore: 'A time may come when there will be a need for valour without renown....'
Text: Skirmish: Make an unbound companion strength +1 for each [ROHAN] Man you spot (limit +3).

Name: Horse of Rohan
Lore: Very swift were the horses of Rohan.
Text: To play, spot a [ROHAN] Man. Bearer must be a Man, Elf, or Wizard. At the start of each skirmish involving bearer, each minion skirmishing bearer must exert.

Name: King's Mail
Lore: Now men came bearing raiment of war from the king's hoard....
Text: Bearer must be a [ROHAN] Man. Bearer takes no more than 1 wound during each skirmish phase. If bearer is Theoden, he may not take wounds except during a skirmish involving him.

Name: Leod, Westfold Herdsman
Lore: Humble Léod was a rancher before he became a soldier at Helm's Deep.
Text: Villager. Discard Leod if an opponent controls his home site. Skirmish: Exert Leod to make a mounted companion strength +2.

Name: Rider of Rohan
Lore: 'They are proud and wilful, but they are true-hearted, generous in thought and deed....'
Text: Skirmish: If this companion is mounted, exert him to exert a minion skirmishing an unbound companion.

Name: Rider's Mount
Lore: Their horses were of great stature, strong and clean-limbed
Text: their grey coats glistened, their long tails flowed in the wind....
column19: Bearer must be a [ROHAN] Man. At the start of each skirmish involving bearer, each minion skirmishing bearer must exert.

Name: Rider's Spear
Lore: Shafts of the sun flared above the eastern hills and glimmered on their spears.
Text: Bearer must be a [ROHAN] Man. If bearer is mounted, bearer is damage +1.

Name: Simbelmyne
Lore: 'How fair are the bright eyes in the grass! Evermind they are called... for they blossom in all seasons of the year, and grow where dead men rest.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot 2 [ROHAN] Men (or 1 valiant [ROHAN] Man) to play a [ROHAN] character or [ROHAN] possession from your draw deck.

Name: Simbelmyne (T)
Lore: 'How fair are the bright eyes in the grass! Evermind they are called... for they blossom in all seasons of the year, and grow where dead men rest.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot 2 [ROHAN] Men (or 1 valiant [ROHAN] Man) to play a [ROHAN] character or [ROHAN] possession from your draw deck.

Name: Supplies of the Mark
Lore: 'This is all we could save, my Lady.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Fellowship: Add [2] and place a villager from hand beneath your draw deck to heal a [ROHAN] ally.

Name: Sword of Rohan
Lore: 'This is a good sword, Haleth, son of Háma... there is always hope.'
Text: Bearer must be a [ROHAN] Man. While bearer is skirmishing an Uruk-hai, bearer is damage +1.

Name: Theoden, Son of Thengel
Lore: 'I myself will go to war, to fall in the front of the battle, if it must be.'
Text: Regroup: Spot a [ROHAN] ally and exert Theoden to liberate a site.

Name: Valleys of the Mark
Lore: 'Where is the hand on the harpstring, and the red fire glowing? / Where is the spring and the harvest and the tall corn growing?'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time your opponent plays a roaming minion, you may spot a villager to exert that minion.

Name: Weapon Store
Lore: 'And to you my other guests I will offer such things as may be found in my armoury.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Fellowship: Exert a [ROHAN] Man to play a hand weapon from your discard pile.

Name: Weland, Smith of the Riddermark
Lore: A tender of horses, Weland found much work at Helm's Deep.
Text: Villager. Discard Weland if an opponent controls his home site. Fellowship: Exert Weland to heal a mounted companion.

Name: Well Stored
Lore: 'Behind us in the caves of the Deep are... old and young, children and women. But great store of food, and many beasts and their fodder, have also been gathered there.'
Text: Plays to your support area. At the start of each fellowship phase, you may heal a villager.

Name: Work for the Sword
Lore: 'The Orcs are destroyed. We slaughtered them during the night.'
Text: Skirmish: Make a [ROHAN] Man strength +2 (and damage +2 if mounted).

Name: Brace of Coneys
Lore: 'He let them stew for close on an hour, testing them now and again with his fork, and tasting the broth.'
Text: Bearer must be a Ring-bound Hobbit. Fellowship: Discard this possession to remove a burden.

Name: Cliffs of Emyn Muil
Lore: 'We've escaped from the Emyn Muil!'
Text: Plays to your support area. When the fellowship moves from site 1T, remove up to 2 burdens. Skirmish: Discard this condition to wound a minion a Hobbit companion is skirmishing.

Name: Escape
Lore: Suddenly Merry and Pippin realized that without moving they were now outside the circle....
Text: Stealth. Bearer must be an unbound Hobbit. Limit 1 per character. Skirmish: Exert bearer twice to cancel a skirmish involving him. Any Shadow player may remove [1] to prevent this.

Name: Frodo, Courteous Halfling
Notes: This card only prevents Shadow cards that make you discard from hand or draw deck. If a Shadow card gives you a choice, you may choose to discard. For example: if a Dunlending Rampager is played, Courteous Halfling does not prevent the Free Peoples player from discarding. Since the game text of the Rampager says may discard,  a choice is provided.
Lore: 'But as for us, we are Hobbits of the Shire, far to the North and West, beyond many rivers.'
Text: Ring-bearer (resistance 10). While you can spot 3 unbound companions, Shadow cards may not discard cards from your hand or from the top of your draw deck.

Name: Frodo, Courteous Halfling (T)
Notes: Tengwar. This card only prevents Shadow cards that make you discard from hand or draw deck. If a Shadow card gives you a choice, you may choose to discard. For example: if a Dunlending Rampager is played, Courteous Halfling does not prevent the Free Peoples player from discarding. Since the game text of the Rampager says may discard,  a choice is provided.
Lore: 'But as for us, we are Hobbits of the Shire, far to the North and West, beyond many rivers.'
Text: Ring-bearer (resistance 10). While you can spot 3 unbound companions, Shadow cards may not discard cards from your hand or from the top of your draw deck.

Name: Frodo, Tired Traveller
Lore: 'We have come by long ways - out of Rivendell, or Imladris as some call it.'
Text: Ring-bearer (resistance 10). Fellowship: Play a Ring-bound companion to remove a burden.

Name: Frodo's Cloak
Lore: Neither weather nor searching eyes found Frodo.
Text: Bearer must be Frodo. Skirmish: At sites 1T to 4T, add a burden and discard this possession to cancel a skirmish involving Frodo. At any other site, discard this possession to remove a burden and heal Frodo.

Name: Get On and Get Away
Lore: 'The Dead can't be really there! Is it some devilry hatched in the Dark Land?'
Text: Fellowship: Add 2 burdens to play the fellowship's next 2 sites (replacing opponent's sites if necessary).

Name: Good Work
Lore: 'You seem to have been doing well, Master Took.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a Hobbit wins a skirmish, you may place a [SHIRE] token here. Fellowship: Remove a burden for each [SHIRE] token here (limit 3). Discard this condition.

Name: Hobbit Sword
Lore: Although the Ranger had never before seen a Hobbit, he recognized the swords they carried.
Text: Bearer must be a Hobbit.

Name: Impatient and Angry
Lore: He planted himself... as if he was addressing a young hobbit who had offered him what he called 'sauce' when questioned about visits to the orchard.
Text: Skirmish: Exert Sam to make him strength +3. If Sam wins this skirmish, you may remove a burden.

Name: Knocked on the Head
Lore: 'I wonder if poor Merry is much hurt.'
Text: Regroup: Play an unbound Hobbit from your discard pile.

Name: Light Shining Faintly
Lore: 'He's like that, and sometimes it shines through, somehow.'
Text: Fellowship: Add a burden to heal a Ring-bound companion twice.

Name: Merry, Learned Guide
Lore: 'I don't suppose you have much notion where we are
Text: but I spent my time at Rivendell rather better.'
column19: Skirmish: Exert the Ring-bearer to discard Merry. Any Shadow player may remove [2] to prevent this.

Name: Merry, Unquenchable Hobbit
Lore: 'All Wizards should have a hobbit or two in their care - to teach them the meaning of the word, and to correct them.'
Text: Skirmish: If Merry is not assigned to a skirmish, discard him to remove a [SAURON] Orc from a skirmish involving an unbound companion.

Name: Mind Your Own Affairs
Lore: 'Yet those who claim to oppose the Enemy would do well not to hinder it.'
Text: Skirmish: Spot Frodo and add a burden to wound a minion skirmishing a companion who has the Frodo signet.

Name: Pippin, Just a Nuisance
Lore: 'What good have I been?... a passenger, a piece of luggage.'
Text: Skirmish: If Pippin is not assigned to a skirmish, discard him to remove an Uruk-hai from a skirmish involving an unbound companion.

Name: Pippin, Woolly-footed Rascal
Lore: 'We had foul fare with the Orcs, and little enough for days before that. It seems a long while since we could eat to heart's content.'
Text: Skirmish: Add a burden to discard Pippin. Any Shadow player may remove [2] to prevent this.

Name: Sam, Frodo's Gardener
Lore: 'I am only a hobbit, and gardening's my job at home, sir, if you understand me....'
Text: Ring-bound. Fellowship: Play Sam's Pack from your draw deck. Response: If Frodo is killed, make Sam the Ring-bearer (resistance 5).

Name: Sam, Samwise the Brave
Lore: 'Frodo wouldn't have got far without Sam....'
Text: Ring-bound. Response: If a Shadow card is about to add any number of burdens, spot Frodo and exert Sam to prevent this. Response: If Frodo is killed, make Sam the Ring-bearer (resistance 5).

Name: Sam's Pack
Lore: He still hopefully carried some of his gear in his pack....
Text: Bearer must be a Ring-bound Hobbit. At the start of each turn, you may add [2] to heal a Ring-bound companion.

Name: Seven We Had
Lore: '...one we lost at Moria, the others we left at Parth Galen above Rauros....'
Text: Fellowship: Add a burden to discard a condition borne by a Hobbit.

Name: Severed His Bonds
Lore: 'The cord was cut!'
Text: Stealth. Skirmish: At sites 1T to 4T, cancel a skirmish involving a Hobbit. At any other site, prevent a Hobbit from being overwhelmed unless his or her strength is tripled.

Name: Store-room
Lore: 'Saruman kept enough wisdom not to trust his Orcs. He had Men to guard his gates.... Anyway, they were favoured and got good provisions.'
Text: Regroup: Heal an unbound Hobbit once (or twice if you spot Gandalf).

Name: Swiftly and Softly
Lore: In the deep of night under hard clear stars they set off.
Text: Stealth. Skirmish: At sites 1T to 5T, cancel a skirmish involving a Hobbit. At any other site, prevent a Hobbit from taking more than 1 wound.

Name: Warmed Up a Bit
Lore: '...we shall be able to stand again, and walk.'
Text: Stealth. Skirmish: Discard an unbound Hobbit.

Name: East Wall of Rohan
Text: When the fellowship moves from East Wall of Rohan, add [2].

Name: Eastemnet Downs
Text: Each time you play a companion here, you must discard 2 cards from hand.

Name: Eastemnet Gullies
Text: Fellowship: Exert 2 unbound companions to play Legolas from your draw deck.

Name: Horse-country
Notes: This Two Towers card was misprinted in an Ents of Fangorn starter deck.
Text: Plains. While you can spot a [ROHAN] mount at Horse-country, the move limit is +1 for this turn.

Name: Plains of Rohan
Text: Plains. Fellowship: Exert 2 unbound companions to play Gimli from your draw deck.

Name: The Riddermark
Text: Plains. Fellowship: Exert 2 unbound companions to play Aragorn from your draw deck.

Name: Western Emyn Muil
Text: When the Fellowship moves from Western Emyn Muil, each Ring-bound companion must exert.

Name: Derndingle
Notes: This Two Towers card was misprinted in an Ents of Fangorn starter deck.
Text: Forest. While you can spot an unbound Hobbit at Derndingle, the move limit is +1 for this turn.

Name: Eastfold
Text: Plains. Shadow: Spot 3 [ISENGARD] trackers to prevent the fellowship from moving again this turn.

Name: Fangorn Forest
Text: Forest. Fellowship: Play Treebeard from your draw deck.

Name: Plains of Rohan Camp
Text: Plains. At the start of each fellowship phase, heal up to 3 wounds from companions.

Name: Rohirrim Village
Text: Each [DUNLAND] Man may not take wounds during the archery phase.

Name: Uruk Camp
Text: Plains. Battleground. Each time an Uruk-hai is played, that minion must exert.

Name: Wold of Rohan
Text: Plains. Each time the Free Peoples player assigns a companion or ally to a skirmish, add [1].

Name: Barrows of Edoras
Text: Sanctuary. Fellowship: Place your hand beneath your draw deck and draw 4 cards.

Name: Golden Hall
Text: Sanctuary. When the fellowship moves to Golden Hall, all Free Peoples weapons must be discarded.

Name: Stables
Text: Sanctuary. Fellowship: Exert a [ROHAN] Man to play a [ROHAN] mount from your draw deck (limit once per turn).

Name: Streets of Edoras
Text: Sanctuary. Each [ROHAN] ally may not participate in archery fire or skirmishes at Streets of Edoras.

Name: Throne Room
Text: Sanctuary. Fellowship: Play Theoden from your draw deck.

Name: Westemnet Plains
Text: Plains. Sanctuary. Each [DUNLAND] Man may not take wounds during the archery phase.

Name: Ered Nimrais
Notes: When Smeagol is played to Ered Nimrais and The Nine Walkers is in play, his twilight cost is 1.
Text: Mountain. The twilight cost of each companion and ally played at Ered Nimrais is +3.

Name: Westemnet Hills
Text: Plains. When the fellowship moves to Westemnet Hills, heal each mounted companion and mounted ally.

Name: White Mountains
Text: Mountain. When the fellowship moves to White Mountains, Theoden or 2 companions must exert.

Name: White Rocks
Text: Battleground. The Shadow number of this site is +1 for each mounted companion.

Name: Deep of Helm
Text: Plains. Battleground. The twilight cost of the first Uruk-hai played at Deep of Helm each turn is -3.

Name: Deeping Wall
Text: Battleground. Shadow: Play Saruman from your draw deck.

Name: Helm's Gate
Text: Battleground. Each companion and minion bearing a hand weapon is strength +2.

Name: Hornburg Courtyard
Text: Battleground. While you can spot Aragorn, the Shadow number of Hornburg Courtyard is -2.

Name: Hornburg Parapet
Text: Battleground. The fellowship archery total is +1. The minion archery total is -1.

Name: Caves of Aglarond
Notes: Version: *. Game text is a clarification.
Text: Underground. Sanctuary. Maneuver: Spot your Uruk-hai and remove [2] to make one of your Uruk-hai fierce until the regroup phase.

Name: Great Hall
Notes: Each [ROHAN] ally participates in archery fire and skirmishes at this site as if this were his or her home site.
Text: Sanctuary. Battleground. Each [ROHAN] ally may participate in archery fire and skirmishes at Great Hall.

Name: Hornburg Armory
Text: Sanctuary. Fellowship: Play a possession to draw a card.

Name: Cavern Entrance
Text: Underground. Skirmish events may not be played and skirmish special abilities may not be used.

Name: Hornburg Causeway
Text: Battleground. The minion archery total is +2 for each unbound companion over 3

Name: King's Room
Text: When the fellowship moves to King's Room without a [ROHAN] companion, each unbound companion must exert.

Name: Ring of Isengard
Text: Shadow: Play a [DUNLAND] minion to draw a card.

Name: Wizard's Vale
Text: At the start of the first Shadow phase, if the twilight pool has fewer than 9 twilight tokens, add [4] (limit once per turn).

Name: Fortress of Orthanc
Text: Battleground. The Shadow number of Fortress of Orthanc is +2 for each companion over 4.

Name: Orthanc Balcony
Text: Battleground. Shadow: Play Saruman from your discard pile
column19: his twilight cost is -2.

Name: Orthanc Library
Text: When the fellowship moves to Orthanc Library, each Shadow player may draw a card for each companion over 4.

Name: Palantir Chamber
Text: Shadow: Remove 2 burdens to play a minion from your discard pile.

Name: Aragorn, Wingfoot
Lore: 'Forty leagues and five you have measured ere the fourth day is ended! Hardy is the race of Elendil!'
Text: Ranger. Each time the fellowship moves, you may wound a minion for each unbound Hobbit you spot.

Name: Aragorn, Wingfoot (T)
Lore: 'Forty leagues and five you have measured ere the fourth day is ended! Hardy is the race of Elendil!'
Text: Ranger. Each time the fellowship moves, you may wound a minion for each unbound Hobbit you spot.

Name: Theoden, Lord of the Mark
Lore: 'Every man and strong lad able to bear arms, all who have horses, let them be ready in the saddle at the gate ere the second hour from noon!'
Text: Fellowship: Play a [ROHAN] possession on a [ROHAN] companion to heal that companion (limit once per turn).

Name: The One Ring (M)
Notes: Oversized. Release schedule for 2004-2007: 8. Siege of Gondor - March 2004. 9. Mount Doom - July 2004. 10. Shadows - November 2004. 11. Black Rider - March 2005. 12. Bloodlines - July 2005. 13. The Hunters - November 2005. 14. Rise of Saruman - March 2006. 15. Treachery and Deceit - July 2006. 16. The Great Eye - November 2006. 17. Shelob's Lair - March 2007. 19. Age's End - July 2007.

Name: Legolas, Dauntless Hunter (M)
Text: Archer. The twilight cost of each Shadow event and Shadow condition is +1 for each unbound Hobbit you can spot.

Name: Dunlending Rampager
Lore: To kill and destroy was the mission of the wild hillmen.
Text: When you play this minion, the Free Peoples player may discard 2 cards from hand to discard him.

Name: Dunlending Renegade
Lore: The strength of the hillmen was driven by passion and anger.
Text: When you play this minion, the Free Peoples player may discard 2 cards from hand to discard him.

Name: Leaping Blaze
Lore: ...they saw torches, countless points of fiery light upon the black fields behind, scattered like red flowers, or winding up from the lowlands....
Text: Shadow: Spot 3 [DUNLAND] minions to shuffle your hand into your draw deck and draw 8 cards. The Free Peoples player may discard 3 cards from hand to prevent this.

Name: Wild Men of the Hills
Lore: The swarm of Dunlendings destroyed everything in its path.
Text: The twilight cost of this minion is -2 during the skirmish phase. When you play this minion, the Free Peoples player may discard 4 cards from hand to discard it.

Name: Baruk Khazad
Lore: ...a small dark figure that none had observed sprang out of the shadows and gave a hoarse shout....
Text: Maneuver: Exert a Dwarf to wound a minion. You may take the next maneuver action.

Name: Defending the Keep
Lore: 'I have fought many wars, master Dwarf. I know how to defend my own Keep.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot a Dwarf to Draw a card or play a [DWARVEN] condition from your discard pile.

Name: Gimli, Skilled Defender
Lore: Despite Théoden's preparations, Gimli found it necessary to warn him of the advancing Uruk army.
Text: Damage +1. Each time Gimli wins a skirmish, you may wound a minion assigned to skirmish an unbound companion.

Name: Horn of Helm
Lore: ...sudden and terrible, from the tower above, the sound of the great horn of Helm rang out.
Text: Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Exert a Dwarf companion to make each minion at a battleground lose all damage bonuses until the regroup phase.

Name: More to My Liking
Lore: 'This country has tough bones.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Stack the top card from your draw deck here (limit once per phase). Maneuver: Spot a Dwarf and discard a card stacked on a [DWARVEN] condition to take a Free Peoples card stacked here into hand.

Name: Balglin, Elven Warrior
Lore: He is a strong fighter. He asks for no quarter and gives none.
Text: To play, spot an Elf. While skirmishing a wounded minion, Balglin takes no more than 1 wound during each skirmish phase.

Name: Break the Charge
Lore: A storm of white arrows answered the attacking hand of Isengard.
Text: Archery: Exert 3 Elf companions to make the fellowship archery total +2.

Name: Legolas' Sword
Lore: Legolas wielded a longsword to strike from horseback.
Text: Bearer must be Legolas. Each time the fellowship moves, you may spot a wounded minion to heal Legolas.

Name: Taurnil, Sharp-eyed Bowman
Lore: Taurnil's careful aim can disarm his enemies at long range.
Text: To play, spot an Elf. While Taurnil bears a ranged weapon, the twilight cost of each Shadow possession is +2, and he does not add to the fellowship archery total.

Name: That Is No Orc Horn
Lore: Anxious defenders cheered the welcome sound of Elvish trumpets.
Text: Regroup: Spot 3 Elf companions to heal a companion and liberate a site.

Name: Birchseed, Tall Statesman
Lore: Slender and royal, he presided over many Entmoots.
Text: Unhasty. Assignment: Exert an unbound Hobbit or discard 2 cards from hand to allow Birchseed to skirmish. Fellowship: Exert Birchseed to Heal an unbound Hobbit.

Name: Down From the Hills
Lore: Down leaped Shadowfax, like a deer....
Text: Spell. Maneuver: Exert Gandalf 3 times to make an unbound companion with the Gandalf signet strength +5, defender +1, damage +2, and unable to take wounds until the regroup phase.

Name: Forest Guardian
Lore: 'We keep off strangers and the foolhardy
Text: and we train and we teach, we walk and we weed.'
column19: Unhasty. Assignment: Exert an unbound Hobbit or discard 2 cards from hand to allow this companion to skirmish.

Name: Fury of the White Rider
Lore: The White Rider was upon them, and the terror of his coming filled the enemy with madness.
Text: Spell. Maneuver: Spot 3 twilight tokens and exert Gandalf to wound a minion twice.

Name: Lindenroot, Elder Shepherd
Lore: A most well-founded and considerate Ent.
Text: Unhasty. Assignment: Exert an unbound Hobbit or discard 2 cards from hand to allow Lidenroot to skirmish. Skirmish: Exert Lidenroot to wound an [ISENGARD] minion he is skirmishing.

Name: Turn of the Tide
Lore: 'Indeed my friends, none of you have any weapon that could hurt me.'
Text: Spell. Maneuver: Exert Gandalf to discard up to 2 shadow possessions. Any Shadow player may discard a minion to prevent this.

Name: Be Back Soon
Lore: 'Now I wonder where he's got to?'
Text: Maneuver: Discard Smeagol to discard a minion. An opponent may exert a minion twice to prevent this.

Name: Evil-smelling Fens
Lore: 'No birds here. There are snakeses, wormses, things in the pools. Lots of things, lots of nasty things.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each site on the adventure path is a marsh. Shadow: Exert Gollum twice and discard this condition to play a minion from your discard pile.

Name: Follow Smeagol
Lore: 'Follow Sméagol very carefully, and you may go a long way, quite a long way, before He catches you, yes perhaps.'
Text: Plays on Smeagol. Regroup: Exert Smeagol or Gollum to play the fellowship's next site ( replacing opponent's site if necessary ).

Name: Gollum, Nasty Treacherous Creature
Lore: '...we won't let you go, either. You're full of wickedness and mischief, Gollum.'
Text: Regroup: Discard Gollum to exert a companion or ally.

Name: Gollum, Stinker
Lore: 'Still he's a Baggins, my precious, yes, a Baggins. A Baggins stole it. He found it and he said nothing. We hates Bagginses.'
Text: Gollum is strength +1 for each burden. Each times Gollum wins a skirmish, you may add a burden.

Name: Gollum, Stinker (T)
Lore: 'Still he's a Baggins, my precious, yes, a Baggins. A Baggins stole it. He found it and he said nothing. We hates Bagginses.'
Text: Gollum is strength +1 for each burden. Each time Gollum wins a skirmish, you may add a burden.

Name: Look at Him
Lore: 'That's what it is. It's that Gollum! Snakes and adders! And to think I thought that we'd puzzle him with our bit of a climb!'
Text: Shadow: Spot Smeagol or Gollum to add [1] for each burden.

Name: Poor Wretch
Lore: 'Throttle us in our sleep, that's his plan.'
Text: Plays on Smeagol. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make Smeagol damage +1.

Name: Smeagol, Old Noser
Lore: 'Could you find anything fit for a hungry hobbit?'
Text: Ring-bound. To play add a burden. Regroup: Exert Smeagol (or Gollum) twice to reveal the top 4 cards of your draw deck. Wound a minion for each Shadow card revealed. Place those 4 cards beneath your draw deck in any order.

Name: Smeagol, Slinker
Lore: '... that it is my fate to receive help from you, where I least looked for it, and your fate to help me whom you long pursued with evil purpose.'
Text: Ring-bound. To play, add a burden. Skirmish: Add a burden to make Smeagol strength +2 and takes no wound.

Name: Smeagol, Slinker (T)
Lore: '... that it is my fate to receive help from you, where I least looked for it, and your fate to help me whom you long pursued with evil purpose.'
Text: Ring-bound. To play, add a burden. Skirmish: Add a burden to make Smeagol strength +2 and take no wounds.

Name: We Must Have It
Lore: 'No, sweet one. See, my precious: if we has it, then we can escape, even from Him, eh?'
Text: Shadow: Play Gollum from your draw deck or your discard pile. Skirmish: Discard a card at random from hand to make Gollum strength +3.

Name: Alcarin, Warrior of Lamedon
Lore: Named for a mighty king, Alcarin is determined to prove himself in battle.
Text: Knight. The twilight cost of each other knight in your starting fellowship is -1. Assignment: Assign Alcarin to a minion bearing a [GONDOR] fortification to heal Alcarin.

Name: Citadel of the Stars
Lore: The city of Osgiliath was the first capital of Gondor.
Text: Fortification. Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Exert a [GONDOR] Man or spot 3 knights to transfer this condition from your support area to a minion skirmishing a [GONDOR] Man.

Name: City Wall
Lore: The war-weary defenses of Osgiliath still protected the Men of Gondor.
Text: Fortification. Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Exert a [GONDOR] Man or spot 3 knights to transfer this condition from your support area to a minion skirmishing a [GONDOR] Man.

Name: Fall Back
Lore: Osgiliath's defenses protected the Gondorian troops.
Text: Skirmish: Discard all Shadow cards borne by a minion bearing a [GONDOR] fortification.

Name: Gondorian Knight
Lore: Soldiers of Gondor share a long heritage of defending their borders against Sauron's attackers.
Text: Knight.

Name: Knight of Gondor
Lore: The brave men of Gondor's army were well-armed and armored.
Text: Knight. Fellowship: Discard a [GONDOR] condition to heal this companion.

Name: Men of Numenor
Lore: '...I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory....'
Text: Skirmish: Wound a minion bearing a [GONDOR] fortification.

Name: Rally Point
Lore: A strategic fallback helps Gondorian knights to plan their counterattack.
Text: Plays to your support area. Regroup: Exert a knight to transfer a [GONDOR] fortification borne by a minion to your support area.

Name: Stone Tower
Lore: The battlements of Osgiliath provided some defense against Sauron's attackers.
Text: Fortification. Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Exert 2 [GONDOR] Men to transfer this condition from your support area to a minion skirmishing a [GONDOR] Man.

Name: Take Cover
Lore: Gondor forces at Osgiliath were too few to fight the advancing armies in the field.
Text: Fellowship: Exert a knight to play a [GONDOR] fortification from your discard pile.

Name: These Are My People
Lore: '...I will die as one of them.'
Text: Fellowship: Exert Aragorn twice to play any number of possessions from your discard pile onto companions with the Aragorn signet.

Name: Turgon, Man of Belfalas
Lore: He hopes to someday become one of the knights of Dol Amroth.
Text: Knight. To play, spot a knight. Maneuver: Exert Turgon to wound a minion bearing a [GONDOR] fortification.

Name: War Must Be
Lore: '...we defend ourselves against a destroyer who would devour all....'
Text: Skirmish: Make a [GONDOR] Man strength +2 (or +4 if skirmishing a minion bearing a [GONDOR] fortification).

Name: Battering Ram
Lore: The trees... smote the timbers with a rending boom.
Text: Machine. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Exert an Uruk-hai to place an [ISENGARD] token on this card. Skirmish: Spot 5 companions and an [ISENGARD] token here to make an Uruk-hai damage +1. Discard this condition.

Name: Berserk Rager
Notes: The strength bonus for this minion is increased for any wound on any minion, companion, or ally in its skirmish. The tokens removed for the special ability on this card must all be removed from the same machine.
Lore: Their mission at Helm's Deep was to clear the walls.
Text: Damage +1. Berserk Rager is strength +1 for each wound on a character in its skirmish. Skirmish: Remove 3 [ISENGARD] tokens from a machine and exert Berserk Rager twice to wound every ally twice.

Name: Berserk Savage
Notes: The strength bonus for this minion is increased for any wound on any minion, companion, or ally in its skirmish. The tokens removed for the special ability on this card must all be removed from the same machine.
Lore: Skull-like helmets are distinctive to the Berserkers.
Text: Damage +1. Berserk Savage is strength +1 for each wound on a character in its skirmish. Skirmish: Remove 4 [ISENGARD] tokens from a machine and exert Berserk Savage twice to make it strength +8.

Name: Berserk Slayer
Notes: The strength bonus for this minion is increased for any wound on any minion, companion, or ally in its skirmish. The tokens removed for the special ability on this card must all be removed from the same machine.
Lore: Berserkers are the first wave of Uruks sent to battle.
Text: Damage +1. Berserk Slayer is strength +2 for each wound on a character in its skirmish. Skirmish: Remove 5 [ISENGARD] tokens from a machine and exert Berserk Slayer twice to wound every companion.

Name: Black Shapes Crawling
Lore: Some were squat and broad, some were tall and grim, with high helms and sable shields.
Text: Maneuver: Spot X Uruk-hai. The Free Peoples player may assign X wounds to your minions. Play X [ISENGARD] weapons from your discard pile.

Name: Devilry of Orthanc
Lore: 'They have a blasting fire, and... they took the Wall.'
Text: Machine. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Exert an Uruk-Hai to place an [ISENGARD] token on this card. Maneuver: Spot 8 [ISENGARD] tokens here to exert every character. Discard this condition.

Name: Foul Horde
Text: Warg-rider. While Foul Horde is not exhausted, it is fierce. While Foul Horde has at least 3 vitality, it is ambush [1]. While Foul Horde has at least 4 vitality, it is damage + 1.

Name: Grima, Chief Counselor
Lore: 'I care for you and yours as best I may.... Let others deal with these irksome guests.'
Text: Maneuver: Spot 4 Free Peoples cultures and exert Grima to return an unbound companion, and all cards on him or her, to their owners' hands.

Name: Isengard Flanker
Lore: Sharku used his warg-riders to scout and defend.
Text: Warg-rider. While this minion is not exhausted, he is fierce.

Name: Isengard Rider
Lore: 'He has taken Orcs into his service, and Wolf-riders, and evil Men....'
Text: Warg-rider. While this minion is not exhausted, he is fierce.

Name: Isengard Scimitar
Lore: Orcs from Isengard favor a short, curved sword when mounted.
Text: Bearer must be an [ISENGARD] Orc. When you play this weapon, you may add [1] for each site you control.

Name: Isengard Scout Troop
Lore: '...where the warg howls, there also the orc prowls.'
Text: Warg-rider. While this minion is not exhausted, it is fierce. Each time an [ISENGARD] Orc wins a skirmish, you may exert this minion to control a site.

Name: Saruman, Master of Foul Folk
Text: Saruman may not take wounds during the archery phase and may not be assigned to a skirmish. Each time the fellowship moves, you may heal each [ISENGARD] Orc twice. Shadow: Exert Saruman to play an [ISENGARD] possession from your discard pile.

Name: Scaling Ladder
Lore: Hundreds of long ladders were lifted up. Many were cast down in ruin, but many more replaced them....
Text: Machine. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Exert an Uruk-hai to place an [ISENGARD] token on this card. Skirmish: Spot an [ISENGARD] token here to heal an Uruk-hai. Discard this condition.

Name: Sharku, Warg-captain
Lore: Only Sharku commanded enough respect to control Saruman's warg-riders.
Text: Warg-rider. While Sharku is not exhausted, he is fierce. Each time you play an [ISENGARD] mount, you may make the Free Peoples player exert a companion (except a Hobbit).

Name: Sharku's Warg
Lore: The warg-captain picked the fastest and strongest mount.
Text: Bearer must be a warg-rider. If bearer is Sharku, he is damage +1. Response: If a skirmish special ability is used in a skirmish involving bearer, exert bearer to cancel that action.

Name: Siege Engine
Lore: Ropes... were hurled over the parapet....
Text: Machine. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Play an Uruk-hai to place an [ISENGARD] token on a machine. Response: If one or more machines are about to be discarded by an opponent, discard this condition to prevent that.

Name: Uruk Engineer
Lore: Trained Uruk-hai operated Saruman's siege engines at Helm's Deep.
Text: Damage +1. When you play this minion, you may place an [ISENGARD] token on a machine.

Name: Uruk Sapper
Lore: The destruction of the Hornburg fortifications was the task of Saruman's engineer troops.
Text: Damage +1. When you play this minion, you may place an [ISENGARD] token on a machine.

Name: Uruk-hai Berserker
Notes: The strength bonus for this minion is increased for any wound on any minion, companion, or ally in its skirmish.
Lore: Goatskins full of blood poured upon berserkers before battle instill their bloodlust.
Text: Damage +1. This minion is strength +1 for each wound on a character in its skirmish.

Name: War-warg
Lore: Bigger and stronger wargs were ridden into battle.
Text: Bearer must a warg-rider. Response: If a skirmish special abiliy is used in a skirmish involving bearer, exert bearer to cancel that action.

Name: Warg
Lore: 'Tell him there is no hope ahead. He should return to Edoras before the wolves of Isengard come there.'
Text: Bearer must a warg-rider. Response: If a skirmish special abiliy is used in a skirmish involving bearer, exert bearer to cancel that action.

Name: Warg-master
Lore: '...yet I feared that wolf-riders and plunderers might ride nonetheless to Meduseld, while it was undefended.'
Text: Warg-rider. When you play this minion, you may play an [ISENGARD] mount from your discard pile. While this minion is not exhausted, he is fierce.

Name: Warg-rider
Lore: Swiftly a scout rode back and reported that wolf-riders were abroad in the valley....
Text: Warg-rider. While this minion is not exhausted, he is fierce.

Name: Wolf-voices
Lore: '...these howls freeze my blood.'
Text: Skirmish: Make an [ISENGARD] Orc strength +2 (and heal it if mounted).

Name: Wolves of Isengard
Lore: Saruman's warg-riders traveled the plains faster than even the Riders of Rohan.
Text: Plays on a plains site you control. Regroup: Exert an [ISENGARD] Orc to make the Free Peoples player wound a companion.

Name: Army of Haradrim
Lore: The desert lords of Harad support their huge forces with mammoth war beasts.
Text: Southron. Skirmish: Remove [3] to play a [RAIDER] mount from your discard pile.

Name: Company of Haradrim
Lore: The quick movements of Southron soldiers cut off all paths of retreat.
Text: Southron. Regroup: Remove [9] and spot antother Southron to make the move limit -1 for this turn ( to a minimum of 1 ).

Name: Desert Stalker
Lore: They strike only when their prey is haggard and tired.
Text: Southron. Ambush [2]. Maneuver: Exert this minion and spot 4 free peoples cultures to exert every companion.

Name: Mumak
Lore: Sam saw a vast shape crash out of the trees and come careening down the slope.
Text: Bearer must be a Southron. Bearer is fierce. Each time bearer wins a skirmish, you may add [2].

Name: Southron Marcher
Lore: Hardy desert warriors needed little rest.
Text: Southron. Ambush [2]. While you can spot a Southron, this minion's twilight cost is - 2.

Name: Southron Runner
Lore: Swift scouts track enemy movements to set up surprise attacks.
Text: Southron. Ambush [2]. While you can spot a Southron, this minion's twilight cost is - 2.

Name: Southron Traveler
Lore: Men of Harad were used to long journeys.
Text: Southron. Ambush [2]. Response: If a Southron is about to take a wound, remove [3] to prevent that wound.

Name: Strength in Numbers
Lore: Lacking arms and armor, the Haradrim use swift movements to outnumber their opponents.
Text: To play, spot a Southron. Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Discard this condition to add [1] for each Man with ambush you spot.

Name: War Mumak
Lore: Big as a house, much bigger than a house, it looked to him, a grey-clad moving hill.
Text: Bearer must be a Southron. Bearer is fierce. Each time bearer overwhelms a character, you may add [5].

Name: Armory
Lore: 'Choose from these ere we go, and may they serve you well!'
Text: Fortification. Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Spot 2 [ROHAN] Men to remove 2 tokens from a machine or to take a [ROHAN] possession into hand from your discard pile. Discard this condition.

Name: Arrow-slits
Lore: Here and there were clefts in the stone through which men could shoot.
Text: Fortification. Plays to your support area. Maneuver: Spot 2 [ROHAN] Men to discard a possession or a machine. Discard this condition.

Name: Ecglaf, Courageous Farmer
Lore: Like many of the Rohirrim, Ecglaf no longer had a home awaiting his return.
Text: Villager. Fellowship: Exert Ecglaf and spot 2 valiant Men to play a [ROHAN] possession from your discard pile.

Name: Gamling, Warrior of Rohan
Lore: He was one of Théoden's most trusted lieutenants.
Text: Valiant. To play spot a [ROHAN] Man. Skirmish: Play a [ROHAN] possession on Gamling to make him strength +2 and damage +1.

Name: Household Guard
Lore: The king and the men of his household were in the Hornburg....
Text: Valiant.

Name: I Am Here
Lore: 'The last host of the Eorlingas has ridden forth. It will not return without battle.'
Text: Fellowship: Exert Theoden twice to heal every other companion with the Theoden signet twice.

Name: Let Us Be Swift
Lore: 'Let us drive through such foes as are already between us and the fastness.'
Text: Regroup: Spot 3 valiant Men to discard up to 2 conditions and liberate a site.

Name: No Rest for the Weary
Lore: 'We must draw all our forces now behind the walls.'
Text: Maneuver: Spot 3 valiant Men to make one of those Men defender +1 until the regroup phase.

Name: Parapet
Lore: Upon the spur of rock from the cliff stood high walls of ancient stone.
Text: Fortification. Plays to your support area. Archery: Spot 2 [ROHAN] Men to remove 2 tokens from a machine or to make the minion archery total -3. Discard this condition.

Name: Rohirrim Bow
Lore: 'The Rohirrim have good bowmen after their fashion, but there are too few here, too few.'
Text: Bearer must be a [ROHAN] Man. Archery: Exert bearer and discard this possession to wound a minion.

Name: Rohirrim Helm
Lore: The armory of Helm's Deep provided raiment of war for her defenders.
Text: Bearer must be [ROHAN] Man. Skirmish: Discard this possession to cancel a skirmish involving bearer. A minion in this skirmish may exert to prevent this.

Name: Rohirrim Scout
Lore: ...scouts rode out far ahead, passing like shadows in the folds of the land.
Text: Valiant. Regroup: Exert this companion and spot a [ROHAN] possession to return that possession to hand.

Name: Rohirrim Shield
Lore: The Rohirrim carried round wooden shields, usable on foot and on horseback.
Text: Bearer must be a [ROHAN] Man. The minion archery total is -1. Regroup: Discard this possession to heal bearer.

Name: Sigewulf, Brave Volunteer
Lore: The courage of Sigewulf and other Rohirrim like him will not be forgotten.
Text: Villager. Regroup: Exert Sigewulf and spot 5 valiant Men to discard a minion.

Name: Theoden, King of the Golden Hall
Lore: 'You thought I remained in Meduseld bent like an old tree under winter snow.... But a west wind has shaken the boughs.'
Text: Valiant. Maneuver: Play a [ROHAN] possession on Theoden to heal a [ROHAN] ally.

Name: Thundering Host
Lore: ...with a rush like the sudden onset of a great wind the last host of Rohan rode thundering into the West.
Text: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make a mounted [ROHAN] Man strength +3 (and heal that Man if at a plains).

Name: Dead Marshes
Text: Plays to your support area. While the fellowship is at site 4T, Ring-bound companions skirmishing [SAURON] orcs are strength -1. Maneuver: Spot 2 [SAURON] Orcs to play up to 2 [SAURON] conditions from your discard pile. Discard this condition.

Name: Eye of Barad-Dur
Notes: This card must be played in order to use its response text, which is affected by cards like Legolas, Dauntless hunter. The text discard this card to is superfluous.
Lore: The Lidless Eye looked out from Sauron's fortress.
Text: Skirmish: Make a companion or ally skirmishing a [SAURON] Orc strength -1 for each ring-bound companion. Response: If a free people player reveals this card from your hand, discard this card to add 2 burdens.

Name: Gate Soldier
Lore: ...a host of orcs lurked, ready at a signal to issue forth like black ants going to war.
Text: When you play a [SAURON] condition, you may exert this minion and remove [2] to draw a card.

Name: Gate Trooper
Lore: Another dreadful day of fear and toil had come to Mordor
Text: and the night-guards were summoned....
column19: When you play this minion, you may exert him and spot 5 burdens to draw a card.

Name: Gate Veteran
Lore: ...the day-guards, evil-eyed and fell, were marching to their posts.
Text: When you play this minion, you may exert him and spot 6 companions to draw a card.

Name: Grishnakh, Orc Captain
Lore: 'They might agree with me, with Grishnákh....'
Text: Tracker. The site number of each [SAURON] Orc is -3. Shadow: Exert Grishnakh twice and spot another [SAURON] Orc to draw 3 cards. The Free Peoples player may add 2 burdens to prevent this.

Name: Grishnakh, Orc Captain (T)
Lore: 'They might agree with me, with Grishnákh....'
Text: Tracker. The site number of each [SAURON] Orc is -3. Shadow: Exert Grishnakh twice and spot another [SAURON] Orc to draw 3 cards. The Free Peoples player may add 2 burdens to prevent this.

Name: I'd Make You Squeak
Lore: 'If I had my way, you'd wish you were dead now.'
Text: To play, exert 2 [SAURON] Orcs. Plays to your support area. The Shadow number of each site is +1 for each wound on a Hobbit (limit +3).

Name: Morannon
Lore: The black gate of Mordor was called the Morannon.
Text: Plays to your support area. The twilight cost of the first [SAURON] Orc played at site 4T is -3. Shadow: Spot 2 [SAURON] Orcs and discard 4 cards from hand to draw 3 cards. Discard this condition.

Name: Orc Captain
Lore: ...far away from hidden holds and outposts in the hills came answering calls....
Text: When you play this minion, you may spot a [SAURON] condition to draw a card for each site you control (limit 3).

Name: Orc Cutthroat
Lore: A few Orc casualties were of no concern to him.
Text: Tracker. The site number of each [SAURON] Orc is -3. Skirmish: Discard another [SAURON] Orc and exert Orc Cutthroat to wound a companion he is skirmishing.

Name: Orc Fighter
Lore: The Orcs of Mordor extended the will of Sauron to control the weak Men of the East.
Text: Regroup: Spot a [SAURON] condition and exert this minion to take control of a site.

Name: Orc Infantry
Lore: Barad-dûr sent Orcs to all corners of Middle-earth.
Text: Regroup: Spot a [SAURON] condition and discard this minion to take control of a site.

Name: Orc Patrol
Lore: Sauron's Orcs ranged far and wide, searching for Baggins and the Ring.
Text: Tracker. The site number of each [SAURON] Orc is -3. Maneuver: Exert Orc Patrol twice and spot another [SAURON] Orc to discard a condition.

Name: Orc Pursuer
Lore: '...why not kill them now? They're a cursed nuisance, and we're in a hurry.'
Text: Tracker. The site number of each [SAURON] Orc is -1. When you play this minion, you may exert him and remove [2] to draw a card.

Name: Orc Runner
Lore: 'There's no time to kill them properly.... No time for play on this trip.'
Text: Tracker. The site number of each [SAURON] Orc is -1. When you play this minion you may exert him and discard 2 cards from hand to draw a card.

Name: Teeth of Mordor
Lore: None could pass the Teeth of Mordor and not feel their bite....
Text: Plays to your support area. Regroup: Spot a [SAURON] Orc and remove [3] to stack that minion here. Shadow: Play a [SAURON] Orc stacked here as if played from hand.

Name: Frodo, Master of the Precious
Lore: 'We promises, yes I promise!... Good master, good Sméagol, gollum, gollum!'
Text: Ring-bearer (resistance 10). Fellowship: Add a burden to play Smeagol from your discard pile.

Name: No Help for It
Lore: '...he'll come back, you'll see. The promise will hold yet a while. And he won't leave his Precious, anyway.'
Text: Regroup: Spot Sam and discard Smeagol or Gollum to remove 3 burdens.

Name: No Use That Way
Lore: 'Don't take the Precious to Him!... Keep it, nice master, and be kind to Sméagol.'
Text: Skirmish: Add 3 burdens to wound a minion skirmishing a companion who has the Frodo signet twice.

Name: Rare Good Ballast
Lore: 'What a hobbit needs with coney... is some herbs and roots, especially taters - not to mention bread.'
Text: Plays on Sam. Response: If a regroup special ability is used, discard Smeagol or Gollum to cancel that action.

Name: Sam, Nice Sensible Hobbit
Lore: 'Trust Sméagol now? Very, very good.'
Text: Ring-bound. While you can spot Frodo and Smeagol, Sam may not be overwhelmed unless is strength is tripled. Response: If Frodo is killed, make Sam the Ring-bearer (resistance 5).

Name: Sting, Baggins Heirloom
Lore: 'This is Sting. You have seen it before once upon a time.'
Text: Bearer must be Frodo. Skirmish: Exert Frodo to make Smeagol strength +2 or Gollum strength -2.

Name: Sting, Baggins Heirloom (T)
Notes: Tengwar. Image fixed. The collector's information on the Tengwar version of this card (a tournament promo card) was printed incorrectly as 4R100. There are no printed Tengwar versions with the correct info (5R116).
Lore: 'This is Sting. You have seen it before once upon a time.'
Text: Bearer must be Frodo. Skirmish: Exert Frodo to make Smeagol strength +2 or Gollum strength -2.

Name: You Must Help Us
Lore: 'You will have to come with us, that's all, while we keep an eye on you.'
Text: Fellowship: Play Smeagol from your discard pile to heal each Ring-bound Hobbit twice.

Name: Hornburg Wall
Text: Regroup: Spot your minion and remove [9] to make the fellowship move again this turn (if the move limit allows).

Name: Nan Curunir
Text: Plains. Response: If your mounted minion is about to take a wound, remove [2] to prevent that wound.

Name: Caverns of Isengard
Text: Underground. The Free Peoples player wins the game only if the Ring-bearer survives until Shadow players reconcile.

Name: Legolas, Archer of Mirkwood
Lore: '...even more would I give for a hundred good archers of Mirkwood. We shall need them.'
Text: Archer. Each time Legolas wins a skirmish, you may heal a Dwarf companion or another Elf companion.

Name: Eowyn, Daughter of Eomund
Lore: 'Let the heralds announce to the folk that the Lady Éowyn will lead them!'
Text: Valiant. Maneuver: Play a [ROHAN] possession on Eowyn to heal her.

Name: Baruk Khazad (AI)
Lore: Axes of the Dwarves! cried Gimli in the secret tongue of his kin.
Text: Maneuver: Exert a Dwarf to wound a minion. You may take the next maneuver action.

Name: Break the Charge (AI)
Lore: A wall of Elven arrows met the attackers before they reached the Hornburg itself.
Text: Archery: Exert 3 Elf companions to make the fellowship archery total +2.

Name: Foul Horde (AI)
Text: Warg-rider. While Foul Horde is not exhausted, it is fierce. While Foul Horde has at least 3 vitality, it is ambush [1]. While Foul Horde has at least 4 vitality, it is damage + 1.

Name: Army of Haradrim (AI)
Lore: Lacking shields and armor, Southron forces rely on speed and numbers.
Text: Southron. Skirmish: Remove [3] to play a [RAIDER] mount from your discard pile.

Name: Rohirrim Helm (AI)
Lore: A helm split by an Uruk blade often still saves the rider who wears it.
Text: Bearer must be [ROHAN] Man. Skirmish: Discard this possession to cancel a skirmish involving bearer. A minion in this skirmish may exert to prevent this.

Name: Thundering Host (AI)
Lore: The roar of hooves was enough to rout the Uruk-hai without sword or spear.
Text: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make a mounted [ROHAN] Man strength +3 (and heal that man if at a plains).

Name: Gollum, Stinker (M)
Text: Gollum is strength +1 for each burden. Each times Gollum wins a skirmish, you may add a burden.

Name: Grima, Chief Counselor (M)
Text: Maneuver: Spot 4 Free Peoples cultures and exert Grima to return an unbound companion, and all cards on him or her, to their owners' hands.

Name: Bound By Rage
Text: Plays to your support area. When you play this condition, you may spot 2 [DUNLAND] Men to place 2 [DUNLAND] tokens here. Response: If a [DUNLAND] Man is about to take a wound, discard this condition or remove a [DUNLAND] token from here to prevent that wound.

Name: Dunlending Elder
Lore: Hatred of the Rohirrim is passed from generation to generation.
Text: While you control 2 sites, this minion is strength +5, fierce and damage +1.

Name: Dunlending Footmen
Lore: Driven by Saruman's ranting, waves of Dunlendings descended upon the holdings of Rohan.
Text: The twilight cost of this minion during a skirmish phase is -2.

Name: Dunlending Headman
Lore: The diminished Rohirrim offered little resistance to the advancing Dunland horde.
Text: When you play this minion, you may spot 2 other [DUNLAND] Men to take control of a site. The Free Peoples player may discard 2 cards from hand to prevent this.

Name: Dunlending Reserve
Lore: The relentless campaign of the hillmen drove citizens of the Westfold to the shelter of their capital.
Text: The twilight cost of this minion during a skirmish phase is -2.

Name: Hill Clan
Lore: 'We will take their king.'
Text: Each time this minion wins a skirmish, you may play a [DUNLAND] Man from hand. That Man is fierce and damage +2 until the regroup phase.

Name: Ready to Fall
Lore: 'Why do you lay these troubles on an already troubled mind?'
Text: Plays to your support area. Shadow: Spot 2 sites you control and remove [2] to play a [DUNLAND] Man from your discard pile.

Name: Too Long Have These Peasants Stood
Lore: The rabble of Dunland pillaged their way across the Mark.
Text: Response: If a [DUNLAND] Man wins a skirmish, discard all conditions.

Name: Lend Us Your Aid
Lore: He hewed a two-handed stroke and laid the last Orc before his feet. 'Now my count passes Master Legolas again.'
Text: Maneuver: Exert Gimli twice to make him and each Elf companion strength +3 until the regroup phase.

Name: Suspended Palaces
Text: Plays to your support area. When you play this condition, you may spot a Dwarf to place 2 [DWARVEN] tokens here. Fellowship: Discard this condition or remove a [DWARVEN] token from here to stack the top card of your draw deck on a [DWARVEN] condition that has a card stacked on it.

Name: Toss Me
Lore: 'Don't tell the Elf.'
Text: While this card is stacked on a [DWARVEN] condition, Gimli is strength +1. Fellowship: Place this card or another [DWARVEN] card from hand on top of or beneath your draw deck.

Name: Agility
Lore: Elves rely upon more than strength in combat.
Text: Plays to your support area. When you play this condition, you may spot an Elf to place 2 [ELVEN] tokens here. Skirmish: Discard this condition or remove an [ELVEN] token from here to make a minion skirmishing an Elf strength -1.

Name: Arwen, Evenstar of Her People
Lore: 'If you trust nothing else, trust this... trust us.'
Text: Skirmish: Exert an Elf to make a minion skirmishing Arwen strength -1.

Name: Banner of Elbereth
Lore: 'First name the four, the free peoples: / Eldest of all, the elf-children...'
Text: Bearer must be an Elf companion. Each time bearer wins a skirmish, you may draw a card. Response: If bearer wins a skirmish, discard this possession to liberate a site.

Name: Elrond, Keeper of Vilya
Lore: 'You have foreseen it. War is coming... many will die.'
Text: At the start of each turn, heal Elrond. Fellowship: Exert Elrond to discard the top card of your draw deck. If it is an [ELVEN] card, you may take it into hand and heal an Elf companion.

Name: Forearmed
Lore: 'Give them a volley.'
Text: Skirmish: Reveal the top card of your draw deck to make a minion skirmishing an Elf strength -X, where X is the twilight cost of the revealed card.

Name: Forewarned
Lore: 'Whether by the sword or the slow decay of time, Aragorn will die.'
Text: To play, spot 2 Elves. Plays to your support area. Fellowship: Add [1] to look at the top card of your draw deck. You may discard this condition to discard that card.

Name: Galadriel, Keeper of Nenya
Lore: 'In Dwimordene, in Lórien / More fair than thoughts of Mortal Men.'
Text: At the start of each turn, heal Galadriel. Skirmish: Exert Galadriel to discard the top card of your draw deck. If it is a Shadow card, make a minion skirmishing an Elf strength -3.

Name: Gift of Foresight
Lore: 'Here you will dwell, bound to your grief, under the fading trees.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot an Elf to reveal the top card of your draw deck. You may discard it, return it to the top of your draw deck, or take it into hand.

Name: Must Be a Dream
Lore: 'May the Grace of the Valar protect you.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot an Elf to reveal the top card of your draw deck. Heal up to 2 companions whose culture matches the revealed card. You may discard the revealed card.

Name: Naith Longbow
Lore: 'Show them no mercy, for you shall receive none.'
Text: Bearer must be an Elf companion. Archery: Exert bearer to discard the top card of your draw deck. If it is an [ELVEN] card, exert a minion.

Name: Naith Troop
Lore: Now only the bow and the sword can forestall the coming of the Shadow.
Text: To play, spot 3 Elf companions. Skirmish: Exert Naith Troop to discard the top card of your draw deck. If it is an [ELVEN] card, make a minion skirmishing Naith Troop strength -2.

Name: Naith Warband
Lore: 'But do not think that only by singing amid the trees... is Lothlórien maintained and defended....'
Text: To play, spot 3 Elf companions. While Naith Warband bears a ranged weapon, it takes no more than 1 wound during each skirmish phase and does not add to the fellowship archery total.

Name: Boomed and Trumpeted
Lore: 'For bole and bough are burning now, the furnace roars-we go to war!'
Text: Skirmish: Make an Ent strength +X and damage +X, where X is the number of unbound Hobbits you can spot.

Name: Crack Into Rubble
Lore: 'To Isengard! Though Isengard be ringed and barred with doors of stone
Text: / Though Isengard be strong and hard, as cold as stone and bare as bone....'''
column19: Regroup: Exert 2 Ents to liberate a site and discard a Shadow condition.

Name: Enraged
Lore: 'An angry Ent is terrifying.'
Text: Bearer must be an Ent. Limit 1 per bearer. Discard this condition at the end of the turn.

Name: Ent Avenger
Lore: As they drew near the flash and flicker of their eyes could be seen.
Text: While you can spot 3 Ents, this companion is strength +2.

Name: Ent Horde
Lore: 'With doom we come, with doom we come!'
Text: To play, spot 2 Ent companions. Ent Horde's twilight cost is -2 for each Ent or unbound Hobbit you can spot. While you can spot more minions than companions, Ent Horde is defender +1.

Name: Ent Moot
Lore: But when the Ents all gathered round Treebeard,... then the Hobbits saw that they were all of the same kindred, and all had the same eyes....
Text: To play, exert an unbound Hobbit. Bearer must be an Ent. Limit 1 per bearer.

Name: Gandalf, Mithrandir
Lore: 'The Dark Lord has Nine. But we have One, mightier than they: the White Rider. He has passed through the fire and the abyss, and they shall fear him.'
Text: Damage +1. Each time the fellowship moves, wound Gandalf.

Name: Glamdring, Lightning Brand
Lore: 'Thunder they heard, and lightning... smote upon Celebdil, and leaped back broken into tongues of fire.'
Text: Bearer must be Gandalf. He is damage +1. Each time you play a spell during a skirmish, you may make Gandalf damage +1 until the end of that skirmish.

Name: Host of Fangorn
Lore: 'Of course, it is likely enough, my friends...that we are going to our doom, the last march of the Ents.'
Text: To play, spot 2 Ent companions. Host of Fangorn's twilight cost is -2 for each Ent or unbound Hobbit you can spot.

Name: Quickbeam, Bregalad
Notes: Like other similar cards, this card's game text should say  "Ent or unbound Hobbit.  " For each Ent or each unbound Hobbit, the twilight cost is -1.
Lore: 'But if we stayed home and did nothing, doom would find us anyway, sooner or later.'
Text: Quickbeam's twilight cost is -1 for each Ent and unbound Hobbit you can spot.

Name: Roused
Lore: 'To Isengard!' the Ents cried in many voices.
Text: Skirmish: Exert an Ent to make him strength +1 for each Ent you spot (limit +4).

Name: Skinbark, Fladrif
Lore: 'He was wounded by Orcs, and many of his folk and tree-herds have been murdered and destroyed.'
Text: Skinbark's twilight cost is -1 for each Ent or unbound Hobbit you can spot. Response: If an unbound Hobbit is about to take a wound, exert Skinbark to prevent that wound.

Name: Threw Down My Enemy
Lore: '...he fell from the high place and broke the mountain-side where he smote it in his ruin.'
Text: Spell. Skirmish: Make a minion skirmishing Gandalf strength -1 for each wound on each character in the skirmish.

Name: Treebeard, Guardian of the Forest
Lore: 'The little that I know of his long slow story would make a tale for which we have no time now.'
Text: Unhasty. Assignment: Exert an unbound Hobbit to allow Treebeard to skirmish. Skirmish: Exert Treebeard to make an Ent damage +1.

Name: Don't Follow the Lights
Lore: 'Careful, careful now or Hobbits go down to join the dead ones and light little candles.'
Text: Response: If Smeagol wins a skirmish, add a burden to discard a minion.

Name: Don't Look at Them
Lore: 'You should not look in when the candles are lit.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Spot Smeagol and discard 3 cards from hand to wound a minion Smeagol is skirmishing once (or twice if that minion is a [WRAITH] minion).

Name: Gollum, Old Villain
Lore: 'Must take it. The Wraiths are searching. Must take it.'
Text: Skirmish: Discard a card from hand to make Gollum strength +1 (or +2 if skirmishing a Ring-Bound companion).

Name: Master Broke His Promise
Lore: 'Kill them! Kill them! Kill them both! And then we take the Precious! We be the Master!'
Text: Regroup: Exert Gollum 3 times to wound each companion. The move limit for this turn is -1.

Name: Nasty, Foul Hobbitses
Lore: 'We ought to wring their filthy little necks!'
Text: Response: If Gollum wins a skirmish, add a burden.

Name: Not Listening
Lore: 'They'll wake too quick and kill us... Not now. Not yet.'
Text: Response: If Smeagol wins a skirmish, heal him and remove 2 burdens.

Name: Safe Paths
Lore: 'Soft and quick as shadows we must be!'
Text: Regroup: Exert Smeagol 3 times and discard him to wound each minion. The move limit for this turn is +1. If the fellowship moves, each Shadow player may take up to 3 Shadow cards into hand from his or her discard pile.

Name: Smeagol, Poor Creature
Lore: 'And we're so lonely... We'll be nice to them, very nice, if they'll be nice to us, won't we, yes, yess.'
Text: Ring-bound. To play, add a burden. Skirmish: Discard a card from hand to make Smeagol strength +1.

Name: They Stole It
Lore: 'Where iss it, where iss it: my precious....'
Text: Plays to your support arear Skirmish: Spot Gollum and discard 3 cards from hand to wound a companion Gollum is skirmishing once (or twice if that companion is a [SHIRE] companion).

Name: You're a Liar and a Thief
Lore: 'No, sweet one. See, my precious: if we has it, then we can escape, even from Him, eh?'
Text: Response: If Gollum wins a skirmish, wound a companion (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: Anborn, Skilled Huntsman
Lore: 'Perhaps under the shadow of the Unnamed some of the beasts of Mirkwood are wandering hither to our woods.'
Text: Ring-bound. Ranger. Each time Anborn wins a skirmish, you may make a minion's site number +3 until the regroup phase.

Name: Ancient Roads
Lore: '...they go ever more heedlessly, we learn, thinking that the power of their new master is great enough....'
Text: Plays to your support area. While you can spot 3 rangers, the site number of each minion skirmishing a ranger is +2.

Name: Aragorn, Defender of Free Peoples
Lore: '...this is the hour when we draw swords together.'
Text: Skirmish: Remove an [ELVEN] token to make a minion skirmishing Aragorn strength -3. Skirmish: Remove a [DWARVEN] token to heal a Dwarf. Regroup: If Aragorn is mounted, remove a [ROHAN] token to wound a minion twice.

Name: Banner of Westernesse
Lore: 'What brought they from the foundered land / Over the flowing sea?... / and one white tree.'
Text: Bearer must be a [GONDOR] companion. Each time bearer wins a skirmish, you may heal another [GONDOR] companion. Response: If bearer wins a skirmish, discard this possession to liberate a site.

Name: Garrison of Osgiliath
Lore: 'So ever do we watch the shores nigh Osgiliath....'
Text: Fortification. Plays to your support area. When you play this condition, you may spot a [GONDOR] Man to place 2 [GONDOR] tokens here. Skirmish: Discard this condition or remove a [GONDOR] token from here to make a [GONDOR] Man strength +1.

Name: Mortal Men
Lore: 'I fear neither death nor pain.'
Text: Skirmish: Make a [GONDOR] Man strength +2 (and exert a minion if you spot a [ROHAN] token).

Name: Perilous Ventures
Lore: 'But still we will not sit idle and let Him do all as He would....'
Text: Regroup: Exert 2 rangers to discard a minion (or 2 [WRAITH] minions).

Name: Ring of Barahir
Lore: 'This is a thing of worth beyond your reckoning. For its ancientry alone. It has no power, save the esteem in which those hold it who love my house.'
Text: Bearer must be Aragorn. At the start of each of your turns, you may spot a culture token to heal a companion of that culture.

Name: Trust
Lore: 'You cannot falter now.'
Text: Skirmish: Make a [GONDOR] Man strength +2 (and heal a companion if you spot an [ELVEN] token).

Name: Agents of Orthanc
Lore: 'How long is it since Saruman bought you?'
Text: This minion is strength +2 and damage +1 for each Free Peoples culture that you can spot over 2.

Name: Assault Ladder
Lore: 'It is a great host....'
Text: Machine. Plays to your support area. Shadow: Exert an Uruk-hai to place an [ISENGARD] token on this card. Skirmish: Spot 3 [ISENGARD] tokens here to make an Uruk-hai strength +3. Discard this condition.

Name: Banner of Isengard
Lore: ...blazoned upon every helm and shield the ghastly hand of Isengard was seen.
Text: Bearer must be an [ISENGARD] minion. Each time bearer wins a skirmish, the Free Peoples player must exert a companion for each site you control.

Name: Berserk Butcher
Text: Damage +1. Berserk Butcher is strength +1 for each wound on each character in its skirmish. Maneuver: Remove an [ISENGARD] token from a machine and exert Berserk Butcher twice to prevent all wounds to Uruk-hai until the assignment phase.

Name: Desertion
Lore: 'Who knows what you've spoken to the darkness in the bitter watches of the night?'
Text: To play, spot an [ISENGARD] Man. Plays on a companion (except the Ring-bearer). Assignment: Assign an [ISENGARD] minion with less strength than bearer to skirmish bearer. Discard this condition.

Name: Fires and Foul Fumes
Lore: 'One of them... got caught in a spray of some liquid fire and burned like a torch: a horrible sight.'
Text: Regroup: Discard 4 [ISENGARD] orcs to wound a companion 4 times (except the Ring-bearer).

Name: Gnawing, Biting, Hacking, Burning
Lore: 'Destroyers and usurpers.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a regroup action discards an [ISENGARD] Orc, you may stack that Orc on this card. Shadow: Discard 2 cards stacked here and remove [1] to play an [ISENGARD] Orc from your discard pile.

Name: Iron Fist of the Orc
Lore: 'The old world will burn in the fires of industry.'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a regroup action discards an [ISENGARD] Orc, you may stack that Orc on this card. Regroup: Discard 3 cards stacked here and remove [1] to discard a Free Peoples possession.

Name: Isengard Artisan
Lore: Minions of Orthanc shared their master's fascination with machines.
Text: Regroup: Discard an [ISENGARD] Orc to make the Free Peoples player wound a companion.

Name: Isengard Builder
Lore: 'They were all singing with harsh voices, and laughing, making a hideous din.'
Text: Regroup: If stacked on an [ISENGARD] card, discard this card to add [2].

Name: Isengard Journeyman
Lore: Drudgery and toil at Isengard left Saruman's minions hungry for sport.
Text: Regroup: Discard an [ISENGARD] Orc to make the Free Peoples player wound a companion.

Name: Isengard Mechanics
Text: Regroup: Discard an [ISENGARD] Orc to make the Free Peoples player wound a companion (or 2 companions if you spot 6 companions). Regroup: If this minion is stacked on an [ISENGARD] card, spot an [ISENGARD] Orc and discard this minion to add [3].

Name: Isengard Plodder
Lore: Saruman dispatched his trusted Orcs to aid in the sack of Rohan.
Text: Regroup: Discard an [ISENGARD] Orc to make the Free Peoples player wound a companion.

Name: Isengard Tender
Lore: Unfortunate Orcs assisted in Saruman's foul wizardry.
Text: Regroup: If stacked on an [ISENGARD] card, discard this card and remove [2] to exhaust a companion.

Name: Isengard Tinker
Lore: 'I wonder if his fame was... due to his cleverness in settling at Isengard.'
Text: Regroup: Discard an [ISENGARD] Orc to make the Free Peoples player wound a companion.

Name: Rohirrim Traitor
Lore: 'Once it was a man, and did you service in its fashion.'
Text: While you can spot a companion bearing an [ISENGARD] condition, this minion is strength +2.

Name: Scaffolding
Lore: Towers marked the inner ring, implements of industry.
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a regroup action discards an [ISENGARD] Orc, you may stack that Orc on this card. Response: If an [ISENGARD] Orc is about to take a wound, discard 2 cards stacked here to prevent that wound.

Name: Sharku, Vile Marauder
Lore: 'Send out your warg-riders.'
Text: Warg-rider. While Sharku is not exhausted, he is fierce. Regroup: Exert Sharku to add [1].

Name: Twisted Tales
Lore: 'Too long have you sat in the shadows....'
Text: Plays to your support area. Each time a companion or ally loses a skirmish involving a [ISENGARD] Man, you may spot a possession to stack that possession here.

Name: The Balrog, Terror of Flame and Shadow
Lore: '...he burst into new flame.'
Text: Damage +2. The twilight cost of The Balrog is -3 if you can spot a [MORIA] minion. The Balrog cannot be assigned to skirmish companions or allies of strength less than 6.

Name: Durin's Tower
Lore: '...carved in the living rock of Zirakzigil, the pinnacle of the Silvertine.'
Text: Plays to your support area. At sites 2T and 3T, The Balrog's twilight cost is -3. Skirmish: Discard this condition to make a unique [MORIA] minion strength +3.

Name: Easterling Army
Text: Easterling. Fierce. Skirmish: Spot 2 burdens and exert this minion to make an Easterling strength +1. Skirmish: Spot 4 burdens and exert this minion to make an Easterling strength +2. Skirmish: Spot 6 burdens and exert this minion to make an Easterling strength +3.

Name: Easterling Polearm
Lore: '...and the tips of their spears....'
Text: Bearer must be an Easterling. While you can spot 2 burdens, bearer cannot take wounds. While you can spot 5 burdens, bearer is damage +1.

Name: Southron Archer Legion
Lore: 'But I've heard tales of the big folk down away in the Sunlands.'
Text: Southron. Archer. Archery: Remove [3] to add 1 to the minion archery total for each companion over 4 (limit +4).

Name: Southron Invaders
Lore: 'So when you said Men out of the South, all in red and gold, I said were there any oliphaunts? For if there was, I was going to take a look....'
Text: Southron. Ambush [1]. When you play this minion, you may spot another Southron to play a minion with ambush from your discard pile.

Name: Trample
Lore: '...I stomp round and round, / Never lie on the ground, / Not even to die. / Oliphaunt am I....'
Text: Maneuver: Spot a mounted [RAIDER] Man to discard a companion (except the Ring-bearer). The Free Peoples player may add [4] to prevent this.

Name: Fell Beast
Lore: 'And these winged creatures that they ride on now, they can probably see more than any other creature. They are like great carrion birds.'
Text: To play, discard 2 cards from hand. Bearer must be a Nazgul. Bearer is fierce.

Name: Spied From Above
Lore: It leaped into all of their minds that the Black Wings had spied them and had sent armed soldiers to seize them....
Text: Plays to your support area. Regroup: Exert a Nazgul twice to play a [WRAITH] or [SAURON] minion. That minion's twilight cost is -8 and it comes into play exhausted.

Name: Sword of Dol Guldur
Lore: The weapons of the Nine are wrought with sorcery.
Text: Bearer must be a Nazgul. While bearer is Ulaire Toldea, each time he wins a skirmish the Free Peoples player must discard a Free Peoples possession or a Free Peoples condition.

Name: Ulaire Lemenya, Winged Hunter
Lore: ...the helpless horror that had come with the cry in the wind and the shadow on the moon....
Text: Regroup: Exert Ulaire Lemenya and discard 3 cards from hand to return a companion (except the Ring-bearer) to owner's hand.

Name: Ulaire Nertea, Winged Hunter
Lore: A vast winged shape passed over the moon like a black cloud... The stars fainted before it....
Text: When you play Ulaire Nertea, spot another Nazgul to make the Free Peoples player exert a Ring-bound companion for each Free Peoples culture you can spot over 2.

Name: Ulaire Toldea, Winged Sentry
Lore: 'They are calling for it. Calling for the precious.'
Text: Fierce. Each time Ulaire Toldea wins a skirmish, the Free Peoples player must exert a companion or add a burden.

Name: Ulaire Toldea, Winged Sentry (T)
Lore: 'They are calling for it. Calling for the precious.'
Text: Fierce. Each time Ulaire Toldea wins a skirmish, the Free Peoples player must exert a companion or add a burden.

Name: Winged and Ominous
Lore: It scudded across the moon... outrunning the wind in its fell speed.
Text: Plays to your support area. Regroup: Exert a Nazgul to place a [WRAITH] token on this card. Shadow: Remove 3 [WRAITH] tokens from here to add [2].

Name: Banner of the Mark
Lore: 'Fell deeds awake. Now for wrath. Now for ruin, and the red dawn.'
Text: Bearer must be a [ROHAN] companion. Each time bearer wins a skirmish, you may exert a minion. Response: If bearer wins a skirmish, discard this possession to liberate a site.

Name: Blood Has Been Spilled
Lore: They were hemming the Orcs in, preventing them from scattering, and driving them....
Text: Plays to your support area. Skirmish: Discard a mount borne by a [ROHAN] Man to prevent that Man from being overwhelmed unless his or her strength is tripled.

Name: Eomer, Rohirrim Captain
Lore: 'Gúthwinë for the Mark!'
Text: Valiant. While you can spot a [ROHAN] Man, Eomer's twilight cost is -1. Skirmish: Discard 3 cards from hand to make a [ROHAN] Man strength +2 for each wound on each minion in his or her skirmish.

Name: Ever the Hope of Men
Lore: 'Would that day was here and we might ride down upon them like a storm out of the mountains!'
Text: Regroup: Exert 2 mounted [ROHAN] Men to discard up to 2 wounded minions.

Name: Hama, Doorward of Theoden
Lore: 'Yet in doubt a man of worth will trust to his own wisdom. I believe you are friends and folk worthy of honour, who have no evil purpose.'
Text: To play, spot a [ROHAN] Man. Skirmish: Exert Hama to discard a possession borne by a minion he is skirmishing.

Name: Hrethel, Rider of Rohan
Lore: ...gaining on the Orcs, gaining on them like a tide over the flats on folk straying in a quicksand.
Text: To play, spot a [ROHAN] Man. Skirmish: Heal a minion skirmishing Hrethel to make Hrethel strength +3 (limit +3).

Name: News From the Mark
Lore: 'We are friends of Rohan, and of Théoden, your king.'
Text: Fellowship: Spot 3 mounted [ROHAN] Men to make the move limit for this turn +2. Each Shadow player may draw 6 cards.

Name: We Left None Alive
Text: Plays to your support area. When you play this condition, you may spot a [ROHAN] Man to place 2 [ROHAN] tokens here. Skirmish: Discard this condition or remove a [ROHAN] token from here to make a [ROHAN] Man skirmishing an exhausted minion strength +2.

Name: Banner of the Eye
Lore: Stony-faced they were, with dark window- holes staring north and east and west, and each window was full of sleepless eyes.
Text: Bearer must be an [SAURON] Orc. Each time bearer wins a skirmish, you may add [1] for each site you control.

Name: Corpse Lights
Lore: 'I tried once
Text: but you cannot reach them. Only shapes to see, perhaps, not to touch.'
column19: Twilight. Skirmish: Exert this minion to make a [SAURON] or twilight minion strength +1 for each twilight minion you can spot.

Name: Dead Ones
